title: Trinity CEO Savage honored as LRW's Woman of the Year
summary: Jean Savage, CEO and President of Trinity Industries Inc., was recognized as the League of Railway Women's (LRW) "Railway Woman of the Year” for 2022. She is the first woman and non-family member to lead the $2 billion rail-car manufacturing and leasing company, introducing strategic plans, restructuring, and diversity programs. Savage is lauded for her transformational leadership, business acumen, and efforts to promote women in traditionally male-dominated industries, and is a strong advocate for diversity and inclusion within Trinity.

title: Terex Releases its 2023 Sustainability Report
summary: Terex Corporation has published its 2023 Sustainability Report, highlighting its commitment to sustainability across its products, operations, and team members. The report details efforts to reduce carbon emissions and environmental impact, while also featuring products that assist customers in achieving their own sustainability goals. Terex emphasizes its focus on long-term value creation through its sustainability initiatives.

title: Higher Prices Drive Procter & Gamble's Better-Than-Expected Earnings
summary: Procter & Gamble (PG) reported stronger-than-expected Q1 FY 2024 earnings, with sales up 6% and profit up 17% year-over-year, primarily driven by higher product prices. While some segments saw declining sales volume due to these price increases, the overall financial performance remained robust. The company's successful management of prices and margins has been crucial in navigating inflation, leading to a significant increase in gross margin for the quarter.

title: Steel mill hires consultant to stop oil spills (7 Algoma briefs) - Sault Ste. Marie News
summary: Algoma Steel Group Inc. has hired WSP Engineering to prevent future oil spills after an incident on June 9, 2022, discharged oil into the St. Marys River. The company's inaugural ESG report details spill prevention efforts and other key updates, including a contract extension with U.S. Steel, changes in employment levels due to the electric arc furnace project, slag pile carcinogenicity updates, Indigenous engagement, and local economic contributions.

title: Trimble and AGCO to Form Joint Venture to Better Serve Farmers Worldwide with Mixed Fleet Precision Agriculture Solutions
summary: Trimble and AGCO have announced a definitive agreement to form a joint venture aimed at better serving farmers with factory-fit and aftermarket applications in the mixed-fleet precision agriculture market. Trimble will contribute its precision agriculture business (excluding certain GNSS and guidance technologies) and receive $2 billion in pre-tax cash proceeds plus a 15% stake in the JV, while AGCO will contribute its JCA Technologies business. This transaction is expected to accelerate innovation, enhance Trimble's financial profile, and simplify its Connect and Scale strategy.

title: Albemarle and Caterpillar Collaborate to Pioneer Sustainable Mining Technologies and Operations
summary: Albemarle Corporation and Caterpillar Inc. have signed agreements to collaborate on sustainable mining solutions, focusing on establishing North America's first zero-emissions lithium mine at Kings Mountain, N.C. The collaboration includes deploying Cat battery-electric trucks, making Albemarle’s lithium available for Caterpillar battery production, and exploring joint research in battery cell technology and recycling. This partnership aims to advance sustainable mining operations and contribute to a resilient value chain for electrified equipment.

title: 5 Top Stocks in the Thriving Construction & Mining Equipment Industry
summary: The construction and mining equipment industry is experiencing a boom driven by infrastructure spending, solid mining demand, and easing supply-chain issues. This article highlights five top-performing stocks—Caterpillar Inc. (CAT), Komatsu (KMTUY), Terex Corporation (TEX), H&E Equipment Services (HEES), and Astec Industries, Inc. (ASTE)—that are well-positioned to capitalize on these trends through technological advancements and strategic initiatives.

title: Greenstone mine nears finish line
summary: The Greenstone mine, a joint venture between Equinox Gold Corp. (60%) and Orion Mine Finance Group (40%), is 85% complete and on track for its first gold pour in the first half of 2024. Located in Ontario, it is expected to be one of Canada's largest open-pit gold mines, averaging 400,000 oz. of gold per year for the first five years. The project remains on budget, with US$937 million of the US$1.23 billion construction budget already spent.

title: Who is David Bozeman, C.H. Robinson’s new CEO?
summary: David Bozeman has been appointed CEO of C.H. Robinson, becoming the ninth Black CEO on the Fortune 500 list. He brings over 30 years of experience in supply chain, transportation, and manufacturing services, aiming to leverage his expertise to drive the company's growth and enhance its digital and customer service offerings. Bozeman faces the challenge of addressing declining revenues and pressure from investors amidst a complex and evolving logistics industry.

title: People News: C.H. Robinson, Port NOLA
summary: C.H. Robinson has appointed Dave Bozeman as its new CEO and a member of its Board of Directors, effective June 26, 2023. Concurrently, Port NOLA announced Matthew Wypski as its new COO, succeeding Mike Stolzman. Both new appointees bring extensive experience from industry-leading companies to their respective roles.

title: C.H. Robinson Appoints Dave Bozeman as CEO
summary: C.H. Robinson Worldwide has appointed former Amazon and Ford Motor Co. executive Dave Bozeman as its new CEO, effective June 26. Bozeman brings extensive experience in supply chain, transportation, and manufacturing, having previously served leadership roles at Amazon.com Inc. and Ford. He replaces interim CEO Scott Anderson, who will continue as a board member after the transition.

title: Caterpillar reaffirms recent $1 million commitment to Purdue by establishing office at Convergence Center
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has formally opened an office at the Convergence Center in Discovery Park District at Purdue, solidifying its $1 million commitment to the Purdue Polytechnic Institute. This move establishes a permanent presence for Caterpillar near campus and supports the newly named Caterpillar Smart Foundry within the Purdue Polytechnic Smart Learning Factory. The collaboration aims to strengthen the relationship between Caterpillar and Purdue, fostering innovation and knowledge exchange.

title: State Street Industrial Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLI) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the State Street Industrial Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLI), including its stock price, holdings, dividend yield, and key financial metrics. As of November 27, 2025, XLI holds 79 stocks with a total value of $23.84 billion, and its top holdings include GE Aerospace, RTX Corp, and Caterpillar Inc. The ETF primarily invests in industrial companies, offering investors exposure to this sector.

title: The global rugged phones market was valued at US$ 2,982.21 million in 2023 and is expected to grow at a CAGR of 8.4% during the forecast period of 2023 to 2028 to reach US$ 4,457.88 million by 2028
summary: The global rugged phones market was valued at US$ 2,982.21 million in 2023 and is projected to reach US$ 4,457.88 million by 2028, growing at an 8.4% CAGR. The report highlights regional growth drivers, including technological adoption in North America, industrialization in Canada, and factory automation in Mexico. Asia Pacific is expected to be the fastest-growing region, fueled by automation, digitalization, and increased investments, while Europe's market is driven by high smartphone penetration and the demand for durable devices.

title: Fertilizer giant slashes HQ space with move to Northbrook
summary: CF Industries is cutting its headquarters space by more than half and relocating from Deerfield to Northbrook, reflecting the ongoing impact of remote work on office demand. The fertilizer giant will occupy 77,863 square feet in Northbrook, a significant reduction from its current 176,000 square feet in Deerfield. This move adds to a trend of companies downsizing office footprints, creating challenges for office landlords and contributing to record-high vacancy rates.

title: Baker Hughes Co. stock falls Wednesday, underperforms market
summary: Baker Hughes Co. (BKR) stock declined by 0.27% on Wednesday, closing at $30.05, despite a broader market slump where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones also fell. This marks the third consecutive day of losses for the company, falling $9.73 below its 52-week high. Despite the dip, Baker Hughes Co. outperformed some major competitors in the sector, whose shares experienced larger declines.

title: A disappointing quarter sends newest position Emerson Electric to the penalty box
summary: Emerson Electric (EMR) reported a disappointing fiscal first quarter, missing revenue and adjusted earnings estimates, leading to a 5% drop in shares and a downgrade by the Investing Club. The difficult quarter was attributed to a noisy reporting structure and soft guidance, largely due to stock-based compensation and the uncertainty surrounding a hostile takeover attempt of National Instruments (NATI). As a result, the Club has put EMR in the "penalty box" with a 2 rating, giving management one quarter to demonstrate improvement.

title: News | In Latest Office-to-Logistics Move, Industrial Firm Lands Deal To Buy Baxter HQ Campus Near Chicago
summary: Bridge Industrial has secured a deal to purchase Baxter International’s 101-acre headquarters campus in Deerfield, Illinois, signaling another major office-to-logistics conversion in the Chicago area. This move follows a national trend of redeveloping sprawling suburban office campuses into industrial space as office demand slackens and warehouse demand remains strong. The specific plans for Baxter's site and its future headquarters location are yet to be disclosed.

title: Interview: Tim M. Clerc, VP Engineering, Seacor Marine
summary: Tim M. Clerc, VP Engineering at Seacor Marine, discusses the company's significant investment in hybrid technology, viewing it as one of the most transformative developments in the maritime industry. Seacor Marine has brought nine hybrid vessels to market without subsidies and is awaiting its 10th, the Seacor Yangtze, highlighting the benefits of reduced fuel consumption and emissions. Clerc also shares practical insights for other shipowners considering hybrid conversions, emphasizing the importance of funding, space management, thorough planning, and strong partnerships.

title: Caterpillar Announces Investment in Lithos Energy Inc. to Further Battery Pack Development and Manufacturing
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced an investment in Lithos Energy, Inc., a U.S.-based lithium-ion battery technology company. This strategic investment aims to accelerate the development of Caterpillar's electrified product portfolio, supporting its commitment to lower-carbon advanced power technologies for hybrid and full-electric machines. Lithos Energy's expertise in manufacturing durable battery packs for demanding environments aligns with Caterpillar's goals for its heavy equipment.

title: Caterpillar Says Construction Equipment Remains in Demand, Boosting Sales, Profit
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported a 21% increase in quarterly sales due to strong demand for construction and mining equipment and engines, despite weakening consumer spending in other sectors. The company's sales growth, particularly in North America, allowed it to offset rising production costs and the impact of a stronger U.S. dollar by increasing prices. Dealers also added inventory to meet the rising customer demand.

title: Tocantinzinho Gold Project
summary: Torys LLP advised Franco-Nevada in a US$481 million project financing package for G Mining Ventures Corp.'s Tocantinzinho gold project in northern Brazil. The financing includes a US$250 million gold stream, a US$75 million secured term loan, and a US$27.5 million equity investment from Franco-Nevada, along with contributions from other strategic investors and equipment financing. This initiative supports the development of the construction-ready gold project in the Tapajos region.

title: Going Electric With John Deere
summary: John Deere is actively pursuing electrification solutions for off-highway equipment in response to growing regulatory pressure and market demand for sustainable options. The company has acquired a majority ownership in Kreisel Electric Inc., a battery technology provider specializing in high-durability electric battery modules, packs, and charging infrastructure. This strategic investment aims to accelerate the integration of battery-powered equipment across various segments, supporting John Deere's sustainability goals and offering competitive solutions to OEMs.

title: John Deere beat expectations last quarter, vows to break more records next year
summary: John Deere reported record profits of $2.25 billion last quarter and $7.13 billion for the fiscal year, driven by strong demand and catching up on parts orders. The company projects another record-breaking year for 2023, with anticipated earnings of $8 billion to $8.5 billion, as demand continues to outstrip supply, and it plans to increase large agricultural equipment production. Despite positive financial outlooks, the company is moving some production to Mexican factories, which will impact some Iowa positions.

title: Caterpillar to Move Global Headquarters to Texas From Illinois
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is relocating its global headquarters from its longtime Illinois base to Irving, Texas. This move aligns with a trend of major U.S. companies reassessing hiring and costs post-pandemic. The company stated the move would support its growth and was not driven by economic or tax incentives.

title: Caterpillar Works to Turn Old Engines Into New Profits
summary: Caterpillar is expanding its remanufacturing business to rebuild used engines from mining trucks and compactors and sell them as new. This initiative helps the company meet environmental goals and aims to boost revenue from services, potentially giving Caterpillar a competitive advantage. In 2021, the company reprocessed an estimated 127 million pounds of equipment through this program.

title: Caterpillar leaving Illinois, moving global headquarters from Illinois to Texas this year
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced its decision to relocate its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to its existing office in Irving, Texas, this year. Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby stated that this move aligns with the company's strategy for profitable growth and better serves its long-term strategic interests.

title: Caterpillar Settles Tax Dispute With IRS, Will Pay No Penalties
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has settled a years-long tax dispute with the Internal Revenue Service without incurring any penalties. The settlement resolves the tax treatment of profits earned by its Swiss subsidiary, Caterpillar SARL, from sales of replacement parts between 2007 and 2016. Analysts had previously estimated that Caterpillar could face over $2 billion in potential tax increases and penalties from the IRS.

title: Construction Demand Lifts Caterpillar Revenue as Order Backlog Grows
summary: Caterpillar's revenue is being boosted by strong construction demand in the U.S., but the company faces significant challenges due to ongoing supply-chain issues. These disruptions have caused an over 60% increase in order backlog to around $23 billion and raised shipping and manufacturing costs, leading to a decline in a key profit measure. The company is struggling to obtain necessary parts, pushing them to use more expensive shipping methods to meet customer demand.

title: Bank for Truckers: An Idea Once Scoffed at Finds Success
summary: Triumph Financial, formerly Triumph Bancorp, successfully rebranded to emphasize its move into fintech, serving over 12,000 truckers nationwide. CEO Aaron Graft established the bank to address the unique financial challenges faced by independent truckers, by purchasing invoices from those they haul for, totaling $24 billion annually. Despite initial skepticism from the traditional banking industry, Triumph Financial has grown significantly by focusing on this niche market and mitigating credit and fraud risks associated with the trucking industry.

title: Caterpillar Names New Chief Sustainability Officer
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the appointment of Dr. Lou Balmer-Millar as the new Chief Sustainability Officer, in addition to her current role as Senior Vice President of the Large Power Systems Division. She succeeds Julie Lagacy, who is retiring, and will report directly to Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby. This appointment emphasizes Caterpillar's continued focus on sustainability within its long-term growth strategy.

title: Terex all-electric bucket truck displayed at New York Stock Exchange
summary: Terex Utilities and Consolidated Edison showcased an all-electric bucket truck at the New York Stock Exchange as part of Terex’s Investor Day activities, highlighting Terex Utilities' innovation and growth positioning. This presentation underscored the company's commitment to fleet electrification and sustainability goals, with utilities like Con Edison already adopting the electric bucket trucks. The event followed Newsweek recognizing Terex as one of "America’s Most Responsible Companies," acknowledging its environmental, social, and corporate governance efforts.

title: Caterpillar Announces Collaboration with Luck Stone to Scale Autonomous Solutions to the Aggregates Industry
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced a collaboration with Luck Stone to deploy its autonomous solutions to Luck Stone's Bull Run Plant in Virginia, marking Caterpillar's first autonomous deployment in the aggregates industry. This partnership will expand Caterpillar's autonomous truck fleet to include the 100-ton-class Cat® 777 and tailor next-generation autonomous solutions for quarry and aggregate applications, aiming to enhance safety and productivity. The implementation of the Cat® MineStar™ Command for Hauling system on a fleet of 777G trucks is scheduled for 2024.

title: Newmont’s Boddington mine safely hauls more than 100mt autonomously using Cat MineStar
summary: Newmont's Boddington Mine in Western Australia has safely hauled over 100 million tonnes of material using Cat MineStar Command for hauling, marking a significant milestone for the gold industry's first autonomous haulage system. The mine invested $150 million in this project, converting 36 Cat 793F trucks to autonomous operation in a record seven months, aiming to improve safety, productivity, and extend the mine's life. This achievement highlights the successful collaboration between Caterpillar and Newmont, transforming mining operations.

title: Cat’s first battery-powered big mining truck
summary: Caterpillar recently demonstrated its first battery electric 793 large mining truck to its Early Learner partners, showcasing its capabilities on a 4.3-mile course and emphasizing its commitment to sustainability. The prototype achieved a top speed of 37 mph when fully loaded and regenerated energy on downhill grades, demonstrating its efficiency and potential for carbon-reduction goals. Caterpillar is also transforming its Tucson proving ground into a sustainable "mine site of the future" by integrating renewable energy sources.

title: The rebound is close to 50%! US industrial stocks are leveraging the door to new stock prices, while technology stocks are still struggling
summary: US industrial stocks have seen a significant rebound, with some constituent stocks of the Industrial Select Sector SPDR (XLI.US) reaching new highs, while technology stocks continue to struggle, being down nearly 30% for the year. This article highlights the strong performance of key industrial companies like Boeing Co and Caterpillar Inc, suggesting that investors may want to shift focus from struggling tech to these rebounding industrial sectors.

title: Caterpillar Recognizes Top Suppliers
summary: Caterpillar recently honored 150 top-performing suppliers at an event in Dallas, Texas. Awards were given in categories such as Supplier Excellence, Aftermarket Excellence, and Supplier of the Year, recognizing suppliers who met rigorous performance standards and achieved world-class certification. Pam Heminger highlighted the crucial role of this diverse supply network in Caterpillar's mission to help customers build a better, more sustainable world.

title: Caterpillar Successfully Demonstrates First Battery Electric Large Mining Truck and Its Hydrogen Storage and Fuel Cell Plans at Arizona Demonstration Site
summary: Caterpillar recently demonstrated its first battery-electric large mining truck along with its hydrogen storage and fuel cell plans at an Arizona demonstration site. This event highlights Caterpillar's advancements in sustainable mining solutions. The demonstration signifies a step towards electric and hydrogen-powered heavy machinery in the mining industry.

title: Caterpillar Successfully Demonstrates First Battery Electric Large Mining Truck and Invests in Sustainable Proving Ground
summary: Caterpillar Inc. successfully demonstrated its first battery-electric 793 large mining truck and announced a significant investment to transform its Arizona proving ground into a sustainable testing and validation hub. Key mining customers from its Early Learner program witnessed the demonstration, which validated the truck's performance and regeneration capabilities. The proving ground will become a "mine site of the future" utilizing renewable energy sources and advanced sustainability technology to help customers achieve carbon-reduction goals.

title: Caterpillar and Axenox strike intellectual property acquisition deal
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced an agreement to acquire the intellectual properties of two asphalt paving screed products, Oxclaw textured screed plates and Bullox modular screed plate system, from construction solutions supplier Axenox Inc. These innovative screed products, which improve mat density and reduce screed plate change time by up to 80%, will be exclusively available for Cat asphalt paving customers.

title: OSHA Fines Caterpillar for Safety Issues After Illinois Foundry Fatality
summary: OSHA has fined Caterpillar Inc. $145,027 for a willful safety violation at its Mapleton, Illinois foundry following a fatality where a worker fell into a vat of molten iron. The agency found that a lack of required safety guards or fall protection contributed to the death. Caterpillar stated it is deeply saddened by the incident and is engaging with OSHA to resolve the review, emphasizing that employee safety is its top priority.

title: Federal Investigation Says Caterpillar Employee Fell to Death in Molten Iron in Freak Accident
summary: A federal investigation by OSHA concluded that a Caterpillar employee, Steven Dierkes, died after falling into molten iron at the company's Mapleton foundry. OSHA cited Caterpillar Inc. for a willful violation and proposed fines of $145,027, stating that unprotected fall hazards routinely exposed employees. Caterpillar expressed sadness over the incident and stated its commitment to engaging with OSHA for a resolution.

title: Caterpillar Fined $145K in Connection with Death of Employee Who Fell Into Vat of Molten Iron
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has been fined $145,027 by OSHA following the death of an employee who fell into a vat of molten iron at its Illinois foundry. OSHA accused the company of failing to install required fall protection at the Mapleton job site, where 39-year-old Steve Dierkes suffered fatal burns. Dierkes had been working at the foundry for only nine days, and OSHA emphasized that his life could have been spared with proper safety measures.

title: Caterpillar fined $145K after worker falls into pot of molten iron and is ‘immediately incinerated,’ OSHA says
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is facing over $145,000 in fines from OSHA after an employee, Steven Dierkes, fell into a pot of molten iron and was "immediately incinerated." The agency's investigation found that the foundry exposed employees to unprotected fall hazards and failed to install guardrails. This incident marks the second death at the Mapleton foundry in six months, highlighting ongoing safety concerns.

title: Freak accident at Caterpillar foundry killed worker instantly
summary: A Caterpillar employee died instantly after falling into a pot of molten iron at the Mapleton Foundry in June. OSHA determined Caterpillar (NYSE: CAT) failed to provide adequate fall protection, citing the company with a willful violation and proposing fines of $145,027. The accident highlights repeated safety concerns at the facility, which annually produces 150,000 tons of cast iron engine components.

title: OSHA proposes fines against Caterpillar after worker fell into molten iron in June
summary: OSHA has proposed fines of $145,027 against Caterpillar Inc. following the death of Steven Dierkes, who fell into molten iron at a foundry in June. The investigation found that Caterpillar routinely exposed employees to unprotected fall hazards. This incident marks the second fatality at the Mapleton foundry in six months, with another worker, Scott Adams, dying in December.

title: Caterpillar employee ‘immediately incinerated’ after falling into pot of molten iron, OSHA says
summary: A Caterpillar employee died after falling into a pot of molten iron at a foundry in Mapleton, Illinois, just nine days into his new job. OSHA determined that the death could have been avoided if proper safety guards had been installed, citing Caterpillar Inc. for a willful violation and ordering a fine of $145,027. The agency found that the foundry regularly exposed employees to unprotected fall hazards near deep containers of molten iron.

title: Caterpillar Inc. faces $145,000 fine after employee fell to death in molten iron
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is facing a proposed fine of $145,027 from OSHA after an employee died from falling into molten iron at its Mapleton, Illinois foundry. An investigation by OSHA found that the facility lacked legally required guardrails and restraint systems, routinely exposing employees to fall hazards. Caterpillar has expressed condolences and stated its intention to engage with OSHA for a resolution.

title: The price of a worker’s life in America: OSHA fines Caterpillar $145,027 for “willful” safety violation that led to Steven Dierkes’ death
summary: OSHA fined Caterpillar $145,027 for a "willful" safety violation that resulted in the death of 39-year-old worker Steven Dierkes at its Mapleton, Illinois, foundry. Dierkes fell into a vat of molten iron maintained at over 2,000 degrees Fahrenheit, and officials stated Caterpillar failed to install required safety protections like guardrails. The article highlights the inadequacy of the fine, comparing it to Caterpillar's $50 billion revenue in 2021 and CEO Jim Umpleby III's $24 million compensation.

title: OSHA proposes fines against Caterpillar after worker death
summary: The federal Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) has proposed fines exceeding $145,000 against Caterpillar Inc. following the death of a worker who fell into molten iron at a foundry. The investigation found that the foundry routinely exposed employees to unprotected fall hazards near molten iron containers. Caterpillar has 15 business days to respond to the proposed penalties.

title: Caterpillar Raises Record $13.8 Million in United Way Campaign
summary: Caterpillar employees and retirees, along with the Caterpillar Foundation, pledged a record-breaking $13.8 million to United Way chapters across the United States, Mexico, Canada, and Panama for their 2022-2023 campaign. This marks a $1 million increase from 2021 and represents over 70 years of partnership between Caterpillar and United Way. The funds will support local communities and help improve lives globally, continuing a tradition that has raised over $200 million in the past two decades.

title: Doing the Work That Matters: How Manufacturing Makes a Difference
summary: Caterpillar celebrates Manufacturing Month by highlighting the impact of its production team and its legacy of innovation. The article details how Caterpillar's manufacturing efforts contribute to communities through job creation and infrastructure development, and how the company continues to innovate with advanced technologies like collaborative robots. It emphasizes Caterpillar's commitment to building a better, more sustainable world through its manufacturing operations.

title: Iridium Stock and the Starlink Threat
summary: This article examines Iridium Communications (IRDM) and the potential competitive threat posed by SpaceX's Starlink. It details Iridium's business model, financial performance, and market strategy, particularly in IoT, while analyzing how Starlink's broader and higher-bandwidth offerings could impact Iridium's various revenue segments and future growth prospects. The article concludes by questioning the long-term growth potential of Iridium given upcoming capital expenditure requirements and increasing competition.

title: Caterpillar CEO to continue in post after company waives retirement policy
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced that its board has waived the mandatory retirement policy for Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby, allowing him to continue in his role past age 65. This decision provides the board with greater flexibility in its CEO succession process. Umpleby, who has been with the company for 40 years and CEO since 2017, will continue leading Caterpillar after he turns 65 in February 2023.

title: Jim Umpleby to Continue as Caterpillar Chairman & CEO
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced that its Board of Directors has waived the mandatory retirement policy for Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby, allowing him to remain in his position beyond February 2023. The Board cited Umpleby's strong strategic and operating leadership as the reason for the decision, providing greater flexibility with the CEO succession process. Caterpillar, a leading manufacturer of construction and mining equipment, reported $51.0 billion in sales and revenues in 2021.

title: Caterpillar Expands Construction Industries Portfolio With Four Battery Electric Machines
summary: Caterpillar announced it will display four battery electric machine prototypes, including battery prototypes, at bauma 2022. These machines, including a mini excavator, medium excavator, and two wheel loaders, are part of Caterpillar's commitment to delivering solutions for customers' sustainability goals. The Caterpillar-designed batteries will also be available for other industrial applications and are engineered for scalability and sustainability throughout their lifecycle.

title: Virginia Company Keeps Clean Chips Flowing to International Paper Mill
summary: Jerry D. Rose Inc., a Virginia company specializing in chipping whole trees for paper production, has relied on Peterson chippers for over 20 years to supply clean chips to International Paper. The family-operated business, now run by Jerry's children Davis and Stephanie, emphasizes the durability of Astec Peterson machines and maintains a robust operation producing about 5,500 tons of chips weekly, along with affiliated businesses for fuel chips and trucking. They actively purchase timber and invest in advanced equipment while prioritizing employee safety and well-being.

title: The Caterpillar Foundation Celebrates 70 Years of Global Impact
summary: The Caterpillar Foundation is celebrating 70 years of global impact, having invested $851 million in initiatives ranging from workforce readiness and STEM education to disaster relief. Looking forward, the Foundation plans to continue prioritizing innovative and scalable solutions to global challenges, working with partners to build resilient and sustainable communities worldwide. Their efforts align with Caterpillar's core values and commitment to sustainability.

title: Newmont Announces Executive Leadership Appointments
summary: Newmont Corporation has announced several executive leadership appointments to strategic technical and operational roles. Aaron Puna will join as Executive Vice President and Chief Technology Officer in January 2023, while Mark Rodgers and Bernard Wessels will take on new senior regional leadership roles in October. These appointments aim to strengthen Newmont's technical, operational, and management capabilities globally.

title: Meet the Insider: Mallorie Brodie, CEO of Bridgit
summary: This article introduces Mallorie Brodie, CEO and Co-Founder of Bridgit, a construction technology company specializing in workforce planning. Brodie discusses the construction industry's labor challenges, her family's background in construction, and her passion for digital transformation to help solve these issues. She emphasizes Bridgit's customer-centric approach to product development and what readers can expect from her contributions as a Digital Builder Insider.

title: Power Solutions International selects CFO
summary: Power Solutions International Inc. (PSI) has appointed Xun (Kenneth) Li as its new CFO, succeeding interim CFO Matthew Thomas. Li brings over 20 years of experience in finance and accounting, having previously served as CFO for ND Paper and held various leadership roles at Caterpillar Inc. and Ford Motor Co. Interim CEO Dino Xykis expressed confidence that Li's expertise will contribute to PSI's strategic objectives and long-term profitable growth.

title: Caterpillar settles tax dispute with IRS that led to 2017 government raids
summary: Caterpillar announced a settlement with the U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS) regarding a long-standing tax dispute, which became public after federal raids in 2017. The agreement resolves all issues for tax years 2007 through 2016 without penalties, though the specific amount paid in back taxes was not disclosed. Caterpillar's SEC filing indicated that the settlement does not include tax increases based on "substance-over-form" judicial doctrines or any penalties.

title: Caterpillar settles long-running tax dispute with IRS
summary: Caterpillar has settled a long-running tax dispute with the IRS covering tax years 2007 through 2016, stemming from allegations of funneling U.S. profits through a Swiss subsidiary. The settlement's financial details were undisclosed, but Caterpillar stated it was within its gross unrecognized tax benefits, avoiding further disputes and penalties. This resolution follows years of federal scrutiny, including a grand jury subpoena and office raids, with a federal criminal probe reportedly halting in 2018.

title: BHP, Caterpillar, and Finning announce an agreement to replace entire haul truck fleet at Escondida Mine in Chile
summary: BHP, Caterpillar, and Finning have announced an agreement to replace the entire haul truck fleet at BHP's Escondida mine in Chile, the world's largest copper producer. The replacement will involve over 160 new Caterpillar 798 AC electric drive trucks, with deliveries beginning in the second half of 2023 and extending over 10 years. This initiative aims to improve efficiency, reliability, safety, and accelerate decarbonization, autonomy, and local capability development at the mine.

title: Take a Ride Through the 100-year History of EMD®
summary: The article celebrates the 100-year history of EMD®, a premier brand of diesel-electric locomotives now part of Progress Rail. It highlights EMD's innovations from its founding in 1922 and acquisition by General Motors, to its current focus on alternative fuel options like 100% biodiesel and battery-electric locomotives under Progress Rail. The piece emphasizes EMD's commitment to power, performance, and sustainability in the rail industry.

title: Republic Services of North Ohio celebrates over a year without an incident
summary: Republic Services' North Ohio team has achieved over a year without a reportable accident, a significant accomplishment given the challenging and unique nature of their 41 routes. This milestone is particularly noteworthy due to the extreme weather conditions and logistics involved, such as servicing Middle Bass Island in winter. GM Heather Brown shared insights into this achievement.

title: Top 20 Lift Truck Suppliers 2022
summary: This article details the Top 20 Lift Truck Suppliers for 2022, based on their 2021 worldwide revenue. It highlights a significant rebound in sales following the pandemic-constrained year of 2020, with aggregate revenue for the listed suppliers topping $50.9 billion, an 18.8% growth. The report also provides insights into market leaders, key developments, and growth trends within the lift truck industry, alongside the Industrial Truck Association's classification of lift trucks.

title: A New Jailbreak for John Deere Tractors Rides the Right-to-Repair Wave
summary: A hacker known as Sick Codes has developed a new jailbreak for John Deere tractors, allowing farmers root access to two popular models through their touchscreens. This exploit highlights the ongoing right-to-repair movement and its security implications, enabling farmers to perform necessary repairs and modifications to their equipment. While requiring physical access, the breakthrough emphasizes the need for full disk encryption as a potential solution for the manufacturer, pushing for greater farmer control over their machinery.

title: Building Value with Big Data
summary: Caterpillar is leveraging big data, machine learning, and advanced analytics to help customers increase uptime and operational efficiency by proactively managing machine and component health. Through tools like Cat Inspect and SIS 2.0, and "failure models," they can predict and prevent costly repairs, ultimately saving customers millions of dollars. This digital ecosystem fosters deeper relationships between dealers and customers, ensuring timely service and optimizing asset performance.

title: Loughborough University and Caterpillar reinforce strategic collaboration to accelerate innovative t | Media Centre
summary: Loughborough University and Caterpillar have renewed their strategic collaboration, which began over 25 years ago, to advance innovative technologies in the off-highway powertrain sector. This partnership, centered around the Innovation and Research Centre (IRC), aims to accelerate solutions for a sustainable future and has already yielded significant economic and environmental benefits, including a £26m project that reduced CO2 emissions and created jobs. Both parties are committed to another five years of research, innovation, and talent development within the heavy-duty vehicles sector.

title: US OPEN: Wall Street slips on rising US-China tensions
summary: Wall Street indexes started the day lower due to escalating US-China tensions following House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. Caterpillar (CAT.US) shares fell on disappointing quarterly results, while Uber (UBER.US), Simon Property Group (SPG.US), and Pinterest (PINS.US) saw premarket gains based on better-than-expected revenues or shareholder news despite mixed earnings or user declines.

title: Quaker Houghton aumenta la calidad en componentes metálicos
summary: Quaker Houghton, líder en fabricación de fluidos industriales, mejora la calidad de componentes metálicos en diversas industrias. Con más de 50 años en México y una planta en García, Nuevo León, la empresa ofrece tecnologías para todos los procesos del metal, desde el corte hasta el acabado superficial. Además, invierten en "fluid intelligence" para la digitalización y economía circular, apoyando los objetivos de la Industria 4.0.

title: Portland Community College, Caterpillar hope new training facility will help address enrollment, workforce challenges
summary: Portland Community College (PCC) and Caterpillar have opened a new Dealer Service Technology Building aimed at addressing both the skilled labor shortage in industries like agriculture and construction and the enrollment declines faced by community colleges. The facility, part of the two-year ThinkBIG program, will train students to become technicians for Caterpillar equipment, offering an authentic dealership training experience and connecting them to internships. This initiative is expected to help students secure high-demand jobs and demonstrates a shift in community college models towards hands-on, workforce-relevant education through industry partnerships.

title: Cat equipment, technologies, services to be displayed at Bauma 2022
summary: Caterpillar, through its dealer Zeppelin, will showcase over 70 pieces of Cat construction equipment, attachments, and power systems at Bauma 2022. The exhibit will highlight Caterpillar's technology including remote operation and productivity applications, as well as services like Customer Value Agreements and Rebuild options. Several electric models under development will also be unveiled, alongside next-generation mini hydraulic excavators, compact wheel loaders, and other construction machinery demonstrations.

title: Caterpillar releases new 336 hydraulic excavator
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has launched its new 336 hydraulic excavator, featuring a powerful hydraulic system and three engine modes to optimize performance and fuel efficiency. The excavator is designed for demanding applications, offering enhanced digging forces and swing torque, along with advanced technology for operator efficiency and reduced operating costs. It also includes features for operation in various climates and remote diagnostic capabilities.

title: NASCAR Technical Institute Celebrates 20 Years of Skilled Trades Training
summary: NASCAR Technical Institute (NASCAR Tech) is celebrating its 20th anniversary, marking two decades of providing skilled trades training in automotive, CNC machining, and welding. The institute has seen nearly 14,000 graduates and has expanded its offerings to include degree programs and an upcoming Robotics and Automation program in 2023. NASCAR Tech is the only technical training school endorsed by NASCAR and was recently named "Best Place to Work" in the "Best of Iredell" awards.

title: A shot and a goal: Caterpillar, NHL partner
summary: Caterpillar Inc. and the National Hockey League (NHL) announced a multiyear global sponsorship, naming Caterpillar the official heavy equipment and industrial power sponsor. This partnership, launching with the 2022-23 NHL season, aims to engage customers and employees while showcasing Cat products at NHL events. The collaboration also seeks to promote hockey in local communities through Caterpillar's dealer network.

title: “There was blood everywhere”: Former Caterpillar worker speaks out on lack of safety
summary: A former Caterpillar worker, Jon, speaks out on severe safety issues, a hostile work environment, and the inadequacy of the UAW. His testimony follows the death of Steven Dierkes at a Caterpillar foundry and reveals multiple incidents of neglect, including a worker losing an arm and another being fired for a motorcycle accident. Jon also details how the two-tier contract system fostered division and negatively impacted quality and worker protections.

title: Caterpillar uses Snowflake technology to create a consistent view of its data
summary: Caterpillar is leveraging Snowflake technology to build a consistent digital platform, enabling the company to develop data-led services for its customers. This approach helps Caterpillar manage vast amounts of data from its dealer network, allowing customers to use their products more efficiently and effectively. The collaboration with Snowflake, initiated in 2017, focuses on creating a unified data environment to support advanced analytics and future innovation.

title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Ties Exec Pay to Climate Targets
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) announced that a portion of its top executives' bonus pay will be linked to the management of value chain emissions, alongside mandatory climate training for leadership. This move is part of HPE's broader ESG initiatives, including accelerating its net-zero goal to 2040 and setting ambitious 2030 emissions reduction targets approved by the Science-based Target Initiative (SBTi). HPE is joining a growing trend of companies connecting executive compensation to ESG performance to drive sustainability.

title: Copper as an Inflation Hedge for Portfolios
summary: This article explores copper's role as an inflation hedge given its historical correlation with rising prices and its pervasive use across global industries. It details the current bullish case for copper driven by inflationary pressures, supply deficits, and increasing demand from the renewable energy transition, particularly in electric vehicles and infrastructure projects. The author highlights China's significant impact on future copper demand due to its ambitious green energy and EV plans.

title: Inclusion Meets Innovation
summary: Caterpillar's LGBTQIA+ employee resource group chair, Jenny, spearheaded an initiative with customer Newmont to paint a Cat® 793F Autonomous Mining Truck in rainbow colors at an Australian gold mine. This collaboration highlights a commitment to diversity and inclusion, making a visible statement of support for the LGBTQIA+ community and demonstrating how innovation and inclusion can intersect. The initiative showcases how Caterpillar's values align with customer success, promoting a culture of belonging for employees and partners.

title: Caterpillar Relocating Global Headquarters from Chicago to Irving
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is moving its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas, citing strategic interests for profitable growth. This move adds to the growing number of Fortune 500 companies in North Texas, specifically Irving-Las Colinas, due to its central location, favorable tax structure, and access to talent. The article also covers other real estate developments in the DFW area, including a new business park in Benbrook, the sale of Element Towers, and Shaquille O'Neal's relocation to Dallas.

title: Caterpillar and the National Hockey League Announce Multiyear Global Sponsorship
summary: Caterpillar Inc. and the National Hockey League (NHL) have announced a multiyear global sponsorship, naming Caterpillar the Official Heavy Equipment and Industrial Power Sponsor of the NHL. The partnership will begin in the 2022-23 NHL regular season and aims to engage customers and employees while providing brand visibility for Caterpillar through various NHL events and media platforms. Caterpillar will also collaborate with the NHL to provide behind-the-scenes products and services and promote hockey in local communities.

title: Caterpillar HQ leaving for Texas, decade after CEO warned Illinois
summary: Caterpillar is moving its corporate headquarters from Illinois to Irving, Texas, a decade after its former CEO warned state leaders about business losses due to an unbalanced budget, high workers’ compensation costs, and high taxes. This move makes Caterpillar the second major company to leave Illinois in five weeks, following Boeing. The decision was influenced by higher operating costs in Illinois, including a 26% higher cost of living in Deerfield compared to Irving, and the nation's highest combined state and local tax burden.

title: Caterpillar to relocate global headquarters from Illinois to Irving, Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced it will move its global headquarters from Illinois to Irving, Texas, transitioning in 2022. This relocation makes Texas home to 54 Fortune 500 corporate headquarters, according to Governor Greg Abbott's office. Despite the move, Illinois will remain the largest concentration of Caterpillar employees worldwide.

title: Caterpillar to move global headquarters from Illinois to Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced it is moving its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas. The company declined to state the reason for the move or if it received incentives, though Texas is known for lower labor costs and less stringent regulation. This relocation follows a trend of other major manufacturers, like Boeing and Tesla, moving headquarters to Texas from other states.

title: Caterpillar to move headquarters from Illinois to Texas
summary: Industrial conglomerate Caterpillar, Inc. announced it is moving its global headquarters from suburban Chicago, Illinois, to its existing office space in suburban Dallas, Texas. The move to Irving, Texas, will begin later this year and affects 230 employees, though the company will retain more employees in Illinois than in any other state. Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby stated the move is in the best strategic interest of the company, supporting its strategy for profitable growth.

title: Caterpillar to move headquarters to Texas, marking second major corporate departure from Illinois in 6 weeks
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is moving its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas, following Boeing's recent departure, making it the second major corporate relocation from Illinois in six weeks. The move will affect approximately 230 employees over time, though Illinois is expected to remain the largest concentration of Caterpillar employees worldwide with over 17,000 workers. While company and state officials expressed disappointment, the decision highlights a growing trend of corporate relocations, often driven by tax benefits and changing office work models.

title: Construction Manufacturer Caterpillar to Move Headquarters to Irving
summary: Caterpillar, a Fortune 100 construction and mining equipment manufacturer, has announced it is moving its global headquarters from a Chicago suburb to Irving, Texas. The company cites strategic interests and profitable growth as reasons for the move, establishing its new headquarters at Williams Square. This relocation will consolidate the Electric Power leadership and support teams, leveraging Irving's skilled workforce and global accessibility.

title: Pritzker, Republicans Spar Over Caterpillar's Decision to Move Global HQ From Illinois
summary: Illinois Republicans criticized Gov. J.B. Pritzker after Caterpillar announced its decision to move its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irvin, Texas. Pritzker countered that Illinois is still experiencing job growth and that the majority of Caterpillar's 17,000 employees will remain in the state. Texas Gov. Greg Abbott lauded the move, highlighting Texas's growing number of Fortune 500 corporate headquarters.

title: Caterpillar to move headquarters to Texas from Illinois in fresh blow to the Chicago area
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced it will relocate its global headquarters from Illinois to an existing divisional office in Irving, Texas. This move follows Boeing Co.'s departure last month and is considered to be in the company's best strategic interest. Caterpillar has maintained a presence in Texas since the 1960s.

title: Caterpillar relocating headquarters from Illinois to Texas
summary: Caterpillar is moving its corporate headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas, four years after relocating from Peoria. The move, effective this year, is aimed at supporting profitable growth and attracting new talent, according to Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby. Despite the relocation of headquarters staff, Illinois will remain home to Caterpillar's largest concentration of employees and manufacturing plants.

title: Caterpillar To Move Global Headquarters From Illinois to North Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is relocating its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, North Texas, citing strategic company interests and a strong talent pool in the region. The move leverages Caterpillar's existing presence in Texas, including its Electric Power division in Irving, and aims to support the company's growth strategy. While 230 employees are expected to move, Illinois will remain the largest concentration of Caterpillar employees.

title: Caterpillar Moving Corporate HQ From Illinois to Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is moving its corporate headquarters from Illinois to Irving, Texas, expanding an office established in 2021. The move is expected to bring 240 office employees to the Dallas area by 2023, though manufacturing operations and the majority of Illinois jobs will remain unchanged. This relocation follows other major construction-related firms moving to North Texas and is supported by Texas Governor Greg Abbott, citing the state's lack of income tax as an incentive.

title: Caterpillar to Relocate Global Headquarters to Dallas-Fort Worth Area
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced its decision to move its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to its existing office in Irving, Texas. This strategic move aims to support the company's profitable growth strategy and will begin transitioning in 2022. Illinois will continue to house the largest concentration of Caterpillar employees worldwide.

title: Caterpillar announces plans to relocate global headquarters to Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced its plans to relocate its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas. Texas Governor Greg Abbott celebrated the move, noting it brings the total number of Fortune 500 corporate headquarters in Texas to 54. Caterpillar, with $51 billion in sales and revenues in 2021, plans to begin transitioning its headquarters to Irving this year.

title: Caterpillar to move global headquarters to Texas
summary: Caterpillar announced its decision to move its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas. This move marks the end of the company's century-long presence in Illinois and follows a similar relocation by aerospace giant Boeing. Most of Caterpillar's 230 employees based in Illinois are expected to transition to the new headquarters over time.

title: Caterpillar, a $51 billion construction equipment company, is relocating to North Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc., a $51 billion construction equipment company, is relocating its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas. This move, which supports Caterpillar's strategy for profitable growth, will begin later this year. Texas Governor Greg Abbott praised the decision, noting that Texas continues to attract Fortune 500 companies.

title: Caterpillar Inc. to Move Global Headquarters Out of Chicago Area, Into Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced it will move its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas, later this year. This move, which comes after a previous relocation from Peoria to Deerfield in 2017, is intended to support the company's strategy for profitable growth. Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker expressed disappointment but affirmed continued support for the remaining 17,400 Caterpillar employees in Illinois.

title: Caterpillar Moving Global Headquarters From Deerfield To Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is moving its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas, part of the Dallas-Fort Worth area, starting this year. This move comes five years after the company relocated its headquarters to Deerfield from Peoria. The company believes this strategic relocation supports its goal for profitable growth, although Illinois will remain the largest concentration of Caterpillar employees worldwide.

title: Caterpillar headquarters leaving Illinois after nearly 100 years
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is moving its global headquarters from Deerfield, Illinois, to Irving, Texas, after nearly 100 years in its home state. The construction equipment manufacturer previously moved its base from Peoria, Illinois, to Deerfield in 2017. This move follows a trend of major corporations, including Boeing and several tech companies, relocating headquarters to Texas.

title: Caterpillar relocates headquarters from Chicago area to Irving
summary: Industrial giant Caterpillar Inc. is moving its global headquarters from suburban Chicago to Irving, Texas. The company, which already has 120 employees in Irving, cited strategic interests, talent attraction, and the business-friendly environment of North Texas as key reasons for the relocation. This move will make Caterpillar the fifth-largest public company headquartered in North Texas and adds to the region's growing list of Fortune 500 company headquarters.

title: Great Lakes Exercises Option to Build Second Hopper Dredge
summary: Great Lakes Dredge & Dock Corporation has exercised its option to build a second 6,500-cubic-yard-capacity trailing suction hopper dredge at Conrad Shipyard. This new vessel will be identical to the Galveston Island and is expected to be delivered in the first quarter of 2025, reinforcing Great Lakes' investment in its dredging fleet and commitment to the U.S. dredging market.

title: Caterpillar Inc. Increases Dividend
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE: CAT) announced an 8% increase in its quarterly cash dividend, raising it by nine cents to $1.20 per share, payable on August 19, 2022. This decision reflects the company's strong balance sheet and free cash flow generation, continuing its 28-year history of increasing annual dividends and membership in the S&P 500 Dividend Aristocrat Index. Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby stated intentions to return substantially all Machinery, Energy & Transportation free cash flow to shareholders.

title: Dallas Invents: 113 Patents Granted for Week of May 3
summary: Dallas-Fort Worth ranked No. 13 for patent activity out of 250 metros with 113 patents granted for the week of May 3. The article highlights key patents granted to companies like Amazon, American Airlines, Capital One, and Samsung, across various classifications such as human necessities, operations & transport, chemistry & metallurgy, fixed constructions, mechanical engineering, physics, and electricity. It also lists top assignees and local inventors, showcasing the region's inventive activity.

title: Transforming the Future of Mining
summary: Caterpillar is actively transforming the future of mining by focusing on sustainable, productive, and safe solutions crucial for the global energy transition. The company collaborates with customers to develop electrification, alternative fuels, and advanced automation technologies, exemplified by partnerships with Nouveau Monde Graphite, Rio Tinto, BHP, and Newmont for zero-emission mining fleets and systems. Caterpillar's commitment to innovation extends to engineering more sustainable products like battery-electric loaders and autonomous water trucks to meet the industry's evolving needs.

title: Building Infrastructure Around the World
summary: Caterpillar has been instrumental in global infrastructure development for a century, supporting projects from the U.S. Interstate Highway System to modern-day large-scale investments aimed at sustainability and economic growth. The company provides equipment and services for major infrastructure projects worldwide, including expressways in India, a new airport in the Philippines, and high-speed railways in Malaysia and the U.K.

title: Caterpillar to Launch Demonstration Project Using Hydrogen-Fueled Combined Heat and Power System
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced a three-year demonstration project with District Energy St. Paul to evaluate a hydrogen-fueled combined heat and power (CHP) system. This initiative, supported by the U.S. Department of Energy and National Renewable Energy Laboratory, aims to provide sustainable power solutions and help customers meet climate-related goals. The project builds on Caterpillar's extensive experience with high-hydrogen fuel and its existing hydrogen-capable power generation offerings.

title: Caterpillar to Sponsor Major League Soccer
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced a multi-year sponsorship with Major League Soccer (MLS) to broaden its brand audience in the U.S. and Canada, targeting millennials and multicultural fans. This partnership aims to engage the next generation of employees and customers by integrating Cat products into the soccer ecosystem and providing exclusive experiences for dealers and their families. The initiative also includes collaboration on content like Cat Trials 12, featuring FIFA legend DaMarcus Beasley.

title: Caterpillar looking to hire 50 in new divisional office in Las Colinas
summary: Caterpillar is establishing a new divisional office in Las Colinas and plans to hire 50 employees for this location. Jason Kaiser, Electric Power division vice president, highlighted the new hub's role for the division and a few others. The article also touches upon related topics concerning the construction industry and other company relocations to the DFW area.

title: Caterpillar eyes energy transition as growth driver for mining business
summary: Caterpillar Inc. anticipates that the global clean energy transition will significantly boost its mining business due to increased demand for critical minerals. CEO Jim Umpleby projects a $5 trillion market for energy transition infrastructure between 2021 and 2040, leading to higher mining capital expenditures and a need for more mining equipment. The company's financials for Q1 2022 already show an increase in capital expenditures, and its board approved a new $15 billion stock repurchase.

title: Caterpillar Highlights Services and Energy Transition Growth Opportunities at 2022 Investor Day
summary: Caterpillar Inc. hosted its 2022 Investor Day, focusing on services, technology, and sustainability as key growth drivers. The company highlighted achieving its adjusted operating profit margin targets and generating strong ME&T free cash flow since 2017. Caterpillar expects higher long-term sales growth due to the energy transition and plans to return substantially all free cash flow to shareholders, including a new $15 billion stock repurchase authorization.

title: Caterpillar 2021 Diversity & Inclusion Report Highlights Progress with Growth in Diverse Populations
summary: Caterpillar Inc. released its 2021 Diversity & Inclusion Report and a new diversity and inclusion website, highlighting its commitment to fostering a rich culture of inclusion. The report details significant progress made in 2021 regarding diverse representation and talent strategies. Caterpillar emphasizes that a diverse team and inclusive culture are crucial for innovation, performance, and meeting evolving customer needs.

title: Caterpillar Acquires Tangent Energy Solutions
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has acquired Tangent Energy Solutions, a U.S.-based energy-as-a-service (EaaS) company, marking another expansion in Caterpillar's energy industry portfolio. Tangent Energy provides solutions for reducing energy costs and emissions, increasing efficiency, and monetizing grid support through its software, and will operate under Caterpillar's Electric Power Division. Caterpillar, with 2021 sales and revenues of $51 billion, continues to be a major player in construction and mining equipment.

title: Caterpillar | Caterpillar Updates Enterprise Strategy with Focus on Sustainability, Reports One-Year Progress on 2030 Sustainability Goals
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has updated its enterprise strategy to focus on sustainability, reporting significant progress on its 2030 sustainability goals. The company announced it will begin disclosing Scope 3 greenhouse gas emissions in 2023 and enhance sustainability reporting using the TCFD framework. Additionally, Caterpillar's Board of Directors has restructured to include a new Sustainability and other Public Policy Committee to strengthen oversight of ESG issues.

title: Agricultural equipment maker AGCO reports ransomware attack
summary: Agricultural equipment manufacturer AGCO announced on Friday that it was hit by a ransomware attack this week, affecting some of its production facilities. The company, which had over $11 billion in sales last year, is investigating the extent of the attack and anticipates business operations will be adversely affected for several days or longer. This incident comes amidst warnings from the FBI to the U.S. agricultural sector about potential attacks, echoing a 2021 alert regarding BlackMatter ransomware targeting agricultural companies.
source: The Record from Recorded Future News
source_domain: The Record from Recorded Future News

title: CVX, CAT, BNSF Hydrogen Locomotive Demo
summary: Caterpillar's Progress Rail, BNSF Railway Company, and Chevron U.S.A. Inc. have signed a memorandum of understanding to advance the demonstration of a hydrogen fuel cell-powered locomotive. This initiative aims to confirm the feasibility and performance of hydrogen as a lower-carbon alternative to traditional fuels for line-haul rail service. The project involves Progress Rail designing a prototype, Chevron developing fueling infrastructure, and BNSF demonstrating the locomotive on its lines.

title: Caterpillar sees China excavator demand falling below pre-pandemic levels
summary: Caterpillar Inc. warned that demand for excavators in China, one of its largest markets, could fall below pre-pandemic levels in 2022 due to strict pandemic lockdowns impacting construction activity. Despite this, the company saw overall sales rise across other regions, benefiting from price hikes and increased mining and construction activity, leading to adjusted profit and revenue figures that beat analyst expectations for the first quarter. Caterpillar anticipates that announced price increases will more than offset higher manufacturing costs this year.

title: Caterpillar Says Supply-Chain Challenges Aren’t Improving
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported continued strong demand for its heavy equipment due to robust construction activity, but supply-chain challenges, particularly for components like semiconductors, are not improving. Despite a 14% revenue increase to $13.59 billion in Q1 and a growing order backlog, rising costs for materials outpaced price increases during the quarter, though the company expects this to even out for the full year. Caterpillar's shares saw a slight decline in premarket trading even as profits rose and adjusted earnings beat analyst forecasts.

title: Glover shares experience, advice with engineering students
summary: Matt Glover, a Senior Engineering Project Team Leader at Caterpillar, Inc., returned to Mizzou Engineering to share career advice with students. He emphasized the importance of listening, giving/receiving feedback, continuous learning, and treating others well. Glover also highlighted Caterpillar's autonomous product achievements and his role in recruiting Mizzou students.

title: Trimble: Grading smooth as butter
summary: Buesing Corp. utilized Trimble's Earthworks Grade Control Platform and GCS900 system to efficiently excavate and grade a landfill project in Arizona, facing challenging conditions and strict deadlines. The integration of advanced machine control technology has significantly improved productivity, accuracy, and safety on their jobsites, particularly for complex urban excavations. This adoption highlights the evolution and increasing sophistication of grading technology in construction.

title: Nouveau Monde Graphite Provides a Quarterly Update and Releases its Annual Report – Disciplined Execution of the Company’s Business Plan
summary: Nouveau Monde Graphite (NMG) has released its year-end financial results for 2021, showcasing significant progress towards completing its Phase-1 facilities and advancing its Phase-2 commercial scale-up. The company is nearing completion of its 2,000-tonnes-per-annum integrated graphite production line for anode material and is actively defining the economic model for its Phase 2 while engaging with potential customers and financial partners. NMG also highlights its commitment to ESG principles, carbon-neutral operations, and sustainability in its production of advanced graphite materials for the electric vehicle and renewable energy sectors.

title: Cummins moves its operations to Mexico
summary: Cummins announced an investment of US$11 million to transfer engine manufacturing operations from the United States to its San Luis Potosí plant in Mexico. This move will enable the production of ISM11 and QSX15 engines to supply global markets, generating 50 new direct jobs with 30 more projected. The relocation aligns with USMCA requirements and marks a return to engine manufacturing for Cummins' New and ReCon plant in Mexico.

title: Tutor Perini / Brosamer & Wall Works On $187M Project to Restore Capacity at Friant-Kern Canal
summary: A joint venture between Tutor Perini and Brosamer & Wall has commenced a $187 million project to restore capacity along a 10-mile portion of the Friant-Kern Canal in central California, addressing damage caused by land subsidence. The project involves significant earthwork, concrete pouring, and the use of advanced technology like GPS-equipped excavators and drone photogrammetry. Expected to be fully operational by September 2024, this initiative aims to restore critical water deliveries to agricultural regions and communities in the San Joaquin Valley.

title: Caterpillar Suspends Operations At Russian Manufacture Facilities
summary: Caterpillar, Inc. announced the suspension of its manufacturing operations in Russia due to supply chain disruptions and sanctions following the conflict in Ukraine. The Deerfield-headquartered company also committed over $1 million through the Caterpillar Foundation to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine. Caterpillar, with $51 billion in 2021 sales, stated it is complying with all applicable laws and sanctions while supporting its employees.

title: Caterpillar, Deere Join Firms Suspending Business in Russia
summary: Deere & Co. and Caterpillar Inc. have suspended their business operations in Russia following the invasion of Ukraine. Deere halted shipments of farm equipment to Russia and Belarus two weeks prior, while Caterpillar suspended operations at its plants due to supply chain disruptions and sanctions, further isolating the country from the global economy.

title: Caterpillar Foundation Supports Urgent Humanitarian Needs for the Ukrainian People
summary: The Caterpillar Foundation is donating over $1 million to support urgent and long-term humanitarian needs in Ukraine, working with the American Red Cross, Project Hope, and the Center for Disaster Philanthropy. This donation will provide essential relief like water, food, medical supplies, and housing. Additionally, the Foundation is matching employee donations 2:1, amplifying global support for the crisis.

title: Caterpillar suspends operations in Russia
summary: Caterpillar announced it is suspending operations in Russia due to increasing challenges, including supply chain disruptions and sanctions following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The company is also donating over $1 million through the Caterpillar Foundation to support the Ukraine crisis and is complying with all sanction laws. There is no information available on the number of employees affected by this closure.

title: Building Begins on Support Vessel for Orsted, Eversource Wind Farms
summary: Ørsted, Eversource, and Edison Chouest Offshore (ECO) have commenced construction on the first Jones Act-qualified wind farm service operations vessel (SOV) in the United States, named ECO EDISON. This vessel, built across multiple states and scheduled for delivery in 2024, will support the operation and maintenance phases of the South Fork Wind, Revolution Wind, and Sunrise Wind projects. It signifies a crucial step in the growth of America's offshore wind industry, creating jobs and advancing clean energy.

title: Cummins says expects 'some impact' in Russia; Deere says to abide by sanctions
summary: Cummins Inc. anticipates "some impact" on its business in Russia due to current and expected sanctions following the invasion of Ukraine. Similarly, Deere & Co. stated it would fully comply with U.S. and international sanctions, impacting its significant investments in Russia. Shares of Cummins were down in late afternoon trading, reflecting investor reactions to the sanctions.

title: Sify Technologies: Simplifies digital adoption
summary: Sify Technologies, an Indian ICT services company, has been led by CEO Kamal Nath for a decade, focusing on digital adoption for enterprises with cloud@core at the heart of its products and services. The company, founded in 1995, transitioned from a consumer-facing business to a 100% enterprise-focused model, proving its resilience and adaptability in the face of technological disruptions and global challenges like COVID-19. Sify leverages partnerships with global technology majors and investments in infrastructure to continually innovate and remain relevant to its diverse customer base.

title: 500+ Autonomous Trucks Operating Worldwide With Cat® Command for Hauling
summary: Caterpillar announced a significant milestone of over 500 Cat® autonomous trucks operating worldwide, primarily in the mining industry, with plans to expand into quarry/aggregates and construction. These driverless trucks have safely hauled over 4 billion tonnes and traveled more than 145 million kilometers, demonstrating up to 30% improved performance and increased safety compared to operator-driven trucks. Caterpillar has been investing in autonomous development for decades, showcasing its commitment to innovation and future-proofing the mining and other heavy industries.

title: Tejon Ranch: Land Steward Provides Housing, Jobs, Conservation
summary: Tejon Ranch, a publicly traded company on the NYSE (TRC), is highlighted for its role in providing housing, jobs, and conservation efforts in California. The 270,000-acre ranch, strategically located near Los Angeles and Bakersfield, develops master-planned communities and commercial centers while emphasizing sustainability and land stewardship. This article from the California Chamber of Commerce is part of a series profiling member companies contributing to the state's economic strength.

title: Huge Demand at Caterpillar, But Global Supply Constrains
summary: Caterpillar experienced a significant surge in sales in its fourth quarter of 2022, with sales climbing 23% to $13.8 billion, exceeding Wall Street expectations. Despite strong demand for construction equipment, particularly in the U.S. economy which saw its fastest growth since 1984, the company faced ongoing global supply chain disruptions, including semiconductor shortages, which constrained product availability and depressed stock. Executives noted strong end-user demand except in China, while overall full-year profits more than doubled.

title: Caterpillar sales soar, warns of margin pressure
authors: Bianca Flowers and Uday Sampath Kumar
summary: Caterpillar Inc. exceeded Wall Street revenue estimates in the fourth quarter with a 20% increase but warned of potential margin pressure in the current quarter due to higher production and labor costs. Despite forecasting price hikes to mitigate these costs and strong public spending boosting demand, supply chain constraints are expected to weigh on operating margins in the first quarter before improving later in the year. Shares fell 6% following the warning.

title: Caterpillar to Supply Locomotives to Union Pacific Railroad, Supporting Investment in World’s Largest Battery-Electric Locomotive Fleet
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced that its subsidiary, Progress Rail, will supply 10 battery-electric EMD Joule® locomotives to Union Pacific Railroad. This purchase marks the largest investment in battery-electric technology by a U.S. Class I railroad and will contribute to Union Pacific's goal of reaching net-zero emissions by 2050. The locomotives, which produce zero exhaust emissions, will be manufactured in Indiana and delivered in late 2023 and early 2024 for testing in California and Nebraska rail yards.

title: Platinum Equity and Ball Corporation Complete Sale of Ball Metalpack to Sonoco for $1.35 Billion
summary: Platinum Equity and Ball Corporation have completed the sale of Ball Metalpack to Sonoco for approximately $1.35 billion. This transaction follows a three-year transformation program by Platinum Equity and Ball Corporation, during which Ball Metalpack was established as a standalone enterprise and operational improvements were implemented, including significant investments in manufacturing infrastructure. Platinum Equity Partner Louis Samson highlighted the successful partnership with Ball Corporation in delivering value.

title: Caterpillar Inc. stock rises Monday, still underperforms market
summary: Caterpillar Inc. stock edged up 0.11% on Monday, closing at $214.33, despite the broader market seeing positive gains. The stock remains $32.36 below its 52-week high and showed mixed performance against competitors like Deere & Co., General Electric Co., and Cummins Inc. Additionally, trading volume for CAT exceeded its 50-day average.

title: Contractor Dies in Fall at Caterpillar Foundry in Illinois
summary: A contractor, Scott M. Adams, 50, died after falling 20 feet at a Caterpillar Inc. foundry in Mapleton, Illinois. Authorities believe he stepped off a ladder. The incident is under investigation by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration and the Peoria County sheriff's office.

title: Contractors dies in fall at Caterpillar foundry in Illinois
summary: A contractor died after falling 20 feet through a hole in the floor at a Caterpillar Inc. foundry in Mapleton, Illinois. The 50-year-old man, Scott M. Adams, was working for Shaefer Electric at the time of the incident. Authorities believe he stepped off a ladder before the fatal fall, and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration is investigating.

title: ID released for East Peoria contractor who died in fall at Caterpillar foundry in Mapleton
summary: A 50-year-old East Peoria contractor, Scott M. Adams, died after falling 20 feet through a hole in the floor at Caterpillar Inc.'s Mapleton foundry. The incident occurred on Thursday, December 23, and is currently under investigation by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and the Peoria County Sheriff's Office. Adams was working for Shaefer Electric, and Caterpillar has expressed deep sadness over the accident.

title: Caterpillar, BNSF and Chevron inks MoU for H2-fuel cells powered locomotive demonstration
summary: Caterpillar, BNSF Railway Company, and Chevron U.S.A. Inc. have signed an MOU to demonstrate a hydrogen fuel cell-powered locomotive, aiming to confirm its feasibility and performance as a lower-carbon alternative to traditional fuels for line-haul rail. Progress Rail will design and build the prototype, Chevron will develop the fueling infrastructure, and BNSF will demonstrate the locomotive on its lines. This collaboration represents a significant step towards advancing hydrogen technology in heavy-duty transport and exploring a commercially viable hydrogen economy.

title: Catastrophic Engine Damage Led to OSV Fire -NTSB
summary: The NTSB determined that catastrophic engine damage caused a fire aboard the U.S.-flagged offshore supply vessel Ocean Intervention near Honolulu on December 19, 2020.
