No injuries or pollution occurred thanks to the crew's quick actions to contain the fire, which caused over $3 million in damages. The probable cause was a connecting rod bearing adhering to the crankshaft, and the operating company has since implemented preventative measures for its fleet.

title: Eos Energy Enterprises Appoints Randall Gonzales CFO
summary: Eos Energy Enterprises, Inc. announced the appointment of Randall ("Randy") B. Gonzales as Chief Financial Officer, succeeding Sagar Kurada who will resign on January 11, 2022. Gonzales brings extensive experience from Lydall, Inc., Caterpillar's Rail Division, and Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. The CEO, Joe Mastrangelo, praised Gonzales's track record and expressed gratitude to Kurada for his contributions in taking Eos public.

title: Giant self-driving, electric haulers coming to Colorado gold mine
summary: Newmont is investing $100 million in a partnership with Caterpillar to develop self-driving, electric haulers for its gold mine in Cripple Creek, Colorado. This initiative aims to create an emissions-free system for the mine. Newmont previously became the first to use self-driving trucks in its Colorado gold mine and is now expanding its use of autonomous technology.

title: Brunswick Corp. to Expand Mexico Facility
summary: Brunswick Corp. announced plans to expand its Reynosa, Mexico, manufacturing facility by 150,000 square feet, aiming to boost production by nearly 60 percent to meet high demand for its products. This expansion is part of Brunswick's strategy to increase capacity and vertical integration across its operations, including creating over 600 jobs in the Reynosa community. The project is expected to be completed in late 2023.

title: CATL and Canadian Solar subsidiary CSI Solar to collaborate on battery storage, 'innovative renewable energy tech'
summary: CSI Solar, a subsidiary of Canadian Solar, has signed a strategic cooperation agreement with CATL to collaborate on battery energy storage system (BESS) solutions, lithium-ion battery supply, and O&M services. This partnership aims to leverage CATL's innovative battery technology and Canadian Solar's global reach to meet the increasing demand for battery storage in achieving net-zero emissions goals. Canadian Solar has a significant battery storage pipeline, including 2.9GWh under construction, reinforcing the strategic importance of this collaboration.

title: With UAW strike concluded, Deere reports record profits
summary: John Deere announced record profits for the fiscal year ending November 1, totaling $5.96 billion, despite a five-week UAW strike and ongoing supply chain issues. The company surpassed Wall Street expectations and projects another record year in 2022, driven by strong demand in agricultural and construction equipment, precision agriculture, and favorable market conditions. Deere is also passing increased costs from supply challenges and the new UAW contract onto customers and raised prices in 2021.

title: Great Lakes Dredge & Dock gets Houston Ship Channel dredging contract
summary: Great Lakes Dredge & Dock Corp. has secured a $92.5 million contract for the first phase of the Houston Ship Channel Widening and Improvement Project 11, a multi-phase billion-dollar expansion. This project aims to widen a 11½-mile section of the channel from 530' to 700', allowing safer navigation for larger container and petrochemical ships to the Port of Houston. The company is also investing $4.5 million in emissions upgrades for its dredging equipment to reduce NOx and particulate matter, and will beneficially use dredged material to create a new island for bird habitat and oyster mitigation.

title: Ballard, Caterpillar And Microsoft To Produce Back-up Power For Data Centres
summary: Ballard Power Systems, Caterpillar Inc., and Microsoft have launched a three-year collaboration to demonstrate a 1.5 MW hydrogen fuel cell power system for data center backup. This project, supported by the U.S. Department of Energy and the National Renewable Energy Lab, aims to provide reliable, sustainable backup power with significantly reduced emissions. The demonstration will take place at a Microsoft data center in Quincy, Washington.

title: Ballard teams up with Caterpillar & Microsoft to demonstrate megawatt-scale hydrogen fuel cell backup generator system for datacenters
summary: Ballard Power Systems, in collaboration with Caterpillar Inc. and Microsoft, has launched a three-year project to demonstrate a megawatt-scale hydrogen fuel cell backup generator system for data centers. This initiative, supported by the U.S. Department of Energy, aims to develop a 1.5 MW backup power system with significantly reduced emissions compared to current diesel systems. The project will provide insights into scaling fuel cell technology for multi-megawatt data centers, leveraging low-carbon-intensity hydrogen.

title: Nouveau Monde Provides Corporate Update on the Development of its Mine-to-Market Battery Material Business
summary: Nouveau Monde Graphite Inc. (NMG) is progressing with its mine-to-market battery material business, aiming to become a fully vertically integrated supplier of anode material. The company has completed construction of its phase-1 Bécancour purification facility, producing high-purity spherical purified graphite, and is advancing civil works at its Matawinie mining project. NMG is also actively engaged in commercial discussions for long-term supply agreements and is committed to sustainable, carbon-neutral operations to meet escalating market demand for anode materials.

title: 3M inks 410K sf lease renewal for DeKalb distribution center
summary: Industrial giant 3M signed a 12-year lease renewal for a 410,000-square-foot distribution center in DeKalb, Illinois, making it one of the largest industrial lease transactions in the state for Q4. The renewal, with landlord Modiv, will commence in August 2022 and highlights the growing demand for warehouse space driven by e-commerce expansion. The facility is crucial for storing and exporting 3M products globally, with two additional 3M warehouses located nearby.

title: Caterpillar to introduce battery-electric and autonomous haulage tech at Newmont ops
summary: Newmont has formed a strategic alliance with Caterpillar Inc to implement a fully connected, automated, zero-carbon mining system. This collaboration aims to introduce first-of-a-kind battery-electric haulage technology and automation at Newmont's Cripple Creek and Victor and Tanami mines, supporting Newmont's goal of achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and investing $100 million in initial automation and electrification efforts.

title: Newmont and Caterpillar Announce Revolutionary Strategic Alliance to Achieve Zero Emissions Mining
summary: Newmont Corporation and Caterpillar Inc. have formed a strategic alliance to create a fully connected, automated, zero carbon emitting, end-to-end mining system, aiming to achieve zero emissions mining. This partnership, involving an initial $100 million investment from Newmont, will focus on deploying battery electric autonomous haulage fleets in both surface and underground operations, supporting Newmont's goal of net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. The alliance plans to introduce automated and electric haulage technologies at Newmont's Cripple Creek and Victor mine in Colorado and Tanami mine in Australia, with targets for deployment of first-of-a-kind battery electric vehicles by 2026-2027.

title: Newmont and Caterpillar Announce Revolutionary Strategic Alliance to Achieve Zero Emissions Mining
summary: Newmont Corporation and Caterpillar Inc. have formed a strategic alliance to develop a fully connected, automated, zero carbon emitting, end-to-end mining system. This partnership aims to help Newmont achieve its 2030 greenhouse gas emissions reduction target of over 30% and net-zero carbon by 2050, building on an initial investment of $100 million from Newmont. The collaboration will focus on deploying battery-electric haulage technology and autonomous systems at Newmont's Cripple Creek & Victor mine in Colorado and Tanami mine in Australia.

title: CISO Academy - Cyber Security Training for C-Level
summary: CISO Academy offers a global education program from Check Point Software, designed for C-Level Executives to master cybersecurity practices and balance tactical issues with strategic leadership. The program provides world-class instructors, high-quality remote training, and globally-recognized certifications from organizations like ISACA and ISC2, including various courses and a podcast series on CISO secrets.

title: Global Industrial Rolls Out CAT Floor Care Equipment Line
summary: Global Industrial Company announced a multi-year floor care trademark license with Caterpillar and the launch of a new Cat Floor Care Equipment line, including scrubbers, sweepers, and vacuums designed for industrial environments. The new product line aims to strengthen Global Industrial's position as a leading distributor of floor care equipment with products known for their performance, durability, and advanced technology. These Cat products are exclusively available on Global Industrial's website and will be showcased at upcoming trade shows.

title: Ideas into Iron
summary: Lou Balmer-Millar, a UC Santa Barbara alumna with a Ph.D. in Materials Science, discusses her new role as Vice President of Caterpillar Inc., leading the Large Power Systems Division. She shares insights into her transition from research to industry, her academic journey at UCSB, and the importance of STEM education and diversity in manufacturing. Balmer-Millar also touches on her personal hobbies and commitment to community involvement.

title: Industrial giant 3M to hike prices as inflation, logistics woes bite
summary: 3M Co. announced it would increase product prices to counteract rising inflation and supply chain issues, which led to a lowered full-year earnings outlook. Despite these challenges, the company reported better-than-expected quarterly profit and revenue, driven by sales growth across its business units. 3M anticipates continued pressure from raw material and logistics costs and a decline in N95 mask demand.

title: Caterpillar Names First Chief Sustainability & Strategy Officer and Will Enhance Climate-Related Disclosures
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is creating the new position of Chief Sustainability & Strategy Officer, appointing Julie Lagacy to the role. The company will also enhance its environmental, social, and governance (ESG)-related disclosures and link a portion of executive compensation to ESG performance. These steps underline Caterpillar's commitment to sustainability, a reduced-carbon future, and aligning with stakeholder feedback.

title: Crane from Manitowoc wins 'Coolest Thing Made in Wisconsin' contest
summary: A 140 Ton Navy Crane manufactured by Broadwind Heavy Fabrications in Manitowoc has won this year's "Coolest Thing Made in Wisconsin" contest, sponsored by Wisconsin Manufacturers & Commerce and Johnson Financial Group. The 2.7 million-pound crane was created with support from a WisDOT Harbor Assistance grant and was destined for a U.S. Navy base on the East Coast. Other finalists included a V12 600hp Verado Outboard Engine from Mercury Marine, a Cat Electric Rope Shovel from Caterpillar Global Mining, and Glazer Donuts from Kwik Trip.

title: History of RTK—Part 4: Birth of a Utility
summary: This article, the fourth in a series, details the commercialization of Real Time Kinematic (RTK) technology, tracing its evolution from early military and surveying applications in the 1990s to a multibillion-dollar industry. It highlights key players like Trimble, Ashtech, and Leica, and describes advancements such as On-The-Fly (OTF) capabilities, miniaturization, and the development of Virtual Reference Station (VRS) technology. The piece concludes by showcasing RTK's impact on diverse fields like agriculture, machine control, and autonomous vehicles, solidifying its role as a ubiquitous utility.

title: BrightVolt Raises $16 Million in Series B Funding Led by New Science Ventures and Caterpillar Venture Capital Inc.
summary: BrightVolt has successfully closed the first tranche of a $16 million Series B funding round, with significant investments from New Science Ventures and Caterpillar Venture Capital Inc. The funds will be used to develop larger form factor products for industrial electrification and e-mobility markets. BrightVolt’s innovative polymer matrix electrolyte technology for solid-state Lithium-Ion batteries is compatible with existing manufacturing lines and aims to power the growing electric vehicle market.

title: Progress Rail and Norfolk Southern unite on latest Tier 4 locomotive
summary: Progress Rail, a Caterpillar Company, and Norfolk Southern Corporation have collaborated on the first EMD GP34ECO (Tier 4) locomotive for yard and intermediate operations. This locomotive is designed to meet the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency Tier 4 emissions certification, achieving a 90% reduction in nitrogen oxide emissions and significantly higher fuel efficiency. The collaboration highlights both companies' commitment to modernizing their locomotive fleets and furthering sustainability goals.

title: VOTE: 3 local companies move up in Coolest Thing Made in Wisconsin competition
summary: Three local Wisconsin companies, out of eight finalists, are still in the running for the annual "Coolest Thing in Wisconsin" contest organized by Wisconsin Manufacturers & Commerce and Johnson Financial Group. These companies include Mercury Marine (Fond du Lac), BenShot (Appleton), and Broadwind Heavy Fabrications (Manitowoc). Voting is currently open, with previous winners including Oshkosh Defense and Uncle Mike’s Bake Shoppe.

title: Manitowoc's big blue crane moves to the top 8 in Coolest Things Made in Wisconsin contest
summary: Manitowoc's "Big Blue" crane, built by Broadwind Heavy Fabrications, has advanced to the top eight in the Coolest Things Made in Wisconsin contest. Voters can help it reach the final four by visiting madeinwis.com, where it is currently competing against Absolut Manufacturing's WiNDR. The article also mentions other notable Wisconsin products in the running and highlights the crane's significance for the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard.

title: Caterpillar Defense to refurbish 49 D7G dozers to a like-new condition status
summary: Caterpillar Inc. Governmental and Defense Products has been awarded an $11.58 million contract modification to refurbish 49 government-owned Caterpillar D7G dozers to a like-new condition. These dozers are military versions of civilian bulldozers, commonly used by the U.S. Army for earthmoving and mine-clearing operations. The D7G model, which can be fitted with various blades and even remote-controlled for mine clearing, weighs around 23 tons and has a maximum speed of 15 km/h.

title: Not just toys: Hot Wheels go life-sized on 6,500-foot track in latest Caterpillar video
summary: Caterpillar Inc. released its 11th Cat Trials video, featuring a life-sized Hot Wheels track spanning 6,500 feet, showcasing Caterpillar Next Generation wheel loaders and replica Hot Wheels cars performing stunts. The video aims to promote STEM education and inspire future innovators by linking the fun of Hot Wheels with the potential of a career in fields related to Caterpillar's operations. The collaboration with Mattel Inc. highlights Caterpillar's global reach, and the elaborate track construction involved moving 15,000 yards of dirt over 6½ acres, with safety and precision ensured through GPS technology.

title: Western States Caterpillar – fusion teams use Microsoft Power Platform to build mobile apps for field staff
summary: Western States Caterpillar leveraged Microsoft Power Platform to build mobile apps for field staff, specifically addressing the digitization of rental returns and enabling sales teams to better understand customers. This initiative involved a "fusion team" approach, combining low-code (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) and pro-dev technologies (ASP.NET Core, Azure Blob storage, Azure SQL), resulting in significant improvements in operational efficiency and sales effectiveness. The success of these solutions, "Return to Ready" and "Client Connect," has led to substantial growth in Power BI and Power Apps usage across the company, inspiring other Caterpillar dealers.

title: Remanufacturing in a changing world: An interview with John Disharoon of Caterpillar Inc.
summary: John Disharoon, Director of Market Access for Cat Reman, discusses the challenges and opportunities in the remanufacturing industry. He highlights Caterpillar's closed-loop system, the importance of high-quality original products for successful remanufacturing, and the value of public-private partnerships like the REMADE Institute. Disharoon also addresses the need for policies that treat remanufactured goods equally to new products, emphasizing the industry's significant contributions to sustainability and the circular economy.

title: 5 Stocks to Buy and Hold According to Bill Gates
summary: This article identifies 5 stocks that Bill Gates' investment trust, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Trust, holds in its portfolio, suggesting them as long-term buys. It details Crown Castle International Corp. (REIT) (NYSE: CCI) as one of these holdings, including its stake value, hedge fund interest, recent financial performance, and an analyst's rating.

title: Yokohama plant earns Caterpillar certification
summary: For the second consecutive year, Yokohama Off-Highway Tires (YOHT) plant in Tirunelveli, India, has been awarded platinum certification through Caterpillar Inc.'s Supplier Quality Excellence Process (SQEP). This certification recognizes YOHT's commitment to delivering high-quality products, meeting stringent performance standards, and achieving outstanding quality, cost, and on-time delivery. YOHT is a subsidiary of Yokohama Rubber Co., Ltd., specializing in various commercial tires.

title: Caterpillar confirms active large mining shovel autonomous-ready & retrofit to electric programs
summary: Caterpillar has confirmed active R&D programs for large hydraulic mining shovels, focusing on autonomy and teleoperation, with prototypes tested at its Tinaja Hills proving ground. The company is also developing a retrofit option for its diesel-powered 6060 shovels to convert them to electric drive, offering customers an electrification pathway during rebuilds. These initiatives are part of Caterpillar's broader strategy to integrate advanced technology and alternative power sources into its mining equipment lineup.

title: Caterpillar to Showcase Sustainability, Safety and the Future of Mining at MINExpo 2021
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is set to present its latest advancements in safety, sustainability, and technology at MINExpo 2021 in Las Vegas, showcasing a 55,000-ft² exhibit. The company will introduce new equipment, autonomous machines, and remote operating stations, emphasizing its commitment to helping customers achieve climate-related objectives while maintaining performance. Key highlights include the new Cat D11 XE dozer, the Cat R1700 XE LHD underground loader with battery-electric propulsion, and various renewable power solutions, all under the theme "Together, We’re Mining Better."

title: VIDEO: Why Deere and Hitachi Are Breaking Up Their Excavator Business
summary: John Deere and Hitachi are dissolving their 30-year excavator joint venture, a decision driven by both companies' aspirations for greater control over their respective product lines and distribution networks. Deere will purchase Hitachi's manufacturing facilities in the Americas and continue building excavators under license, while Hitachi plans to build its brand in the Americas by importing machines from Japan and expanding its dealer network. This strategic split allows each company to pursue independent growth trajectories and deepen customer relationships.

title: What’s Next For 3M Stock After A 5% Fall In A Week?
summary: This article analyzes the recent 5.4% drop in 3M stock price over the past week and uses a machine learning engine to predict its future movement. It suggests that historically, a 5% drop in 3M stock often leads to an average 2.3% gain in the subsequent month. The article also provides updated insights based on 3M's Q2 2021 earnings, which exceeded expectations, leading to a revised full-year outlook and a slightly increased valuation.

title: Chevron, Caterpillar announce collaboration agreement on hydrogen
summary: Chevron U.S.A. Inc. and Caterpillar Inc. have announced a collaboration agreement to develop hydrogen demonstration projects. The focus will be on transportation and stationary power applications, including a hydrogen-fueled locomotive and associated fueling infrastructure, to assess hydrogen's feasibility as a commercially viable alternative to traditional fuels. This initiative aims to advance a hydrogen economy and help customers achieve climate-related objectives.

title: Briggs Equipment Celebrates 125 Years of Service
summary: Briggs Equipment, an ESOP-owned material handling solutions company, is celebrating its 125th anniversary throughout September. Founded in 1896 in Dallas, Texas, the company has grown significantly, becoming a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sammons Industrial and a global provider of materials-handling equipment. This milestone highlights its dedication to customer solutions and employee ownership.

title: BHP and Caterpillar to accelerate development of zero-emissions mining trucks
summary: BHP and Caterpillar Inc. have partnered to develop and deploy zero-emissions mining trucks at BHP sites to reduce operational greenhouse gas emissions. This collaboration will provide BHP with early access to new technology and hands-on learning opportunities, while also aiming to support a more inclusive mining industry by incorporating operator and maintainer input into the design process. The initiative is a step towards BHP's long-term goal of achieving net zero operational GHG emissions by 2050.

title: Champion Iron & CAT to team up at Quebec iron ore mine
summary: Champion Iron has signed a letter of intent with Caterpillar Inc. to implement AI-based technologies and a remote-controlled, semi-autonomous, and fully-autonomous electric drilling fleet at its Bloom Lake mine in Quebec. The project aims to optimize operational productivity and reduce energy consumption using CAT's MineStar™ suite of technologies. Champion Iron plans to utilize its workforce's operational expertise for the deployment of these advanced mining practices.

title: SCV News | Tejon Outlets, Tejon Ranch Commerce Center Partner to Host Job Fair
summary: The Outlets at Tejon and Tejon Ranch Commerce Center are co-hosting a job fair on Wednesday, August 18th, from 2:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. The event aims to fill various positions in the food, retail, hospitality, and warehouse industries, with participating companies including major brands like Polo Ralph Lauren, Kate Spade, Starbucks, and Caterpillar. Job seekers are encouraged to attend professionally dressed and with resumes, as on-the-spot interviews and immediate openings will be available.

title: Champion Iron Signs Letter of Intent With Caterpillar for Advanced Drilling Technologies at Bloom Lake Mine
summary: Champion Iron Limited has signed a Letter of Intent with Caterpillar Inc. to implement artificial intelligence-based Advanced Drilling Technologies at its Bloom Lake Mine. This project will progressively introduce a remote-controlled, semi-autonomous, and fully autonomous Cat electric drilling fleet to optimize operational productivity and reduce energy consumption. The collaboration aims to deploy a Drill-to-Mill strategy focused on improving milling performance through integrated systems and real-time data analysis.

title: Why Is John Deere in a Disruptive Tech ETF?
summary: This article explains why John Deere (NYSE: DE), traditionally seen as an industrial company, is included in disruptive technology ETFs like ARK Autonomous Technology & Robotics ETF (ARKQ) and ARK Space Exploration and Innovation ETF (ARKX). It highlights Deere's historical role in agricultural automation and its current expansion into autonomous farming technology, including the acquisition of Bear Flag Robotics. The piece argues that Deere's innovation in automation aligns with the investment objectives of these tech-focused funds, emphasizing the potential for increased efficiency and productivity in agriculture.

title: Dow rises 160 points to close at a record after Senate passes $1 trillion infrastructure bill
summary: Stocks, specifically the Dow and S&P 500, hit new records on Tuesday after the Senate passed a $1 trillion infrastructure package, boosting economically sensitive stocks. While the Dow and S&P 500 saw gains, the Nasdaq Composite dipped due to rising Treasury yields impacting tech stocks. Investors are now looking ahead to upcoming inflation data and statements from central bank speakers for further market direction.

title: Daseke Reports Higher Profit, Revenue for Q2
summary: Daseke Inc. reported significant increases in earnings and revenue for the second quarter, alongside the permanent appointment of Jonathan Shepko as CEO. The company posted a net income of $35.3 million and revenue of $404 million, surpassing Wall Street expectations. These gains are attributed to strong construction and manufacturing activity, strategic operational integrations, and an enhanced focus on data-driven decision-making.

title: Terex CEO appoints new President of Genie
summary: John L. Garrison, Jr., Chairman, President, and CEO of Terex Corporation, announced the appointment of Simon A. Meester as the new President of Genie, effective August 1, 2021. Meester, who previously served as Genie's Chief Operating Officer, will continue to report to Garrison and join the Company’s Executive Leadership Team. Garrison expressed confidence in Meester’s leadership to drive Genie’s growth and innovation moving forward.

title: Labor, Materials, Nature Complicate I-30 Widening
summary: The 5.4-mile Interstate 30 widening project in central Arkansas, an undertaking approved by voters in 2012, faces numerous challenges including labor shortages due to COVID-19, delays in material availability, and complex environmental and geological issues. Despite these hurdles, the $187-million project, managed by Johnson Bros. Corp., is currently ahead of schedule, with expected completion in September 2022. The project involves expanding the highway to six lanes, reconstructing interchanges, and building 10 bridges, while maintaining continuous traffic flow and addressing weak soils and endangered mussels.

title: Paccar Q2 Results Ride Surge in Truck Deliveries, Parts, Financial Services
summary: Paccar Inc. reported a significant surge in Q2 earnings and revenue, driven by increased truck deliveries and record performance in its parts and financial services segments. The company's net income reached $492.9 million on $5.3 billion in revenue, with strong demand for parts and used trucks despite industry-wide semiconductor chip shortages. Paccar also highlighted advancements in new truck models, autonomous technology, and zero-emission vehicles.

title: Newmont’s Expansion of Gold Mining Production in Ghana
summary: Newmont Corporation is expanding its gold mining operations in Ghana with the approval of the Ahafo North project. This expansion is crucial for meeting resource demand, with the new site expected to produce 275,000 to 325,000 ounces per year and create approximately 1,800 jobs during construction. The project represents a significant investment and is projected to deliver a 30% internal rate of return for the company.

title: How Former Caterpillar Exec Jean Savage is Transforming Dallas’ Trinity Industries
summary: Jean Savage, the first woman and non-family member CEO of Dallas-based Trinity Industries, is transforming the railcar company with strategies focusing on collaboration, leasing, and technological exploration. Her journey from Caterpillar and Progress Rail highlights her leadership in driving significant change and growth, even amidst the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic. Under her guidance, Trinity's headquarters moved, and a new three-year strategic plan was rolled out, emphasizing innovation and market share expansion.

title: Mid-Year Report: Titan adds staff, expects continued surge
summary: Titan International Inc. is expanding production and hiring more staff in response to robust demand in agriculture, construction, and other Off-the-Road (OTR) markets. The company attributes its strong performance in 2021 to U.S. government subsidies and high commodity prices, which have increased demand for its American-made tires and wheels, reducing reliance on global supply chains. Titan expects continued strong demand, particularly in the ag segment, and is focusing on new product development and innovations like the AgraEDGE tire line.

title: From catwalks to construction sites: Caterpillar’s Kenny Beaupre and Lesley Godby on the team’s strategic approach to brand extensions
summary: Kenny Beaupre and Lesley Godby from Caterpillar discuss the brand's strategic approach to extensions, ranging from fashion collaborations to consumer products like the Cat phone. They emphasize a slow, customer-focused expansion strategy, maintaining core brand values of quality, strength, and durability. The article highlights how Caterpillar successfully translates its B2B identity into the consumer space through thoughtful licensing partnerships and creative collaborations.

title: Burns & McDonnell Selected as EPC Contractor for 175-MW Natural Gas-Fired Plant
summary: Burns & McDonnell has been selected as the EPC contractor for NorthWestern Energy's 175-megawatt (MW) natural gas-fired RICE plant, the Laurel Generation Station, near Laurel, Montana. This project will utilize 18 Caterpillar RICE units, providing flexible and on-demand power to support NorthWestern Energy's renewable portfolio growth and address capacity deficits. The plant aims to enhance grid reliability for Montana customers, especially during extreme weather, and mitigate risks from market volatility.

title: Sany 2020 excavator sales top world for first time
summary: Sany Heavy Industry Co Ltd became the world's top excavator seller in 2020, marking the first time a Chinese company achieved this. The company attributed its success to China's robust economy and the increasing trend of automation in manufacturing, despite over 80 percent of its sales being domestic. Sany aims for $10 billion in overseas sales within five years and focuses on electric models and intelligent manufacturing for future growth.

title: Codan finally sells Minetec to Caterpillar for $14 million after three year collaboration
summary: Codan has announced the sale of its Minetec business to Caterpillar for $14 million, culminating a three-year collaboration that integrated Minetec's underground mining technologies into Caterpillar's Cat MineStar™ system. Codan will continue to provide manufacturing services for up to five years, and the sale is expected to generate a one-off pre-tax gain of approximately A$3 million for Codan, with the funds used to pay down loan facilities and allow Codan to focus on its core businesses and recent acquisitions. The decision to sell was made after a strategic review, concluding that Caterpillar was the more appropriate owner to scale the technology-based business.

title: Dana Builds Its Way Into Expanding Commercial EV Market
summary: Tier One supplier Dana Inc. has invested over $400 million in its electrification product portfolio, aiming for $500 million in revenue from this segment by 2023. The company is focusing on the expanding commercial vehicle, particularly medium-duty, market for electric vehicles, and expects its content per vehicle to at least double with the integration of electric motors and inverters into axles. Dana is also expanding into battery systems and embedded software solutions, anticipating profitability in its electrification business in a few years, despite current margin headwinds.

title: Caterpillar engine donation supports WVU Statler College research to reduce greenhouse gas emissions
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has donated a powerful industrial natural gas engine to West Virginia University's Benjamin M. Statler College of Engineering and Mineral Resources. This donation will support a $1.5 million research project aimed at developing technology to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and improve fuel consumption at natural gas production sites. The research, led by principal investigator Derek Johnson, will involve faculty and graduate students through 2023, with the goal of creating an economical methane mitigator system.

title: Caterpillar to acquire Progress Rail Services (5/16/2006)
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has agreed to acquire Progress Rail Services Inc. for $1 billion. The deal involves approximately $800 million in cash and stock, with Caterpillar assuming $200 million in long-term debt. Progress Rail, a supplier of various rail components and services, will see its management team join Caterpillar, pending regulatory approvals by the end of the second quarter.

title: Caterpillar Announces New 2030 Sustainability Goals and Reports Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Progress
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced new 2030 sustainability goals focused on climate, environment, and safety, detailed in its 2020 Sustainability Report. These goals aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, improve water management, decrease waste intensity, and enhance product sustainability and safety. The report also highlights significant progress made through 2020, including substantial reductions in injury frequency, GHG emissions, and water consumption.

title: Caterpillar chooses Las Colinas for divisional office relocation
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has selected Las Colinas as the new location for one of its divisional offices. The company will occupy multiple floors at Williams Square in Irving. This move is part of the ongoing corporate relocations to the North Texas area.

title: Caterpillar Inks Big Lease at Williams Square in Las Colinas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has chosen Las Colinas as the new home for its Electric Power division, leasing multiple floors in the West Tower of Williams Square. The company plans to consolidate global leadership and support teams, expecting to take occupancy in early 2022 and create local hires. This move is supported by a $7.8 million renovation of Williams Square Plaza by the City of Irving, aiming to create an unmatched office destination.

title: Caterpillar flags supply-chain risks as global recovery boosts earnings
authors: Sanjana Shivdas and Rajesh Kumar Singh
summary: Caterpillar reported higher quarterly earnings but warned that supply-chain bottlenecks, particularly a global shortage of semiconductor chips, could hinder its ability to meet increasing customer orders. Despite these risks and rising raw material costs, the company is benefiting from a global economic recovery and increased infrastructure spending, leading to strong demand for its machinery. Adjusted profit significantly exceeded analyst expectations, though shares dipped due to supply concerns.

title: Industrial giant Caterpillar picks North Texas for division move, hundreds of jobs
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is relocating its Electric Power Division, consolidating functions and hundreds of jobs from California, Arizona, and Indiana to Las Colinas in Irving, North Texas. The division will occupy multiple floors in the Williams Square high-rise complex, with plans to move in early next year. This move is seen as a significant win for the Metroplex, highlighting North Texas's growing appeal to major corporations.

title: Digging out: Forecasting for construction OEMs in the next normal
summary: This article discusses how construction equipment (CE) OEMs can navigate the post-COVID-19 market landscape by rethinking traditional strategies and implementing robust, fact-based market outlook models for demand forecasting. It highlights significant industry shifts including digital acceleration, increased demand for rentals and aftermarket services, ESG focus, and the need for stronger supply chains and local manufacturing. The piece emphasizes the importance of data-driven analytical models, specifically combining construction capital expenditures, residential housing starts, and inventory correction, to accurately predict future demand in the CE industry.

title: CalPERS to back activist’s four director nominees in Exxon board fight
summary: The California Public Employees’ Retirement System (CalPERS) announced its support for Engine No. 1's four director nominees in their proxy fight against Exxon Mobil Corp. CalPERS, a major shareholder, cited ExxonMobil's long-term financial underperformance and the need for new expertise, particularly in clean energy, as reasons for its decision. This move adds significant weight to Engine No. 1's challenge ahead of Exxon's annual meeting.

title: Caterpillar and Certarus Sign Memorandum of Understanding to Explore Lower Carbon Energy Solutions
summary: Caterpillar Inc. and Certarus Ltd. have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to collaborate on developing and implementing lower carbon energy solutions for their customers. The agreement focuses on leveraging their combined strengths to bring natural gas and hydrogen energy solutions to off-pipeline applications and other sectors, aiming to help customers reduce carbon intensity. This partnership is a natural extension of their existing relationship, driving clean energy integration and comprehensive customer solutions for the energy transition.

title: Caterpillar Foundation Announces Global Environmental Partnership with One Tree Planted
summary: The Caterpillar Foundation announced a $1 million investment with One Tree Planted to support global reforestation initiatives, aligning with the UN's Sustainable Development Goals. This partnership will facilitate tree planting in 95 communities worldwide, aiming to restore ecosystems and sequester CO2. The initiative underscores Caterpillar's commitment to sustainability and building resilient communities.

title: Caterpillar Announces Board of Directors Changes
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced changes to its board of directors, effective April 14, 2021. Juan Gallardo and William Osborn retired from the board, while David MacLennan, Cargill's Board Chair and CEO, was elected as a new member. The company acknowledged the significant contributions of the retiring members and expressed anticipation for MacLennan's leadership experience.

title: Caterpillar Announces Board of Directors Changes
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced changes to its board of directors, including the retirements of long-time members Juan Gallardo and William (Bill) Osborn. David MacLennan, Cargill Board Chair and CEO, has been elected to the board. These changes were effective April 14, 2021, and highlight Caterpillar's leadership transition and strategic additions to its board.

title: Watch How Trimble Earthworks for Soil Compactors Works
summary: Trimble Earthworks for soil compactors is a GNSS-based, 3D compaction control solution designed to enhance the accuracy, speed, and ease of soil compaction. This system allows contractors to precisely manage the compaction process, thereby reducing unnecessary passes and preventing over-compaction. Operators will benefit from the familiar and intuitive Trimble Earthworks software interface, similar to those used for excavators, dozers, and motor graders, ultimately improving productivity.

title: Caterpillar GC Series Vibratory Soil Compactors
summary: Caterpillar has launched its new 84-inch Cat GC Series vibratory soil compactors, designed for simple operation, high reliability, and low cost-per-hour performance. The series includes 10-, 11-, and 12-ton models in both smooth and padfoot drum configurations, targeting various construction and earth-fill applications. Powered by a Cat C3.6 diesel engine, these compactors feature Eco-Mode for fuel savings and a pod-style vibration system for extended service intervals.

title: How A.I.-powered companies dodged the worst damage from COVID
summary: This article highlights how AI-powered companies like AGCO and Caterpillar successfully navigated the COVID-19 pandemic and are poised for future success. AGCO utilized an AI-based supply chain risk-management system to predict lockdowns and expedite shipments, minimizing disruption. Caterpillar is transforming into a hardware-and-software company, leveraging AI for predictive maintenance and developing AI-based services to drive significant revenue growth and redefine customer value.

title: Caterpillar Introduces Five New Soil Compactors to the Market
summary: Caterpillar has expanded its single-drum vibratory soil compactor line with five new 84-inch drum width Cat GC Series models: the CS10 GC, CP11 GC, CS11 GC, CP12 GC, and CS12 GC. These new compactors are designed for simple operation, high reliability, and low cost-per-hour performance, suitable for road building, site preparation, and large earth fill applications. They feature the Cat C3.6 diesel engine, Eco-Mode for fuel savings, and an exclusive pod-style vibration system with extended service intervals.

title: Machinery manufacturer Caterpillar is expecting shipment delays due to the Suez Canal gridlock
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is anticipating shipment delays of a week or more from Asia to Europe due to the Suez Canal blockage, considering airlifting products if necessary to prevent factory shutdowns. The crisis adds to existing supply-chain issues for US manufacturers, with the obstructed vessel causing significant economic losses and potential shortages of various goods. The White House has offered assistance to reopen the canal, while the ship's owner has apologized for the disruption.

title: Southern Copper's Cuajone copper-moly mine in Peru considering six unit autonomous truck trial
summary: Southern Copper Corporation is considering deploying autonomous trucks at its Cuajone copper-moly mine in Peru, one of the largest copper mines in the country. The company is in discussions with Caterpillar and Komatsu for a potential trial involving six new autonomous trucks in Zone 8 of the mine. This initiative could mark Cuajone as a major Latin American mine to adopt autonomous truck technology, enhancing its existing mixed fleet of traditional Komatsu and Caterpillar trucks used for ore transport.

title: Rob Charter joins GC SUNS Board
summary: The Gold Coast SUNS have announced the appointment of former Caterpillar Inc. executive, Rob Charter, to their board. Charter brings nearly 30 years of global business experience from Caterpillar, including expertise in customer and dealer support and digital initiatives. The SUNS Chairman Tony Cochrane believes Charter's corporate knowledge and connections will significantly strengthen the club's off-field capabilities.

title: Is Charles Schwab (SCHW) Stock A Buy or Sell?
summary: This article analyzes hedge fund activity concerning The Charles Schwab Corporation (NYSE: SCHW) to determine if it's a good investment. It reveals that 61 hedge funds held SCHW at the end of Q4 2020, an increase from the previous quarter, with Generation Investment Management being the largest shareholder. The article also compares SCHW's hedge fund sentiment to other similarly valued stocks, concluding that SCHW's sentiment score is above average and that its stock has outperformed the market since Q4 2020.

title: Caterpillar Inc. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
summary: Caterpillar Inc. stock saw a strong trading day, advancing 3.17% to $233.63, outperforming the broader market indices like the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average. The company also reached a new 52-week high, surpassing its previous peak. While outperforming some competitors, the stock showed mixed performance against others like Deere & Co., General Electric Co., and Cummins Inc.

title: Caterpillar 538 Forest Machine
summary: The Caterpillar 538 Forest Machine features a new electrohydraulic control system with increased swing torque and travel speed, improved ground clearance, and a larger cab for enhanced operator comfort and visibility. It boasts a 173-horsepower Cat C7.1 engine, better fuel efficiency through Smart mode, and significantly reduced maintenance costs and extended service intervals compared to its predecessor. The machine also offers improved cold-start capability, high ambient temperature operation, and an increased fuel tank capacity.

title: Is Caterpillar Stock a Buy?
summary: Caterpillar (CAT) stock has reached a new all-time high, driven by expectations of future performance, including a 2021 bull market, infrastructure stimulus, and higher oil prices, despite a challenging 2020. The company's business is improving, and it maintains its Dividend Aristocrat status, but its surging stock price raises valuation concerns as much of the optimism is already priced in. Investors are advised to monitor the company's progress from the sidelines as the stock may have gotten ahead of itself.

title: General Motors Executive to Join Caterpillar's Board of Directors
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced that Gerald Johnson, executive vice president of Global Manufacturing at General Motors Company, has been elected to its board of directors, effective March 1, 2021. Johnson brings extensive manufacturing and technical expertise, global experience, and a strong commitment to sustainability and diversity, equity, and inclusion, which will complement Caterpillar's board. He will serve on the Public Policy and Governance Committee alongside 11 other board members.

title: General Motors Executive to Join Caterpillar's Board of Directors
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced that Gerald Johnson, Executive Vice President of Global Manufacturing at General Motors, has been elected to its board of directors, effective March 1, 2021. Johnson brings extensive manufacturing and technical expertise, global experience, and a commitment to sustainability and diversity. He will serve on the Public Policy and Governance Committee.

title: 10-Year Treasury Yield Hit 1.21%, More than Doubling Since Aug. But Mortgage Rates Near Record Low. And Junk Bond Yields Dropped to New Record Lows
summary: The 10-year Treasury yield rose to 1.21%, more than doubling since August, signaling inflation concerns in the bond market. Despite this, mortgage rates remain near historic lows at 2.73% for a 30-year fixed rate, while junk bond yields have dropped to new record lows, indicating a growing bubble in the riskiest credit markets. The Federal Reserve appears comfortable with rising long-term Treasury yields as long as they reflect inflation expectations and economic growth rather than financial stress.

title: MCFA forklifts buys back company shares from minority stockholder Caterpillar
summary: Mitsubishi Caterpillar Forklift America Inc. (MCFA) is repurchasing the shares held by its minority stockholder, Caterpillar Industrial Inc. This move will result in MCFA's parent company, Mitsubishi Logisnext Americas group, becoming fully owned by Mitsubishi Logisnext as of March 1. Despite the ownership change, both companies affirm that their existing brand sales structures and strategic relationships will continue, with Cat lift truck brands still being utilized globally by the Mitsubishi Logisnext group.

title: CATERPILLAR ACQUIRES WEIR OIL & GAS, LAUNCHES SPM OIL & GAS
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has completed the acquisition of the Oil & Gas Division of the Weir Group PLC, creating SPM Oil & Gas. This acquisition expands Caterpillar's offerings in the well service industry by combining Weir Oil & Gas' pressure pumping and control portfolio with Cat engines and transmissions, leveraging a global network of service centers and approximately 2,000 employees. SPM Oil & Gas will continue to produce a full line of products including pumps, flow iron, wellhead, and pressure control products.

title: Caterpillar acquires Fort Worth-based Weir Oil & Gas for $405M
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE: CAT) has completed its $405 million cash acquisition of the Oil & Gas Division (Weir Oil & Gas) from The Weir Group PLC. The acquired business, now named SPM Oil & Gas, based near Fort Worth, will continue to produce a full line of pumps, flow iron, consumable parts, wellhead and pressure control products. This acquisition aligns with Caterpillar's strategy to expand its offerings and services in the well service industry, creating one of the broadest portfolios in the sector.

title: Procore Breaks into Preconstruction with Esticom Capability Assimilated into Project Management
summary: Procore Technologies, Inc. has expanded into preconstruction by integrating Esticom's capabilities into its project management platform. This move aims to enhance collaboration and financial solutions, with artificial intelligence expected to make significant contributions to construction computing in the near future. Wyatt Jenkins, senior vice president of product, discussed these developments.

title: Caterpillar Reports Fourth-Quarter and Full-Year 2020 Results
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced its fourth-quarter and full-year 2020 results, reporting a 15% decrease in Q4 sales and revenues compared to 2019, totaling $11.2 billion. Full-year sales and revenues were $41.7 billion, down 22% from 2019, primarily due to lower end-user demand and dealer inventory reductions. Despite the challenges, the company achieved its adjusted operating profit margin target and returned $3.4 billion to shareholders through dividends and share repurchases.

title: Caterpillar’s Chinese Rivals Power Through the Pandemic - WSJ
summary: Chinese machinery giants, including Sany Heavy Industry Co. and Zoomlion Heavy Industry Science & Technology Co., have seen significant stock-market gains. These companies, producing construction equipment like excavators and cranes, have expanded their market share in China. This growth occurred as their foreign competitors, such as Caterpillar, faced challenges due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: TRC: New Approval Validates the Company’s Real Estate Opportunity
summary: Tejon Ranch Company (TRC) received approval to develop multi-family apartments in the Tejon Ranch Commerce Center (TRCC), a move seen as positive for shareholder value and addressing Kern County's housing shortage. The approval allows for up to 495 multi-family residences and commercial space, leveraging TRCC's strategic location near major urban centers. This development also highlights TRC's potential role in mitigating California's broader housing crisis, building on previous legal victories against environmental challenges.

title: COVID-19 cancels $4.5B Heartland project
summary: Pembina Pipeline Corp. and Kuwait’s Petrochemical Industries Co. have indefinitely suspended their $4.5 billion petrochemical project in Sturgeon County, Alberta's Industrial Heartland, due to economic uncertainty caused by COVID-19. The project, which aimed to convert propane into plastic pellets, was expected to generate significant annual earnings and create thousands of jobs. Despite this cancellation, Pembina is proceeding with other projects totaling $785 million.

title: De Lange elected to AGCO board
summary: AGCO announced the election of Bob De Lange to its board of directors, effective Jan. 1, 2021. De Lange, 51, is the group president, services, distribution and digital, at Caterpillar Corp., and brings extensive digitalization and distribution experience to the AGCO board. His background includes leadership roles in the US and internationally, with a focus on managing Caterpillar's brand and distribution network.

title: Italians arrested for selling fake Caterpillar equipment
summary: Three Italian nationals were charged in Nairobi with forgery and fraud for allegedly selling counterfeit Caterpillar equipment. The accused, Loffredo Antonio, Criscuolo Alfredo, and Criscuolo Guisepe, pleaded not guilty to six offenses, including making and uttering forged documents, possessing and selling counterfeit goods, and counterfeiting Caterpillar trademarks. They were arrested while attempting to sell fake generators and are accused of deceiving customers by claiming the products were surplus from an exhibition.

title: Goodyear And SafeAI Announce Tire Intelligence For Autonomous Heavy Equipment
summary: Goodyear and SafeAI have formed a strategic partnership to integrate tire intelligence into autonomous heavy equipment vehicles. This collaboration aims to protect tire health, eliminate downtime, and enhance safety in the construction industry through the exchange of site data and the use of Goodyear's TPMS Heavy Duty rim-mounted sensors on autonomous machinery. The initiative seeks to address inefficiencies and reduce costly unplanned downtime often experienced on construction and mining sites.

title: Exclusive: U.S. investigators were told to take 'no further action' on Caterpillar, ex-client of Barr
summary: U.S. investigators were instructed to take "no further action" on an active criminal probe into Caterpillar Inc. shortly after William Barr, a former lawyer for Caterpillar, was nominated as Attorney General. The decision, which came from the Justice Department's Tax Division and the office of the deputy attorney general, stalled an investigation into Caterpillar's tax practices, which the IRS had linked to $2.3 billion in demanded payments. Barr recused himself from any discussions on Caterpillar after becoming Attorney General, and the reasons for the "no further action" directive issued before his confirmation remain unclear.

title: Exclusive Interview with Caterpillar Inc. Creative Director Archie Lyons
summary: Archie Lyons, Creative Director at Caterpillar Inc., discusses how Cat Trial 9: PAC-MAN™ celebrated the brand's 95th anniversary and showcased automation in construction. Lyons explains the "PAC-MAN™ as a construction site" analogy, where challenges are ghosts and CAT dealer services are power pellets. The article highlights an exclusive interview with Lyons and the trial video.

title: Engineering giant Caterpillar to cut 700 jobs in the UK over next 18 months
summary: US manufacturing firm Caterpillar plans to cut 700 jobs at its Northern Ireland operations over the next 18 months. The redundancies will affect workers across production, support, and management positions, but the company states the decision is unrelated to Brexit, Covid-19, or furlough schemes. Caterpillar is also considering selling its Millennium office building in Belfast and relocating those employees.

title: Biden Basket Vs Trump Trade — Potential Stock and Sector Winners and Losers
summary: This article explores potential stock and sector winners and losers under a Biden administration versus a second Trump term, based on analyses from financial institutions. It identifies "Biden basket" stocks in alternative energy, infrastructure, and those benefiting from fiscal stimulus and reduced tariff tensions, while "Trump basket" stocks include banks, fossil fuel companies, big tech, defense, and pharma/biotech due to differing regulatory and policy approaches.

title: Cat autonomous 785 fleet in the works for ioneer's Rhyolite Ridge lithium-boron project in Nevada
summary: ioneer Ltd has partnered with Caterpillar to supply heavy equipment and introduce autonomous haul trucks for its Rhyolite Ridge lithium-boron project in Nevada. This project will be the first greenfield site in the US to use automated haul trucks in initial operations, utilizing Cat 785 trucks and other advanced machinery with GPS and real-time analytics. The five-year deal for equipment and services is valued at approximately $100 million, with financing solutions from Caterpillar Financial Services, pending a final investment decision.

title: Tesla microgrids spread as U.S. grid ‘gets worse and worse’
summary: Tesla is rapidly expanding its microgrid operations, with over 120 already in operation and plans for 1,000 in the near future, as the U.S. power grid experiences increasing instability from climate-related events. The company, known for its modular and cloud-managed systems, is part of a larger trend of companies entering the microgrid space to meet growing demand for resilient, clean energy solutions. Experts highlight the shift towards simpler, modular microgrids, especially combining solar and battery storage, as a key development driven by grid vulnerabilities and new regulatory support.

title: Caterpillar reports a 54% drop in earnings in the third quarter amid lower equipment demand
summary: Caterpillar reported a significant 54% drop in third-quarter earnings, with adjusted earnings per share of $1.34 on revenue of $9.9 billion. Despite the decline, these figures exceeded analysts' expectations. The company attributed the sales decrease primarily to lower end-user demand for equipment and services and a reduction in dealer inventories.

title: Caterpillar video featuring life-sized game board puts a new spin on Pac-Man
summary: Caterpillar has created a new video featuring a life-sized Pac-Man game board, utilizing company equipment to navigate the massive maze. This project, part of the Cat Trials series, showcases Caterpillar's autonomous construction equipment and services. The video was created with the blessing of Bandai Namco Entertainment Inc. and involved significant in-house effort to construct and film the intricate game board.

title: Caterpillar Revives Popular Video Series with Trial 9: PAC-MAN™
summary: Caterpillar has revived its popular "Cat Trials" video series with a ninth installment featuring a life-sized PAC-MAN™ game played with remote-controlled skid steers. The video showcases Cat equipment and services while also aiming to attract the next generation of operators to the construction industry by connecting virtual gaming skills with real-world applications. The construction of the massive PAC-MAN™ board involved significant earthmoving and featured Cat's latest machines and technologies.

title: Caterpillar Inc. Announces Officer Retirements and Changes to its Executive Office
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the retirements of Group Presidents William (Billy) P. Ainsworth and Ramin Younessi, effective year-end 2020. The company also appointed Joseph (Joe) E. Creed as the new group president of Energy & Transportation and Anthony (Tony) D. Fassino as the new group president of Construction Industries, effective January 1, 2021. These changes reflect shifts in leadership for key segments of the company.

title: Mitsubishi Logisnext Americas Inc. Announces Operational Integration Plans For Mitsubishi Caterpillar Forklift America, UniCarriers Americas Corporation
summary: Mitsubishi Logisnext Americas Inc. announced plans to integrate the operations of Mitsubishi Caterpillar Forklift America Inc. and UniCarriers Americas Corporation within the Americas. This integration aims to create a stronger, more efficient business offering an expanded range of material handling, automation, and fleet solutions through five brands. A new corporate website was launched to serve as a single resource for their complete portfolio.

title: Randal Peterson Obituary (1964 - 2020) - Windsor, CO - Peoria Journal Star
summary: Randal Neil "Randy" Peterson, 56, formerly of Peoria, passed away on October 3, 2020, in Windsor, Colorado. He was born on March 16, 1964, in Brookings, South Dakota, and had a distinguished career at Caterpillar, Inc. and Woodward, Inc., holding 19 patents. A memorial service was held on October 24 in Peoria, and he is remembered for his dedication to family, innovation, and a lifelong love of learning.

title: Weir to sell Oil & Gas division to Caterpillar
summary: The Weir Group plc has agreed to sell its Oil & Gas division to Caterpillar Inc. for US$405 million. This sale will transform Weir into a premium mining technology pure play, operating through its Minerals and ESCO divisions. The deal is expected to be completed by the end of 2020, subject to regulatory clearances.

title: Turner Powertrain Systems
summary: Turner Powertrain Systems, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Caterpillar Inc., specializes in developing and manufacturing transmissions for various heavy machinery. Since 1859, the company has been a market leader, known for providing reliable and innovative transmission solutions to Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) for applications in construction, agriculture, and material handling. They offer product lines including manual, semi-automatic, and hydrostatic transmissions, collaborating closely with OEMs from design to production and beyond.

title: Weir to sell Oil & Gas division to Caterpillar
summary: The Weir Group announced an agreement to sell its entire Oil & Gas division to Caterpillar Inc for $405 million in cash. This strategic move aims to transform Weir into a premium mining technology focused company, using the proceeds to reduce leverage and invest in future growth. The transaction is subject to shareholder approval and is expected to close by the end of 2020.

title: Caterpillar to Buy Weir Oil & Gas for $405M
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced an agreement to acquire the Oil & Gas Division of Weir Group PLC for $405 million in cash. This acquisition will expand Caterpillar's offerings in the well service industry by combining Weir Oil & Gas's pressure pumping and control portfolio with Cat's engines and transmissions. The transaction, which includes over 40 manufacturing and service locations and approximately 2,000 employees, is subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals.

title: CATERPILLAR SIGNS AGREEMENT TO ACQUIRE WEIR OIL & GAS
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has signed an agreement to acquire the Oil & Gas Division of Weir Group PLC for $405 million in cash. This acquisition aims to expand Caterpillar's offerings in the well service industry by combining Weir Oil & Gas's pressure pumping and control portfolio with Cat's engines and transmissions. The transaction includes over 40 manufacturing and service locations and approximately 2,000 employees, and is subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals.

title: CCO Paul McDonnell to Step Down from United Rentals
summary: Paul McDonnell, Chief Commercial Officer of United Rentals, will step down from his position on September 30 but will continue to provide advisory services for 24 months. His responsibilities will be absorbed by COO Dale Asplund. McDonnell leaves after 21 years with the company, having significantly contributed to the growth of its specialty rental segment.

title: Caterpillar Announces Appointment of New Vice President
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the appointment of Marc Cameron as a company vice president, effective November 2, 2020. Cameron will lead Caterpillar’s Resource Industries Sales, Services and Technology Division, bringing 20 years of mining expertise from his previous roles at Rio Tinto. His appointment is expected to enhance customer focus and accelerate the growth of Caterpillar's services, especially technology solutions.

title: Caterpillar Announces Appointment of New Vice President
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has appointed Marc Cameron as a new company vice president, effective November 2, 2020. Cameron will lead Caterpillar's Resource Industries Sales, Services and Technology Division, bringing 20 years of mining and construction industry expertise. His experience includes leading complex global teams and serving in various roles at Rio Tinto, one of Caterpillar's largest mining customers.

title: Interview: Lasse Petterson, CEO and President, Great Lakes Dredge & Dock
summary: Lasse Petterson, CEO and President of Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD), discusses his three years at the helm, the current state of the U.S. dredging market, and GLDD's strategic investments. He highlights the company's strong safety culture, its adaptation to the COVID-19 pandemic, and its focus on new technology and talent development. Petterson also shares personal insights into his career journey and management philosophy.

title: Caterpillar confirms closure of historic German mining equipment factories
summary: Caterpillar has confirmed the closure of its historic Luenen and Wuppertal longwall mining equipment factories, and the Dortmund factory producing hydraulic mining shovels, in Germany. This decision, announced in August 2020, follows a March 2020 statement considering the closures. Caterpillar plans to restructure its longwall business and consolidate production into other locations, transitioning some longwall production to Asia to be closer to end customers.

title: Is Caterpillar Stock a Buy?
summary: This article analyzes Caterpillar's Q2 2020 earnings, which showed a significant revenue and EPS decline due to the pandemic's impact on its core industries. Despite the poor performance, Caterpillar's dividend remains intact thanks to substantial liquidity and free cash flow generation, though its financial metrics like debt to capital are rising. The author concludes that while Caterpillar is an economic bellwether and a long-term investment due to its dividend aristocrat status, expectations for its stock performance should remain low until an economic turnaround.

title: CAT S62 Pro: A rugged smartphone with mid-range specs and a professional-grade thermal imaging camera
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced the CAT S62 Pro, a rugged smartphone featuring a professional-grade FLIR Lepton 3.5 IR sensor. This device combines mid-range specifications like a Snapdragon 660 SoC, 6GB RAM, and 128GB storage with extreme durability, including IP68 and MIL-STD-810H ratings. Retailing for £599 in the UK, the CAT S62 Pro will begin shipping on August 17th.

title: Caterpillar and CalAmp Extend Relationship on Industrial IoT Solutions
summary: CalAmp announced an extension of its relationship with Caterpillar Inc. to continue providing industrial IoT solutions. This expanded agreement focuses on migrating Caterpillar's existing connected asset fleets to 4G LTE, with CalAmp supplying 4G devices and replacements. The partnership aims to accelerate Caterpillar's digital transformation and support its construction and industrial customers with ubiquitous connectivity.

title: Cat Financial Announces Second-Quarter 2020 Results
summary: Cat Financial reported a decrease in second-quarter 2020 revenues by 15% to $641 million and a 25% decrease in profit to $59 million compared to 2019, primarily due to lower financing rates and earning assets. The company saw an 18% decrease in retail new business volume and an increase in past dues, largely attributed to the COVID-19 pandemic. Despite these challenges, Cat Financial maintained strong financial liquidity and implemented customer support programs.

title: PACCAR Achieves Good Quarterly Revenues and Profits
summary: PACCAR reported second-quarter 2020 net income of $147.7 million on revenues of $3.06 billion, a significant decrease from the previous year due to factory closures. Despite the challenges, the company maintained a strong financial position with $4.17 billion in cash and marketable securities and declared a quarterly dividend of $0.32 per share. PACCAR also highlighted its progress in zero-emissions vehicles and the performance of its PACCAR Parts and Financial Services segments.

title: Caterpillar Inc., TACC, and NFTE: Brands in Action Series
summary: This article highlights how Caterpillar Inc., TACC (Texas Advanced Computing Center), and NFTE (Network for Teaching Entrepreneurship) are responding to community needs and global challenges like COVID-19 and social injustice. Caterpillar has committed $10M to global COVID-19 relief and $500,000 to combat racial injustice, TACC is providing advanced computing resources for pandemic research and seeking input on combating racism in STEM, and NFTE offers free online courses for career relaunch and entrepreneurial skills. These companies demonstrate adaptability and support through their resources and initiatives in uncertain times.

title: Caterpillar Acquires Marble Robot, Advances Automation Strategy
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (CAT) has acquired Marble Robot, Inc., a San Francisco-based company specializing in robot and autonomy technology, to further its automation strategy. This acquisition aims to enhance productivity and safety in construction, quarry, industrial, and waste industries by leveraging Marble Robot's expertise. Caterpillar plans to expand its autonomous offerings and build fully autonomous sites, despite facing challenges from the manufacturing slowdown and the pandemic.

title: Caterpillar Acquires Company Focused on Robot and Autonomy Technology
summary: Caterpillar has acquired select assets and hired employees from Marble Robot, Inc., a company specializing in robot and autonomy technology. This acquisition is part of Caterpillar's strategy to expand its automation and autonomy solutions, leveraging the new team's expertise to develop scalable solutions for various industries including construction, quarry, industrial, and waste. The move aims to enhance operator productivity, reduce operating costs, and improve efficiency through autonomous offerings for Caterpillar customers.

title: Cat continues to see LNG interest for large mining trucks
summary: Caterpillar is actively pursuing alternative fuel solutions for its large mining trucks, with a notable interest in liquefied natural gas (LNG). The company's Dynamic Gas Blending (DGB) conversion kits allow mining trucks to substitute diesel with LNG, potentially reducing emissions by up to 30% and costs by a similar margin. This technology is already being utilized in some mines, showing over 10 million operating hours of proven data without impacting unplanned downtime.

title: Former Caterpillar Propulsion COO buys out company
summary: Former Caterpillar Propulsion COO and shareholder Stefan Sedersten has acquired Caterpillar Propulsion and its subsidiaries through his holding company, Gula Skrinet. The deal, expected to close on June 30, includes manufacturing operations in Sweden and Singapore, and offices in Shanghai and Dubai. Sedersten aims to maintain continuity with Caterpillar customers while developing products and services for the marine sector.

title: Everything You Need to Know About the New Caterpillar 994K Wheel Loader
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has launched its largest wheel loader to date, the 994K, featuring increased payload, versatility, power, and productivity. The new model offers efficiency improvements, easier maintenance, and significantly more power, capable of carrying 40.8 tons per pass. The 994K is equipped with advanced systems like Cat MineStar™ and will be commercially available in the first quarter of 2016.

title: Caterpillar launches world’s first smartphone with thermal imaging
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has launched the CAT S60, the world's first smartphone with an integrated thermal camera from FLIR, leveraging its 90 years of experience into this new rugged device. The Android-based phone features MIL Spec 810G drop specifications, is waterproof to 16 feet, and includes a FLIR Lepton sensor for thermal imaging. This innovation represents a significant advancement in mobile thermal technology, making it smaller and more affordable.

title: From Hitachi Construction Machinery to Caterpillar Inc, See What Works Best
summary: This article compares the mining equipment offerings of two industry giants, Caterpillar Inc. and Hitachi Inc., focusing on their suitability for gold mining operations. It details the specific types of machinery each company provides for both surface and underground mining, highlighting their unique features and benefits. The article concludes that the choice between the two depends on the mining company's specific needs and preferences, as both have established strong reputations in the industry.

title: B2Gold's operations fully funded with CAT deal
summary: B2Gold Corp announced approvals for up to $120 million in Gold Prepaid Sales Financing Arrangements and signed a commitment for an $81 million Euro equivalent term mining Equipment Facility with Caterpillar Financial. These agreements, along with an increase in the Otjikoto Equipment Loan Facility, ensure the Fekola Project in Mali is fully funded and on schedule for gold production in late 2017. The company expects significant increases in gold production by 2018.

title: July to bring construction on $84M NorthWestern Energy natural gas plant in South Dakota
summary: NorthWestern Energy plans to begin construction in July on an $84 million, 58-megawatt natural gas-fired plant near Huron, S.D. Caterpillar, Inc. was chosen as the engine supplier and Fagen, Inc. for engineering, procurement, and construction. The new CAT engines will replace existing older turbines, aiming for more efficient operation and controlled emissions, with commercial operation expected by the end of 2021.

title: U.S. companies cut thousands of workers while continuing to reward shareholders during pandemic
summary: Five major U.S. companies have continued to pay out a combined $700 million in dividends to shareholders despite cutting thousands of jobs and closing plants during the coronavirus pandemic. This practice highlights a trend where companies prioritize shareholder returns even amidst significant layoffs and operational suspensions. Caterpillar, Levi Strauss, and Stanley Black & Decker are among the companies mentioned for this controversial approach.

title: Caterpillar Reports Progress on Enterprise Strategy, Sustainability
summary: Caterpillar Inc. released its 2019 Annual Report and Sustainability Report, showcasing progress on its enterprise strategy to deliver innovative products and services while building a better world for customers. The reports highlight strong operational performance, significant returns to shareholders, and a commitment to sustainability, including achieving new safety records and advancing environmental goals. The company emphasizes its dedication to creating a more sustainable future, particularly in light of the global pandemic's challenges.

title: 3M’s Mask-on Magic; Pfizer Pfalls; Caterpillar Crawls
summary: This article discusses the market's "hope-inspired" rally despite overwhelming economic indicators pointing to a downturn, highlighting the Federal Reserve's influence. It examines first-quarter earnings for 3M (NYSE: MMM), Pfizer (NYSE: PFE), and Caterpillar (NYSE: CAT), noting contrasting investor reactions to their reports. The article also touches on vaccine development and offers an investing strategy called "Profit Stacking."

title: Caterpillar Reports First-Quarter 2020 Results
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported a significant decrease in first-quarter 2020 sales and revenues by 21% to $10.6 billion, with profit per share declining by 39%. The company bolstered its financial position, ending the quarter with $7.1 billion in cash and raising additional liquidity. Despite global economic uncertainty due to COVID-19, Caterpillar is taking actions to reduce costs, ensure employee safety, and continue strategic investments.

title: Coeur’s Kensington gold mine in Alaska seeing benefits of Sandvik AutoMine and OptiMine
summary: Coeur Mining's Kensington gold mine in Alaska has implemented Sandvik's AutoMine and OptiMine solutions to improve efficiency and safety. Facing high operating costs due to its remote location, the mine sought to automate LHD operations, track equipment and personnel, and enhance data analytics. The system has exceeded expectations, with autonomous ore movement significantly increasing after initial implementation challenges.

title: Cisco Systems announces Fluidmesh Networks aquisition to widen industrial wireless solutions portfolio
summary: Cisco Systems announced its intent to acquire Fluidmesh Networks, a US-based security company specializing in wireless backhaul systems. This acquisition will expand Cisco's industrial wireless portfolio, providing robust solutions for mission-critical applications in challenging environments such as high-speed rail, mining, and manufacturing, to enhance productivity, safety, and operational efficiency. Fluidmesh’s technology allows for reliable data transfer at speeds exceeding 300 Km/h, crucial for on-the-move applications and remote operations.

title: One local company is hiring
summary: HOLT CAT announced plans to hire approximately 100 people for a new manufacturing facility opening in May. This facility will be located in the previously shuttered Caterpillar Waco Work Tools plant, which HOLT CAT purchased in February. The new hires will fill various roles including technicians, weld fabricators, and a quality control specialist.

title: The Story Behind Deere’s First Diesel Tractor
summary: This article details the 14-year development process of John Deere's first diesel tractor, the Model R, introduced in 1949. It explains the engineering challenges and solutions involved, and how the R paved the way for subsequent record-breaking diesel models like the 70, 80, and 730, establishing Deere as a leader in diesel engine tractor technology.

title: Caterpillar 797F mining truck named 'Coolest Thing Made in Illinois'
summary: Caterpillar Inc.'s 797F mining truck, produced in Decatur, has won the "Coolest Thing Made in Illinois" title in an eight-week online contest organized by the Illinois Manufacturers' Association. The truck, the world's largest mechanical truck, was chosen from over 260 nominees after more than 300,000 votes were cast. Officials praised the truck as an example of American manufacturing, innovation, and ingenuity.

title: Caterpillar Announces Updates and Response to COVID-19 and Global Business Conditions
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is providing an update on the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on its supply chain and operations, leading to temporary suspensions at certain facilities due to uncertain economic conditions. The company is withdrawing its financial outlook for 2020 and its financial results will be significantly impacted, with further updates expected in its first-quarter earnings announcement on April 28, 2020. Despite challenges, Caterpillar's financial position remains strong with $8.3 billion in cash and $10.5 billion in available global credit facilities at the end of 2019.

title: Cat to close some facilities due to coronavirus impact on demand as company withdraws 2020 outlook
summary: Caterpillar announced the temporary closure of some manufacturing facilities and withdrew its 2020 earnings outlook due to the coronavirus pandemic's impact on demand and economic uncertainty. The company cited "uncertain economic conditions resulting in weaker demand, potential supply constraints and the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic and related government actions" as reasons for the closures and withdrawal. Cat also stated it cannot reasonably estimate the total financial impact of the outbreak but assured its financial strength with $8.3 billion in cash and $10.5 billion in global credit facilities at the end of 2019.

title: Caterpillar to temporarily close Mapleton plant because of customer demand
