summary: Caterpillar Inc. is temporarily closing its Mapleton facility due to a decrease in customer demand, not concerns related to the coronavirus pandemic. This decision comes days after the company declared itself an essential business, leading to frustration among employees who were told they were needed. A spokeswoman confirmed the shutdown is part of broader actions to align production with demand across global facilities.

title: The Chief Information And Digital Officer Of AES Drives The Smart Grid And The Connected Enterprise
summary: Sanjeev Addala, Chief Information and Digital Officer of AES, discusses the company's digital transformation journey, focusing on customer-centricity, new business models, and revenue streams. He details the digital strategy across three business dimensions and five strategic themes, including connected enterprise, smart grid, and scaling a digital ecosystem. Addala also shares his perspective on the evolving CDO role and the importance of digital in driving growth and innovation for industrial companies.

title: Caterpillar Cat Command system expanded to small wheel loaders
summary: Caterpillar has expanded its Cat Command for Loading system to include its small wheel loader line (926M, 930M, and 938M models), enabling semi-autonomous remote operation. This system enhances safety in hazardous environments by allowing operators to control machines from a distance, maintaining productivity with both line-of-sight and non-line-of-sight configurations. The technology will be available for purchase in late 2020, following demonstrations at CONEXPO-CON/AGG 2020.

title: Caterpillar Posts Worst Machine Sales Since 2016
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported its largest decline in global machine sales since late 2016, indicating significant stress in the construction and mining sectors. The decline is linked to the coronavirus outbreak and its impact on global growth, causing Caterpillar's shares to drop 38% this year, marking its worst start since 2009. This signals broader economic challenges for industries supplied by Caterpillar.

title: Caterpillar considering closure of historic longwall & hydraulic shovel factories in Germany
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is considering closing its historic longwall and hydraulic shovel factories in Luenen, Wuppertal, and Dortmund, Germany, as part of a restructuring to improve competitiveness and remove structural costs. The closures would impact facilities with a significant legacy in mining technology, including the birthplace of the coal mining plow and early steam-powered excavators. Despite these potential closures, Caterpillar affirms its commitment to customers through its dealers.

title: Farmers Fight John Deere Over Who Gets to Fix an $800,000 Tractor
summary: Farmers are engaging in a "right-to-repair" movement against John Deere and other equipment manufacturers, demanding access to the copyrighted software that controls modern agricultural machinery. Kevin Kenney is leading a grassroots campaign to allow farmers to repair their own expensive equipment, challenging the manufacturers' exclusive control over diagnostics and repairs. This fight highlights concerns about corporate monopolies and the erosion of self-reliance in the agricultural community.

title: Caterpillar Announces Appointment of New Vice President
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced the appointment of Pam Heminger as a new company vice president, responsible for the Strategic Procurement Division, effective April 6, 2020. Heminger brings over 30 years of strategic procurement experience from the automotive and manufacturing sectors, including her recent role as Vice President of North American Purchasing for Honda of America. This appointment is expected to enhance Caterpillar's procurement standards and capabilities.

title: Caterpillar Announces Appointment of New Vice President
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the appointment of Pam Heminger as a new company vice president, specifically leading the Strategic Procurement Division. Heminger, with over 30 years of experience in strategic procurement, will begin her role on April 6, 2020. This appointment aims to enhance Caterpillar's enterprise-wide procurement standards and capabilities.

title: Carter Machinery to Acquire Baltimore-Based Alban Tractor Co., Inc.
summary: Carter Machinery, a Caterpillar dealer based in Salem, Va., announced an agreement to acquire the assets of Baltimore-based Alban Tractor Co., Inc., effective February 4, 2020. This acquisition will expand Carter Machinery's service territory to include Northern Virginia, Washington D.C., Maryland, and Delaware, strengthening its position in key industries like construction and mining. Carter Machinery aims to build on Alban Tractor's strong reputation in heavy equipment and power systems while ensuring seamless transitions and uninterrupted service for new customers.

title: Caterpillar Reports Fourth-Quarter and Full-Year 2019 Results; Provides Outlook for 2020
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced its fourth-quarter and full-year 2019 financial results, reporting an 8% decrease in Q4 sales and revenues but strong operating cash flow. The company returned $6.2 billion to shareholders in 2019 and provided a 2020 profit per share outlook of $8.50 to $10.00, anticipating continued global economic uncertainty. Despite challenges, Caterpillar emphasized its focus on cost control, investments in services, and execution of its profitable growth strategy.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Retirement
summary: E. Jean Savage, VP of Caterpillar's Surface Mining & Technology Division, is retiring effective Feb. 14, 2020. She will become CEO and president of Trinity Industries, Inc. Savage spent 17 years at Caterpillar, holding various leadership roles in their Progress Rail, Advanced Components and Systems, and Innovation and Technology divisions.

title: Serving Customers With Passion and Pride in Mexico
summary: Caterpillar has a long-standing history in Mexico, beginning with the Holt Manufacturing Company selling its first product there in 1897. This article highlights key moments in Caterpillar's presence, from supporting massive infrastructure projects like the Huites Hydroelectric Dam to establishing manufacturing facilities and dealerships, demonstrating a continued commitment to Mexican customers and economy. Today, Caterpillar, along with Cat Financial and Solar Turbines, continues to support various industries in Mexico with high-quality products and services.

title: Capital Drilling bolsters Bonikro gold mine operation with new equipment
summary: Capital Drilling has commissioned new equipment at the Bonikro gold mine in Côte d’Ivoire to supplement Allied Gold’s fleet, following being awarded a mining services contract in October 2019. The company reported a 4.8% quarter-on-quarter revenue increase to $30.7 million in the December quarter and an increase in cash flow generation to $4.4 million, driven by new contract start-ups primarily in West Africa. Capital Drilling expects 2020 contract revenues from Bonikro to be around $15 million and plans to spend $20 million on capex in 2020.

title: Trinity Industries names new CEO
summary: Trinity Industries has appointed E. Jean Savage as its new CEO and president. She is set to join the company in mid-February, bringing with her extensive leadership experience from Catepillar.

title: Trinity Industries names new chief executive officer
summary: Trinity Industries (NYSE: TRN) has appointed E. Jean Savage as its new chief executive officer and president, effective February 17, 2020. Savage, previously a vice president at Caterpillar and a current Trinity board member, will lead the company following a period of interim leadership. Her appointment comes amidst a challenging rail industry landscape marked by volume declines and systemic changes.

title: Trinity Industries turns to its board of directors for its next CEO
summary: Dallas-based Trinity Industries has named E. Jean Savage, a current board member and former Caterpillar executive, as its new CEO, effective February 17. Savage brings 17 years of experience from Caterpillar Inc., where she served as vice president of the surface mining and technology division. She replaces Timothy Wallace, who retired at the end of 2019, and will also remain on Trinity’s board.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Retirement
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the retirement of E. Jean Savage, Vice President of the Surface Mining & Technology Division, effective February 14, 2020. Savage has been appointed Chief Executive Officer and President of Trinity Industries, Inc., starting February 17, 2020. She served Caterpillar for 17 years in various leadership roles.

title: Sysco selects new c.e.o.
summary: Sysco Corp. has appointed Kevin P. Hourican as its new president and chief executive officer, effective Feb. 1, succeeding Thomas L. Bené. Hourican joins Sysco from CVS Health and will lead the food service distribution company. Additionally, Edward D. Shirley has been elected executive chair and Bradley M. Halverson as the new lead independent director.

title: Sysco CEO Tom Bene to step down
summary: Sysco CEO Tom Bene is stepping down at the end of January 2020 and will be replaced by former CVS Health executive Kevin Hourican. Bene will remain an executive adviser until March, while Ed Shirley and Brad Halverson assume new roles on the board. The change aims to accelerate Sysco's performance and capitalize on its scale advantages.

title: Hourican leaving CVS to head Sysco
summary: Kevin Hourican, president of CVS Pharmacy, is departing CVS Health to become the president and CEO of Sysco Corp. He will succeed Tom Bené at Sysco. The move is expected to accelerate Sysco's performance and capitalize on its scale advantages, with the board highlighting Hourican's expertise in sales, supply chain, logistics, operations, and digital technologies.

title: Deere bets on cost cuts, services push to boost profits
summary: Deere & Co. announced plans to cut costs and increase investment in data-driven agriculture technology and its services business to improve profitability. The company aims to boost its operating profit margin to 15% by 2022 from 12.5% projected for the current year, despite expected declines in farm equipment sales in its largest markets. These strategic moves, including a voluntary separation program for salaried employees, are intended to smooth earning volatility amidst a slump in the U.S. manufacturing sector and ongoing trade tensions.

title: The Notable Figure of Tractor Industry, Chandra Mohan Passes Away
summary: Chandra Mohan, a notable figure in the Indian tractor industry who led Punjab Tractors Ltd (PTL) for over three decades, has passed away at 86. Mohan, a Padma Shri awardee, founded Swaraj tractor, which played a crucial role in India's green revolution. PTL was later acquired by Mahindra Group in 2007.

title: New Boeing boss seen as tough veteran used to dealing with crises
summary: David Calhoun has been named the new CEO of Boeing, taking the helm during the biggest crisis in the company's history following two fatal 737 MAX crashes. Calhoun, an industrial veteran experienced in leading companies through crises, faces the challenge of repairing relations with regulators, managing financial pressures, and restoring trust in the aerospace giant. His appointment comes as Boeing grapples with continued fallout from the grounding of the 737 MAX and the recent firing of its previous CEO, Dennis Muilenburg.

title: Global Strategy
summary: Caterpillar's global strategy is centered on profitable growth, guided by its Operating & Execution Model and core values. The strategy emphasizes engaging with people, partners, and customers, focusing on services, expanded product offerings, and operational excellence, all while committing to sustainability. The company aims to double its ME&T services sales to $28 billion by 2026.

title: Caterpillar Celebrates 90 Years on the New York Stock Exchange
summary: Caterpillar Inc. celebrated its 90th anniversary of listing on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) with CEO Jim Umpleby ringing the opening bell. The company is among only three percent of NYSE-listed companies to have been consecutively listed for 90 years or more. To mark the occasion, Caterpillar showcased advanced construction excavator simulators and Cat machines, highlighting its historical success and commitment to shareholders.

title: Disappointment at Deere
summary: Deere & Co. announced a depressed outlook for fiscal 2020, projecting net income no higher than $3.1 billion, which is below analyst models and led to a stock price drop. The disappointment stems from an expected 5-10% slump in global agricultural and turf equipment sales next year, reflecting political and trade uncertainty. While a voluntary separation program aims to save $150 million annually, the company is cautious about aggressive restructuring due to the unpredictable market.

title: “DJD” ETF Offers Dividend-Paying Equities Exposure
summary: The article highlights the Invesco Dow Jones Industrial Average Dividend ETF (DJD) as a means for investors to gain exposure to dividend-paying equities, particularly in an environment of low Treasury yields. It notes DJD's outperformance compared to the S&P 500, its lower P/E ratio, and its focus on large-cap value equities with a history of consistent dividends. Other dividend-focused ETFs like FlexShares Quality Dividend Dynamic Index Fund (QDYN) and ProShares S&P 500 Aristocrats ETF (NOBL) are also mentioned as viable alternatives for income investors.

title: The role of British universities in supporting Israel’s demolitions of Palestinian Homes
summary: This article investigates the partnerships between British universities and companies implicated in Israel's policy of demolishing Palestinian homes. It highlights the involvement of JCB, Caterpillar, HSBC, and Volvo, detailing how their equipment or investments contribute to these demolitions. The piece also names specific UK universities that have collaborations or investments with these companies and calls for action to end these partnerships.

title: California medtech exec brings his expertise home
summary: Medtech entrepreneur Kim Blickenstaff, former CEO of Tandem Diabetes Care, Inc., is bringing his expertise and passion for innovation back to central Illinois. After a successful career in medical device development, including co-founding Biosite Inc. and leading Tandem to create groundbreaking diabetic management technology, Blickenstaff is now focusing on real estate development and fostering a burgeoning medtech industry in Peoria, aiming to create jobs and community wealth. He emphasizes team-oriented problem-solving and leveraging his credibility in the investment community to help new companies in his hometown succeed.

title: Perkins Engines Company announces leadership changes
summary: Perkins Engines Company, a Caterpillar Inc. subsidiary, announced key leadership changes. David Nicoll has been appointed product manager of the Industrial Large Engine department, leading global strategy and lifecycle management. Jason Kern will succeed Nicoll as the marketing and channel development director, responsible for global marketing and rental strategies and the Perkins Distributor Excellence programme.

title: What Makes United Rentals Attractive?
summary: United Rentals is positioned as a clear leader in the North American equipment rental market, holding a 13% share. The company's strategy includes leveraging its national presence, advanced technology, and acquisition-heavy business model to expand market share and pricing power. Morningstar rates the stock as 4-star, trading 25% below its fair value estimate of $185, presenting an attractive entry point for investors.

title: Thermo Fisher invests to boost production of cell culture media
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific is investing nearly $24 million in its Inchinnan, Scotland, biologics site to enhance its capacity for manufacturing cell culture media, with completion expected in 2021. This investment is part of larger capital expenditures for 2019, totaling $270 million, focusing on various global operations including fill-finish, distribution, and gene therapy manufacturing. The company also recently acquired Brammer Bio to bolster its presence in gene therapy.

title: Caterpillar Inc. announces layoffs at plant in South Texas
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced layoffs for 120 employees at its Victoria, Texas plant, citing "market conditions" after missing analyst forecasts for its third-quarter financial results. The company's revenue and sales declined about 6%, with a significant drop in Asia, particularly China. This follows a recent announcement of outsourcing jobs from its Peoria, Illinois facility.

title: Construction Company Caterpillar Wants To Mine the Moon
summary: Construction giant Caterpillar is exploring the possibility of adapting its autonomous mining technology for use on the moon. This initiative comes as NASA continues to invest in in-situ resource utilization for future lunar missions, aiming to convert mined materials on location to support a sustainable presence on the moon. The technology, which has significantly improved safety and productivity in terrestrial mining, faces new challenges in the space environment, such as cosmic radiation and micrometeorite strikes.

title: Great Depression helped forge modern-day Caterpillar
summary: This article details how the Great Depression, despite its severity, played a crucial role in shaping Caterpillar into the global company it is today. Innovation, particularly the adoption of diesel engines and a shift from agricultural focus to earth-moving, allowed the company to thrive during an economic downturn. Strategic management decisions, including investing in R&D and listing on the NYSE, along with visual branding changes, further propelled Caterpillar's growth and stability during this period.

title: 5 Ways Renting Construction Equipment Saves Contractors Money
summary: Renting construction equipment is becoming increasingly popular among contractors due to significant cost savings compared to purchasing. The article outlines five key financial benefits, including lower upfront costs, reduced liability, optimized usage, decreased upkeep and downtime, and avoidance of storage and transportation fees. Rental companies, like United Rentals, are also actively working to enhance customer satisfaction by leveraging data and feedback to provide better services.

title: Caterpillar earnings down for second time in as many quarters
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported lower-than-expected sales and revenues for the third quarter of 2019, marking the second consecutive quarter of declining earnings. The company's profit per share also decreased, leading to a lowered full-year profit outlook, primarily due to shrinking global demand and dealers reducing inventories. CEO Jim Umpleby acknowledged the challenges but expressed optimism about the company's ability to respond to future economic developments.

title: Caterpillar Reports Third-Quarter 2019 Results
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported a 6% decrease in third-quarter 2019 sales and revenues, totaling $12.8 billion, with profit per share down to $2.66. The company lowered its full-year profit per share outlook to $10.90 to $11.40 due to dealer inventory reductions and lower end-user demand. Despite challenges, Caterpillar emphasized its focus on executing strategy, achieving Investor Day targets for margin improvement, and maintaining a flexible cost structure.

title: Caterpillar’s profit outlook down: Is global economy declining?
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported a drop in Q3 sales in the US and China, leading the company to cut its full-year outlook, adding to concerns about a global economic decline. The machinery maker noted the impact of the US-China trade war and weakening construction orders. This performance raises questions about the global economic trajectory and how the market will value Caterpillar's shares moving forward.

title: Fracking Slowdown Weighs on Caterpillar as Sales of Pumps Drop
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (CAT) is experiencing a negative impact from the slowdown in U.S. shale fracking, resulting in decreased sales of its pumping units. The company reported a decline in third-quarter sales of reciprocating engines, with oil and gas-related revenue in its energy and transportation segment dropping about 9% year-on-year, marking the steepest slide across its primary categories. This indicates the significant effect of the energy sector's current conditions on heavy machinery manufacturers.

title: Stocks stall as Boeing, Caterpillar earnings miss
summary: Stocks ended Wednesday with little change after disappointing earnings reports from industrial giants Boeing and Caterpillar. Caterpillar missed expectations for earnings and revenue due to global trade uncertainty, while Boeing's third-quarter sales dropped due to the 737 Max grounding, impacting its adjusted earnings significantly. Despite these misses, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500, and Nasdaq saw slight gains.

title: Cat Financial
summary: Cat Financial is the financial services division of Caterpillar Inc., established in 1981 to support Caterpillar, Cat dealers, and customers with financing solutions. It offers retail and wholesale financing, as well as extended protection products for Cat machinery, engines, Solar gas turbines, and other related equipment. Cat Financial emphasizes its close ties to Caterpillar's operations and global dealer network, providing a streamlined process for equipment acquisition, financing, and protection.

title: Caterpillar or Deere: Which Heavy-Equipment Manufacturer Is A Better Bet?
summary: This article compares the heavy-equipment manufacturers Caterpillar and Deere, analyzing their revenues, operating margins, and key financial metrics. It concludes that Caterpillar is larger and more profitable, demonstrating better resource utilization than Deere. Both companies are expected to achieve steady growth due to their strong fundamentals and market outreach.

title: Caterpillar makes a splash at SPI 2019 with its Hybrid Energy Solutions
summary: Caterpillar Inc. participated in Solar Power International and Energy Storage International at North America Smart Energy Week to promote its hybrid energy solutions for the U.S. solar and storage sectors. The company highlighted its range of technologies, including the Cat Master Microgrid Controller, Cat Connect Remote Asset Monitoring, Cat Bi-Directional Power inverters, the Cat Energy Storage System, and Cat photovoltaic solar modules, all designed to offer robust, reliable, and cost-effective power systems. These solutions aim to provide lower energy costs, improved power quality, reduced emissions, and increased energy resiliency for commercial and industrial customers.

title: Thompson Machinery, Caterpillar Dealer in Tennessee and Mississippi, Celebrates 75 Years
summary: Thompson Machinery, a Caterpillar dealer serving Middle and West Tennessee and North Mississippi, is celebrating its 75th anniversary. The company was founded in 1944 by DeWitt Thompson Jr. and George Green, who were selected by Caterpillar due to their strong philosophy of customer service. Through four generations of leadership, Thompson Machinery has grown significantly while maintaining its commitment to employees and customers.

title: BNSF, NS advance more modern locomotives
summary: BNSF Railway and Norfolk Southern are making technological advancements in locomotive operations. BNSF is collaborating with Wabtec to develop and test a battery-electric high-horsepower road locomotive, aiming for environmental and fuel-usage benefits through hybrid consist operation. Meanwhile, Norfolk Southern is utilizing virtual locomotives in a simulation environment at its PTC lab to test positive train control systems more efficiently and cost-effectively.

title: Truck Makers Apply the Brakes
summary: Truck makers are experiencing a significant decline in orders, contributing to the slowdown in the U.S. manufacturing sector. After a strong year in 2018 driven by high freight demand, trade tensions and slower global growth are now depressing freight volumes and causing a drop in new truck purchases. As a result, freight rates have fallen over 20% from their peak in June 2018.

title: Trump’s Steel Industry Claims
summary: This article debunks President Trump's claims about the U.S. steel industry's transformation under his policies. While tariffs did benefit domestic steel producers by increasing prices and production, the article clarifies that the industry was not "dead" prior to his presidency, new mills had been built, and job growth was modest and influenced by technology. The piece analyzes the actual impact on production, prices, imports, capacity, and employment, concluding that Trump significantly exaggerated the changes.

title: Read This Before Selling Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE:CAT) Shares
summary: This article examines insider transactions at Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE:CAT), noting a significant purchase by Group President Bob De Lange within the last year at a price close to current levels. While insider ownership is only 0.1%, the analysis suggests that insider sentiment remains positive, indicating no doubt about the company's future from those within.

title: Cat Financial launches India operations with Bangalore office
summary: Caterpillar Financial Services India (Cat Financial India) officially launched its operations on July 1, 2019, headquartered in Bangalore. This new venture aims to provide customized financial services for Cat products, supporting customers in the Indian construction industry. The expansion marks Cat Financial's 41st global location, emphasizing its commitment to growth in emerging markets and offering competitive financial solutions.

title: Why Did Caterpillar Stock Rise 2X in 3 Years?
summary: Caterpillar's stock more than doubled in value over three years, rising from under $60 to around $135 per share by July 2019. This growth was attributed to improved operating margins, strong revenue growth driven by the construction and resource industries, and a positive correlation with increasing metal and energy prices. The article concludes that despite the rally, the stock offered a sizable upside based on strong commodity fundamentals and potential infrastructure legislation.

title: Caterpillar paid $70M in tariffs last quarter
summary: Caterpillar incurred $70 million in tariffs in Q2 2019, contributing to a $328 million increase in manufacturing costs, according to CFO Andrew Bonfield. Despite these costs and weaker-than-expected earnings, the company managed to cover higher manufacturing costs through price realization and cost-cutting measures, including redesigning machines and reducing overall manufacturing costs by at least 5%. The article also notes the broader economic context of slowing manufacturing growth and global trade tensions affecting the OEM.

title: US manufacturing flirts with recession despite output rising in June
summary: US manufacturing output rose by 0.4% in June, its biggest monthly gain since December, but still resulted in a contraction for the second quarter as a whole. Both official data and PMI surveys indicate two consecutive quarters of falling output, meeting the technical definition of a manufacturing recession. Weak order book growth and deteriorating business sentiment, especially among larger companies, suggest that production growth will likely remain weak into the third quarter, which could influence future Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) rate decisions.

title: Nick in the AM: Joliet Caterpillar factory becomes a part of history
summary: The article discusses the closing of Caterpillar's Joliet factory on June 30, marking the end of nearly 70 years of production in the area after a four-year process of moving production to Mexico. While Caterpillar was once a major employer, its departure is expected to have minimal economic impact due to its gradual nature and Amazon now being the largest employer in Joliet. The Joliet Area Historical Museum features an exhibit acknowledging Caterpillar's historical presence in the city.

title: Fastenal's Q2 results could predict trouble for manufacturing sector
summary: Fastenal's Q2 earnings report, despite the company remaining a top performer, showed sales growth below expectations, leading to concerns about a slowdown in the manufacturing sector. The company's CFO highlighted the disappointing growth rate compared to previous quarters, and CEO Dan Florness addressed strategies for navigating a slowed business environment. The article suggests that Fastenal's performance serves as an important indicator for the broader industrial economy, and its recent results mirror the “uncertainty” expressed by Federal Reserve Board Chairman Jerome Powell regarding the economic outlook.

title: 100-year-old tractor's legacy still shines for Caterpillar Inc.
summary: This article highlights the 100th anniversary of the Best 60 Tracklayer tractor, a machine instrumental in the merger that created Caterpillar Inc. and its subsequent global success in heavy equipment. The Best 60's reliability and quality helped transition the company from agriculture to earth-moving projects, participating in major constructions like the Hoover Dam, and its legacy continues to influence modern Caterpillar designs.

title: The Heavy Equipment Industry: Comparing the cultures of Deere & Co, Caterpillar, Xerox, Baker Hughes, and Parker Hannifin
summary: This article by Comparably analyzes the corporate cultures of five heavy equipment industry companies: Baker Hughes, Caterpillar, Deere & Company, Parker Hannifin, and Xerox. The comparison, based on employee-submitted data, covers overall culture, CEO leadership, compensation, perks & benefits, and diversity, highlighting areas where these traditional companies need to adapt to modern workplace practices. Deere & Co. consistently performed best among the group, though the overall industry showed room for improvement in fostering healthy corporate cultures and employee retention.

title: Caterpillar sets up Bermuda captive, could create premium savings of 15%
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is establishing a Bermuda captive to fund its employee benefits program, anticipating annual premium savings of 10 to 15 percent. This move is expected to enhance global governance, centralize control, and offer greater plan design flexibility for the manufacturing giant. Darin Hinderman, Global Benefits Manager for Caterpillar, discussed these plans at the Bermuda Captive Conference.

title: Women in Engineering: Roz Buick, Trimble Vice President
summary: This article features Roz Buick, Vice President of Trimble Buildings, detailing her 23-year career at Trimble, a global company specializing in location-based software solutions. Buick, a native New Zealander, discusses her professional journey through the Agriculture, Civil Engineering & Construction, and now Buildings divisions, highlighting her emphasis on teamwork, leadership, and advocating for women in the workplace. She shares insights from her diverse background, including her early life on a farm and her academic pursuits in computer modeling and plant physiology, emphasizing the importance of confidence and continuous learning.

title: Caterpillar Inc. is trying to stop a tiny café from using the word cat
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is engaged in a trademark dispute with a small Santa Cruz coffee shop called Cat & Cloud, seeking to prevent them from using the name on apparel and footwear. Cat & Cloud has launched a GoFundMe to fund their legal defense, stating that Caterpillar is trying to claim ownership of the word "cat." Caterpillar maintains it is only protecting its existing trademarks on specific product categories and is not targeting the coffee business itself.

title: Cat & Cloud Create GoFundMe For Trademark Litigation With Caterpillar
summary: Cat & Cloud, a Santa Cruz coffee shop, has launched a GoFundMe campaign to raise $50,000 for their legal defense in a trademark dispute with Caterpillar Inc. The coffee shop claims Caterpillar is attempting to cancel their Class 25 trademark, which covers clothing, footwear, and headgear. They view Caterpillar's actions as a "needless attack on our American Dream" and hope to bring mainstream media attention to their cause.

title: Steven H. Wunning is elected as lead director at Sherwin-Williams Co.
summary: The Sherwin-Williams Co. announced that Steven H. Wunning has been elected as its new lead director, effective immediately. Wunning, a former group president of Caterpillar Inc., succeeds John M. Stropki, who recently passed away. Additionally, Susan J. Kropf has been appointed chair of the Compensation and Management Development Committee, taking over from Wunning.

title: Is a construction company right in suing a cafe over the word cat?
summary: Caterpillar, the multi-billion dollar construction equipment giant, has filed a cease-and-desist order against a small Santa Cruz coffee shop, Cat & Cloud Coffee, for using the word "Cat" on its apparel. The article questions the company's decision, comparing it to Disney's inaction against a small dry-cleaning business using a Disney character, and highlights the public and the coffee shop's frustration. It suggests that such disputes often come down to economic sense rather than who is "right or wrong."

title: Funrise to Create Caterpillar Construction Toys
summary: Funrise has secured a multi-year licensing agreement with Caterpillar to produce and market a new line of realistic toy construction machines. The toys will feature various styles, sounds, lights, radio control, and different scales, suitable for ages 3 and up. This partnership aims to bring the dynamic world of Caterpillar to kids while promoting educational and creative play.

title: USDOT Secretary Elaine Chao sells stock in Vulcan Materials after conflict of interest questioned
summary: USDOT Secretary Elaine Chao sold her stock in Vulcan Materials after public questioning regarding a potential conflict of interest. This sale followed previous reports that Chao had earned $40,000 from Vulcan stock since 2017 despite indicating she would divest, with ethics officials asserting no conflict existed despite the company's lobbying efforts. The divestment brought Secretary Chao between $250,000 and $500,000.

title: Cat and Cloud Coffee in Santa Cruz facing trademark controversy against Caterpillar Inc.
summary: Cat and Cloud Coffee in Santa Cruz is embroiled in a trademark dispute with Caterpillar Inc. over the use of the word "CAT." Caterpillar Inc., which holds a trademark for "CAT," issued a cease and desist to the coffee shop, primarily concerning footwear and apparel. Cat and Cloud Coffee owners are resisting the demands, citing the significant financial and operational impact of the legal battle and the unlikelihood of consumer confusion between the two vastly different businesses.

title: Cat & Cloud Is Being Sued By Caterpillar Inc.
summary: Cat & Cloud, a coffee company founded by Chris Baca and Jared Truby, is being sued by Caterpillar Inc. for trademark infringement. Caterpillar, a major construction equipment manufacturer with 2018 revenue exceeding $54 billion, owns the trademark for "CAT," while Cat & Cloud holds the trademark for their name in the coffee sector. The coffee company plans to fight what they consider a frivolous lawsuit, leading to a Change.org petition supporting them.

title: Caterpillar Reports Progress on Enterprise Strategy, Sustainability
summary: Caterpillar Inc. released its 2018 Annual Report and Sustainability Report, both titled "Let's Do the Work," detailing its progress on enterprise strategy execution. The reports highlight the company's commitment to sustainable solutions, benefiting customers, dealers, employees, shareholders, and communities. Caterpillar Chairman and CEO Jim Umpleby emphasized the company's focus on profitable growth and shareholder value while investing in a better world.

title: Caterpillar Gains on Mining, Construction Strength
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported better-than-expected first-quarter revenue driven by strong demand for its mining and construction equipment, leading to an increase in its stock. This performance suggests a stabilization in some global economic sectors after earlier signs of slower growth and addresses investor concerns regarding demand and higher costs. The machinery giant also raised its prices alongside beating revenue expectations.

title: U.S. tractor maker AGCO rolls out Fendt line for Brazil farmers
summary: U.S. agricultural machine maker AGCO Corp announced it will launch its Fendt line of equipment in Brazil this year, targeting large soybean farmers. The company plans to introduce high-power tractors initially, with larger planters and harvesters produced in Brazil to follow next year. This initiative aims to provide farmers with equipment designed to increase speed and efficiency for growing two crops per year in Brazil's grain heartland.

title: Terex sells US crane assets
summary: Terex has sold the assets and parts business of its boom truck, truck crane, and Crossover crane product lines to Load King, a subsidiary of Custom Truck One Source. This move aligns with Terex's "Focus, Simplify and Execute to Win" strategy, allowing them to concentrate on businesses with strong market positions like Rough Terrain and tower cranes. The acquisition is seen as a strategic fit for Custom Truck One Source, backed by Blackstone, potentially making them a significant player in the North American crane business.

title: Caterpillar signs agreement to sell purpose-built forestry business
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has entered into a definitive agreement to sell its purpose-built forestry business to Weiler Forestry Inc., with the deal expected to close in Q3 2019. Caterpillar will continue to offer forestry excavators and other core equipment, while Weiler will acquire the purpose-built product line and operations in LaGrange, Ga., Auburn, Ala., and Smithfield, N.C. Weiler Forestry will design and produce these products, which will be available through the Cat dealer network.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Changes
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced several officer changes effective May 1, 2019, to support its enterprise strategy with an emphasis on services. Tom Bluth will transition to Vice President of Legal Aftermarket Support, Karl Weiss will lead the Innovation & Technology Development Division and serve as Chief Technology Officer, and Rob Hoenes has been appointed Vice President of the Material Handling & Underground Division. These changes highlight a focus on intellectual property protection, technology development, and market understanding.

title: Gradall Showcases TrackStar and Rough-terrain Wheeled Excavators at bauma 2019
summary: Gradall Industries Inc. is showcasing its TrackStar Railway Maintenance Machines and the XL 4300V rubber-tire hydraulic excavator at bauma 2019 in Munich, Germany. These machines, co-exhibited with Rivard, offer versatility for construction and maintenance jobs with their low-profile telescoping, tilting booms and a wide range of attachments. The TrackStar machines are particularly adept at rail repair and maintenance, featuring two rail gear systems for efficient travel and enhanced stability.

title: Caterpillar go large at bauma 2019
summary: Caterpillar showcased its widest-ever range of equipment, technology, and services at bauma 2019, the world's largest construction equipment show. The display featured Next Generation Cat machines with advanced automation and digital solutions, including new electric-drive models like the D6 XE dozer and a concept electric wheel loader. Caterpillar emphasized significant advancements in fuel efficiency, productivity, and reduced owning and operating costs through their innovative offerings.

title: Caterpillar dealer Yancey Bros. plans big new Forsyth County facility
summary: Yancey Bros. Co., the nation's oldest Caterpillar dealer, is planning a significant new facility in Forsyth County, Georgia. The proposed site for this expansion is located on the west side of Georgia 400 at the intersection with Hubbard Town Road, approximately 10 miles north of Cumming. This move indicates a major investment and expansion for the company in the Atlanta business region.

title: Maxam MS302 OTR tyre receives Caterpillar OEM approval
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has approved the Maxam MS302 L3 tyre for specific Cat medium wheel loaders in size 23.5R25, making it available as a factory fitment option in certain regions. The MS302 tyre is engineered for extreme conditions, offering excellent traction and heat resistance, and aims to minimize vibration and reduce cost per hour. Maxam also provides global dealer servicing support for its specialty tyres, which are manufactured with advanced construction.

title: Heavy equipment rental companies seek tax breaks
summary: Heavy equipment rental companies, led by United Rentals, are lobbying the Florida Legislature for a $30-million tax break by seeking to reclassify their rental equipment as "inventory" to make it exempt from property taxes. This effort is part of a nationwide push, with the industry arguing that current taxes discourage capital investment and equipment storage in Florida. Despite initial success in a Senate committee, the bill's sponsor decided to remove the provision due to constitutional concerns, though the industry continues to lobby other lawmakers.

title: Ainsworth named Caterpillar group president
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced leadership changes to accelerate its growth strategy. Billy Ainsworth was promoted to group president of the Energy and Transportation segment, while Marty Haycraft succeeded him as vice president of Caterpillar’s Rail Division and CEO of Progress Rail. The company also restructured its Global Power Solutions Divisions into two new industry-focused divisions.

title: Gulf Island delivers Z-drive tug to Suderman & Young
summary: Gulf Island Shipyards delivered the Z-Tech 30-80-class terminal/escort tug Ted C. Litton to Suderman & Young Towing Co. The tug, designed by Robert Allan Ltd., features Caterpillar 3516E engines and Schottel SRP 510 FP Z-drives, providing an 80-tonne bollard pull. Gulf Island is currently building eight sister tugs for Bay-Houston Towing Co. and Suderman & Young.

title: Maxam MS302 Approved by Catepillar as New OEM Tire Option
summary: Maxam Tire North America announced that Caterpillar Inc. has validated and approved the Maxam MS302 L3 tire for use on specific Cat Medium Wheel Loaders. The Maxam 23.5R25 MS302 is now available as a factory fitment option on several Cat models in certain regions, with additional sizes approved for future fitment. Maxam highlights the tire's rugged design, excellent traction, and high heat resistance for demanding conditions.

title: Cat 797F meets tier 4 final configuration
summary: Caterpillar's Cat 797F large mining truck is now available in a fuel-efficient configuration that meets U.S. EPA Tier 4 Final emissions standards. This configuration has demonstrated strong performance and greater fuel efficiency compared to the Tier 2 797F, utilizing an exhaust aftertreatment system with selective catalytic reduction. The 797F continues to deliver class-leading payload and speed-on-grade performance while reducing total specific fluid consumption costs.

title: MAXAM MS302 approved by Caterpillar as new OEM tire option
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has approved the MAXAM MS302 L3 tire as a new OEM factory fitment option for specific Cat Medium Wheel Loaders, including the 950GC, 950L, 950M, 962L, and 962M in certain regions. The MAXAM MS302 features a rugged E3/L3+ heavy-duty design for maximum traction, high heat resistance, and aims to minimize vibration and provide a low cost per hour due to its durable, cut, and tear-resistant rubber compound. This approval highlights MAXAM's growing presence in the heavy equipment tire market.

title: Heatec
summary: Heatec, a company specializing in heaters and liquid storage tanks, has significantly expanded its market beyond asphalt plants to include diverse industrial applications. A subsidiary of Astec Industries, Heatec is known for the quality and customizability of its products, in-house manufacturing, and specialized workforce. The company is actively pursuing international expansion and growth through acquisitions to further diversify its business.

title: Caterpillar creates world's largest game of Jenga
summary: Caterpillar, a construction equipment manufacturer, set a Guinness World Record for the largest game of Jenga using two of its large machines. The game involved 27 laminated pine beams, each weighing about 600 pounds, and lasted for 28 hours, reaching a maximum height of about 20 feet. The initiative was part of Caterpillar's educational efforts to showcase their machines at work, with collaboration from Hasbro.

title: South Milwaukee's former long-time Bucyrus/Caterpillar buildings begin redevelopment for new uses
summary: Former Bucyrus/Caterpillar buildings in South Milwaukee, covering 28 acres with around 550,000 square feet of industrial space and 250,000 square feet of offices, are being redeveloped by Reich Brothers LLC. The project aims to bring new industrial companies and other businesses to the underused site, with significant interest from heavy manufacturing due to available power and crane capacity. The city is also involved through a tax incremental financing district to support public improvements and generate new property values.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Changes
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced several officer changes effective March 1, 2019, including shifts in responsibilities for executive office members and new vice presidents. Tom Pellette will return to lead Solar Turbines, Ramin Younessi will head Construction Industries, and Billy Ainsworth will lead the Energy & Transportation segment. The company also created two new industry-focused divisions: Oil, Gas and Marine, and Electric Power, and appointed new Vice Presidents for its Rail Division and Finance Services Division.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Changes
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced several officer changes effective March 1, 2019, including shifts in responsibilities for three Executive Office members, new roles for two current vice presidents, and the appointment of two new vice presidents. These changes aim to accelerate the company's strategy for continued profitable growth. Key moves include Tom Pellette returning to Solar Turbines, Ramin Younessi leading Construction Industries, and Billy Ainsworth becoming Group President of Energy & Transportation.

title: Equipment company Caterpillar Inc. to expand in Chicago
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is expanding its Chicago office and digital team to attract top tech talent. The company aims to innovate its products and services by developing apps for equipment maintenance and expanding e-commerce operations, demonstrating its focus on digital transformation. This move is critical for the future of Caterpillar as customer expectations evolve, requiring the company to offer sophisticated digital tools similar to those used in daily life.

title: Delivering to the bottom line
summary: The article discusses the success and expansion plans for the SEM brand in South Africa, represented by Barloworld SEM. It highlights SEM's growth, new product launches at bauma CHINA 2018, and its strategy for catering to developing markets with value-for-money, quality earthmoving equipment. The piece also details Barloworld SEM's commitment to after-sales support, flexible financing, and expanding its dealer network and product offerings for 2019.

title: Early Look at Year-End Warranty Data, 14 February 2019
summary: This article provides an early look at year-end warranty data from companies with fiscal years ending earlier than December, focusing on the Hewlett-Packard family (HP Inc., HPE, Agilent), Deere, Navistar, and Toro. It highlights trends in claims and accrual rates, discusses the impact of ASC 606 revisions on warranty reporting, and notes that early reporting indicates an increase in claims and accruals for a significant portion of companies. The article anticipates further insights as more annual reports become available.

title: Fisher, Freissle, Sidney, Tyler inducted into P&Q Hall of Fame
summary: Four aggregate industry leaders – Gene Fisher of Fisher Industries, Manfred Freissle of Polydeck, George Sidney of McLanahan Corp., and Washington Samuel Tyler of W.S. Tyler/Haver & Boecker – were inducted into the Pit & Quarry Hall of Fame. The induction ceremony celebrated their significant contributions to the aggregate industry, including innovations in equipment design, screening technology, and manufacturing processes. Their legacies continue to impact the industry through the companies they founded or led and their pioneering developments.

title: Caterpillar expands its technology presence in Chicago
summary: Caterpillar has expanded its technology presence in Chicago by opening a new digital technology office in the West Loop Gate neighborhood. This expansion follows a "Dirt & Digital" lab hosted by the company in Chicago in November 2017, further solidifying its investment in digital innovation.

title: Waco: HOLT CAT buys shuttered Caterpillar Work Tools plant
summary: HOLT CAT, a Caterpillar equipment dealer, has announced an agreement to purchase Caterpillar's former Waco Work Tools plant. This acquisition includes 107 acres and over 170,000 square feet of manufacturing, warehouse, and office space, which HOLT CAT plans to repurpose for growth opportunities and to better serve customers in its territory. The acquisition aims to expand HOLT CAT's presence in the Waco region and is scheduled for completion later this year.

title: Georgia Logger Staying Busy Harvesting Weyerhaeuser Pine
summary: Joel Adams, owner of Pinetree Trail Enterprises in Nicholls, Georgia, primarily harvests pine for Weyerhaeuser, performing various thinning and harvesting operations. His company, equipped exclusively with Cat machinery, emphasizes strong relationships with Caterpillar and its dealer, Yancey Brothers, for service and support. Despite challenging wet conditions, the team maintains a high output, delivering to several regional mills, and Joel continues to operate daily with his family.

title: China weakness spreads far and wide, from Caterpillar to Nvidia
summary: Major US and European companies like Caterpillar, Nvidia, and Intel are reporting significant impacts from the slowing demand in China across various sectors, from industrial machinery and technology to automotive parts. While many industries are feeling the pinch, luxury goods and some consumer brands like Tiffany & Co. and Starbucks are, for now, experiencing continued growth, creating a mixed economic picture. The emerging trend suggests a broadening slowdown in China is affecting a diverse range of goods and services.

title: Caterpillar, Nvidia Warnings Send Wall Street Tumbling
summary: U.S. stocks tumbled following warnings from Caterpillar and Nvidia, which highlighted concerns about a slowing Chinese economy and the impact of tariffs on corporate profits. Caterpillar missed profit estimates due to softening demand in China and rising costs, while Nvidia cut its revenue forecast due to weak demand and lower data center sales. This sent major indexes like the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq Composite lower, despite overall positive earnings reports.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Building a freight rail future in Southwestern Oregon
summary: This article details the efforts by the Oregon International Port of Coos Bay and Stantec to revitalize the Coos Bay Rail Line in Southwestern Oregon. After the line was shuttered in 2007, it was acquired by the Port in 2011, leading to extensive inspections, repairs, and upgrades of its 121 bridges and other infrastructure. The project, supported by significant state and federal grants including a $20 million BUILD Grant, aims to ensure safe, reliable freight service, promote economic vitality, and reduce environmental impact in the region.

title: Fleets Eye Camera Systems to Replace Mirrors
summary: Fleets like Maverick Transportation and Schneider are testing camera monitor systems to replace traditional truck mirrors, with favorable reviews from drivers who appreciate improved visibility, especially in inclement weather and at night. Federal regulators have issued a five-year exemption for Stoneridge's MirrorEye system. The new technology is also expected to offer safety benefits, eliminate blind spots, and potentially improve fuel efficiency due to reduced aerodynamic drag.

title: Cramer Remix: 'It's too soon' to buy even this top-notch industrial stock
summary: Jim Cramer advises against buying Emerson Electric despite its quality, citing macroeconomic concerns like trade talks with China and oil prices. He also expressed frustration with hedge funds' influence on market swings based solely on oil prices and called for federal regulators to investigate rapid sell-offs like the one on Christmas Eve. Additionally, Cramer discussed backlash from his suggestion for Apple to acquire Epic Systems and gave his preferred fintech stocks: Mastercard, PayPal, and Visa.

title: Gulf Island delivers first of 10 tugs to Bay Houston Towing
summary: Gulf Island Shipyards has delivered the first of ten Z-Tech 30-80 terminal/escort tugs, the Mark E. Kuebler, to Bay Houston Towing Co. Designed by Robert Allan Ltd., this tug is powered by two Caterpillar 3516E Tier 4 diesel engines and is ABS classed. Gulf Island is currently constructing the nine sister vessels.

title: Zach Kauk, VP of Caterpillar's Excavation Division to leave
summary: Zach Kauk, vice president of Caterpillar’s Excavation Division, is leaving the company to pursue other opportunities. He will be replaced by Tom Frake, current vice president of Global Power Solutions Division, with both moves effective immediately. The article highlights Kauk's significant contributions and Frake's extensive experience within Caterpillar.

title: Caterpillar dealer retail sales up 20% in month of Nov.
summary: Caterpillar dealer retail sales in North America increased by 20% in November, marking the highest growth among all four regional markets and contributing to a 16% global increase. However, North American construction industries sales were up 13% for November, which is less than half of August's 30% increase. Caterpillar notes that this summary is based on unaudited dealer reports and is intended to show approximate trends, not to replace audited financial statements.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Changes
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced officer changes, with Zach Kauk, vice president of the Excavation Division, leaving the company. Tom Frake, current vice president of Global Power Solutions Division (GPSD), will replace Kauk, effective immediately. A replacement for Frake will be named soon.

title: North American Construction Group acquires 31 used ultraclass mining trucks from oil sands client
summary: North American Construction Group (NACG) has acquired 31 used ultra-class haul trucks through a long-term purchase arrangement with an existing oil sands client, representing the initial offering under a contract amendment granting NACG right of first refusal on retired assets. This acquisition includes sixteen 380-ton capacity trucks, a new size for NACG, and provides opportunities to meet growing customer demand and utilize their rebuild expertise in their new Acheson maintenance facility. The move aims to maintain low-cost operations and develop retail products for customers seeking alternatives to new asset purchases.

title: Caterpillar Announces New Responsibilities for Officers and Appointment of New Vice President
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced several changes in responsibilities for current vice presidents and appointed a new vice president, effective January 1, 2019. The company is restructuring its Services, Distribution and Digital (SD&D) segment to better support its global customer and dealer base. These changes include new roles for Raymond Chan, Phil Kelliher, Nigel Lewis, and Damien Giraud, along with the appointment of Jason Conklin as Vice President of Global Construction & Infrastructure Division.

title: Caterpillar Announces New Responsibilities for Officers and Appointment of New Vice President
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced several changes in responsibilities for current vice presidents and the appointment of a new vice president, effective January 1, 2019. These changes involve a restructuring of the company's distribution divisions and new leadership for the Global Aftermarket Solutions Division and Global Construction & Infrastructure Division. The moves are intended to better serve global customers and dealers and strengthen leadership in key segments.

title: Caterpillar Board of Directors Elects CEO Jim Umpleby as Chairman; Elects Dave Calhoun as Presiding Director
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced that its Board of Directors has elected CEO Jim Umpleby to the additional position of Chairman of the Board, effective immediately. Dave Calhoun, who previously served as non-executive Chairman, will remain on the Board as Presiding Director. Umpleby has been CEO since January 1, 2017.

title: Governor: Norfolk Southern moving headquarters to Atlanta
summary: Norfolk Southern Corp. is relocating its headquarters from Norfolk, Virginia, to Atlanta, bringing 850 jobs and over $500 million in economic investment to Georgia. Governor Nathan Deal announced this move, highlighting Atlanta's appeal as a transportation and innovation hub. This decision reflects a broader trend of companies moving to major cities for deeper talent pools and better amenities, though it represents a psychological rather than a significant economic loss for Norfolk.

title: Big machines in a sensor-filled world: Analytics and data at Caterpillar
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is investing heavily in connectivity and data management, leveraging analytics to derive insights for its diverse business units, customers, and dealers. With over 500,000 connected assets, the company uses sensor data for efficiency, safety, and operational improvements, including fatigue detection and drive-assist functionality. Caterpillar is also applying AI internally for virtual product development and is expanding its analytics focus beyond traditional areas to encompass marketing and customer interactions, aiming to be a greater enabler of enterprise strategy.

title: Pontiac Caterpillar plant celebrating 40 years
summary: The Caterpillar plant in Pontiac is celebrating 40 years of operation, having been acquired in January 1978. The facility, which currently employs about 1,300 people, has adapted to technological advancements, consolidated operations, and significantly contributed to the local community through employment, donations, and educational partnerships. To mark the milestone, a Family Day was held, attracting over 2,500 attendees and featuring plant tours, activities, and a display of Caterpillar machinery and a NASCAR race car.

title: Caterpillar attorney in tax and trade criminal case tapped by Trump for AG
summary: President Donald Trump has nominated William Barr, the lead attorney representing Caterpillar Inc. in a federal tax and trade criminal investigation, to be the next U.S. Attorney General. If confirmed, Barr would oversee the Department of Justice's ongoing investigation into one of his former prominent clients. The investigation stems from Caterpillar's controversial tax strategy involving a Swiss subsidiary, which has resulted in claims of $2.3 billion in back taxes.

title: Sempra’s ex-CEO joins Chevron BoD
summary: Debra Reed-Klages, former CEO of Sempra Energy, has been appointed to Chevron's board of directors, effective immediately. She will serve on the Management Compensation Committee and the Public Policy Committee. Reed-Klages brings extensive experience from her tenure at Sempra and her previous board positions at Caterpillar Inc. and Halliburton.

title: New Caterpillar D6 dozer adds unprecedented electric drive
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has introduced the D6 XE, a new dozer model featuring an electric drive system, which is claimed to be the world's first high drive electric drive dozer. This innovation offers up to 35 percent better fuel efficiency compared to its predecessor, with the company estimating the additional cost of the electric drive paying for itself in less than two years through fuel savings. The new D6 line also includes significant technology upgrades and improved fuel efficiency for the baseline model.

title: Caterpillar unveils more tech upgrades
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is enhancing its customer offerings in China by introducing a new smart watch and a dozen new excavators, showcasing technological advancements at the Bauma China International Trade Fair. The company aims to improve efficiency and sustainability for users, celebrating 40 years of China's reform and opening-up and upgrading its after-sales service. Despite a recent slowdown, the construction machinery industry is projected to see continued growth in 2019.

title: Caterpillar Expands Tier 4, Stage V Final Industrial Engine Range with New 9.3 L Offering
authors: Caterpillar Inc. - Industrial Engines & Power Systems
summary: Caterpillar has introduced a new Cat C9.3B engine, a 9.3 L, 6-cylinder industrial engine, expanding its Tier 4 and Stage V Final range. This new engine is 140 kg lighter than its predecessor and features a 39% smaller aftertreatment package, offering increased performance, improved fuel consumption, and exceptional starting capability in cold climates. It also provides flexible aftertreatment options including engine-mounted or remote-mounted systems.

title: Caterpillar Inc. - Industrial Engines & Power Systems
summary: This article provides an overview of Caterpillar Inc.'s Industrial Engines & Power Systems division, highlighting their range of industrial diesel and gas engines. It emphasizes the engines' reliability, durability, fuel efficiency, and low cost of ownership, noting the company's 75 years of experience in engine manufacturing. The content also lists various products and press releases, including new engine launches and updates.

title: The Story Nobody’s Telling About Our Robot Future: A Q&A with ROBO Global CIO Bill Studebaker
summary: This article features a Q&A with Bill Studebaker, CIO of ROBO Global, discussing the transformative impact of robotics and AI across industries. Studebaker argues that robots will create jobs and wealth, rather than destroy them, and highlights specific applications in manufacturing, logistics, construction, and agriculture. He also outlines ROBO Global's investment index focused on robotics and automation companies.

title: NYU Student Senators Introduce Divestment Resolution in Support of Palestinian Rights
summary: NYU student senators have introduced a divestment resolution calling on the university to cut ties with Lockheed Martin, General Electric, and Caterpillar Inc. due to their alleged roles in Palestinian human rights violations. The resolution, supported by over 50 student groups and 30 professors, aims to divest from U.S. corporations rather than the state of Israel. A vote is scheduled for December 6th, with specific safety measures in place due to potential harassment.

title: Caterpillar Produces 40,000th Large Dozer
summary: Caterpillar celebrated the production of its 40,000th large dozer, a D11T model, which was delivered to Teck Resources Limited in East Peoria, IL. This milestone highlights Caterpillar's long-standing innovation in track-type tractors and strong customer relationships, particularly with Teck, a major global customer for Cat large dozers. The D11T will be used in Teck's Elk Valley Region for steelmaking coal production, showcasing its efficiency and advanced technology.

title: Caterpillar move left behind 12,000 workers, but what's next?
summary: Caterpillar's 2017 decision to move its corporate headquarters from Peoria to Chicago left 12,000 employees in central Illinois, causing significant concern for the city. This move highlights larger shifts in U.S. manufacturing, as Caterpillar, once deeply tied to Peoria, has expanded globally and into new market segments, facing both challenges and recent successes. The article traces Caterpillar's history, its evolving relationship with Peoria, and the economic changes impacting the company and the region.

title: Teck takes delivery of 40,000th Caterpillar large dozer
summary: Caterpillar celebrated the delivery of its 40,000th large dozer, a D11T, to Teck Resources in a ceremony held in East Peoria, Illinois. This milestone highlights Caterpillar's long-standing innovation in track-type tractors and strong business relationships, particularly with Teck, which has been a top customer for over a decade. The new D11T will operate in Teck's Elk Valley mines in British Columbia, supporting steelmaking coal production.

title: See why Caterpillar changed its machine branding
summary: Caterpillar redesigned its machine branding, known as "Modern Hex," due to an expanding product line, increased technology integration, and competitor imitation of its previous "Power Edge" design. The new design, which features a prominent CAT logo and a 3D red hexagon, aims to communicate technology, adaptability, and a premium brand image across its diverse product range. This update builds upon a hexagon motif that has been evolving within Cat's design language since 2006.

title: Caterpillar investors fearful as US-China trade war drives up costs
summary: Caterpillar's investors are growing concerned as the US-China trade war drives up raw material costs and negatively impacts the company's outlook. Despite reporting better-than-expected third-quarter profits, shares fell due to an unchanged 2018 earnings forecast, signaling potential future slowdowns. The company plans to raise prices on its machines and engines to offset increased manufacturing costs due to tariffs and higher steel prices.

title: Caterpillar Has a Big 3Q, But Wall Street Senses Pessimism
summary: Caterpillar reported strong third-quarter earnings and revenue, exceeding most Wall Street expectations. However, company shares dropped significantly due to investor pessimism over its unchanged full-year outlook, even though the outlook was within analyst predictions. This reaction was compounded by a global stock market sell-off.

title: Caterpillar Inc | $CAT Stock | Rising Material Costs Overshadow Q3 Solid Earnings
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported stronger-than-expected third-quarter profits but saw its stock drop over 8% due to rising material costs from tariffs, amounting to approximately $40 million. The company plans to offset these costs by raising prices for its engines and machines by 1% to 4% in 2019. Despite the impact of tariffs, Caterpillar achieved its best-ever third-quarter profit per share, driven by robust sales growth across several regions.

title: Dow, hit by October blues, posts loss after Caterpillar, 3M offer worrisome forecasts
summary: The U.S. stock market experienced a significant drop in October, driven by disappointing outlooks from industrial giants Caterpillar and 3M, contributing to investor anxieties over trade disputes and rising interest rates. The Dow Jones industrial average and Nasdaq composite both saw losses, with the S&P 500 falling below its September high, despite strong corporate earnings for many companies, as investors remain cautious. Analysts are divided on whether the market dip is a temporary adjustment or a sign of a broader shift.

title: Fisker Inc. Announces Strategic Investment From Caterpillar Ventures
summary: Fisker Inc. announced a strategic investment from Caterpillar Venture Capital Inc., a subsidiary of Caterpillar Inc. The investment targets Fisker Inc.'s solid-state battery technology, which has potential applications across construction, energy storage, transportation, and mining industries. This collaboration highlights the growing importance of electrification solutions in diverse business sectors.

title: John Deere ranked among world's top 90 brands; but what's a name worth?
summary: John Deere has been ranked 88th among the world's most valuable brands by Interbrand, moving up four spots from the previous year. This recognition highlights the company's strong brand influence, financial performance, and customer loyalty. In Ireland, John Deere tractors account for 12,029 of the 79,674 agricultural tractors licensed for road use as of December 31, 2017.

title: New Caterpillar graphic a throwback to first crawler tractors
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is introducing a new graphic element to its branding, adding a three-dimensional hexagon grille outlined in red to its existing Cat name and yellow triangle logo. This new "Cat Modern Hex" design is a nod to the graphics used on the company's first crawler tractors in 1925 and aims to provide a premium look and feel. The company plans to implement this new design across all newly manufactured and refreshed products by 2020.

title: Heinricher Racing LLC Teams up with Caterpillar Inc. to Lead All Female Driver Lineup in the IMSA WeatherTech SportsCar Championship 2019
summary: Heinricher Racing LLC announced a partnership with Caterpillar Inc. to field an all-female driver lineup in the 2019 IMSA WeatherTech SportsCar Championship and Rolex 24 Hours At Daytona. The team will feature Jackie Heinricher, Katherine Legge, Simona De Silvestro, and Bia Figueiredo, competing in the No. 57 MSR Acura NSX GT3. This collaboration aims to promote diversity in racing and will also target the 87th running of the 24 Hours of Le Mans.

title: Astec Mobile Screens Expands Multi-Frequency Screen Offering From: KPI-JCI - Astec Mobile Screens
summary: Astec Mobile Screens has expanded its multi-frequency screen offering, building on the success of its GT205 model. The company will now provide multi-frequency technology for all of its 5-ft wide, two-deck screens, including the portable PTSC205 plant and GT145 track screen. This technology combines a conventional, two-bearing vibrator with a high-frequency vibrator on the bottom deck, resulting in increased G-force and the ability to process material with higher moisture content.

title: Peoria home to 12,000 Caterpillar workers
summary: This article details the historical relationship between Caterpillar and Peoria, Illinois, highlighting the company's growth from a local presence to an international powerhouse. It discusses the recent shift of Caterpillar's corporate headquarters from Peoria to Chicago while emphasizing that 12,000 employees remain in central Illinois. The piece also covers Caterpillar's evolving business strategies, financial performance, and impact on the region throughout various historical periods.

title: Caterpillar to Reveal Range of New Machines at Bauma China 2018
summary: Caterpillar announced it will display 30 machines, work tools, engines, and product support capabilities at Bauma CHINA 2018, featuring Cat general construction, building construction, paving, and SEM-branded equipment. The exhibition will introduce over a dozen Cat Next Generation hydraulic excavators and showcase technological advances aimed at reducing fuel consumption and increasing efficiency. Indoor and outdoor displays will allow visitors to experience the capabilities of Cat machines firsthand.

title: Digital Deals: Amazon backs prefab smart builder, Procore acquires BIManywhere
summary: This article details recent digital deals in the construction technology space, including Procore's acquisition of BIManywhere to enhance its VDC investments and Amazon's significant investment in Plant Prefab, a sustainable smart home builder. It also covers Guardhat's $20 million Series A funding for its smart safety hardhats and a partnership between PCL Construction and Microsoft to develop a cloud-based construction management app.

title: Boeing wins $9.2 billion Air Force contract to build training jets
summary: Boeing has been awarded a contract worth up to $9.2 billion by the U.S. Air Force to build new training jets, in partnership with Swedish company Saab. This contract will replace the Air Force's aging T-38C Talons with 351 new jets, simulators, and associated ground equipment, saving the Air Force an estimated $10 billion through competition. Boeing expects to deliver the first aircraft and simulators in 2023, with full operational capability by 2034.

title: Barron's 400 ETF Boosts Exposure to These Sectors
summary: The Barron’s 400 ETF (BFOR) recently completed its semi-annual rebalance, increasing its exposure to the Consumer Discretionary, Energy, and Materials sectors. New additions to its underlying index include Visa and Intel, while Verizon and Boeing were among the deletions. Financial services and industrials continue to be the largest sector weights within the ETF.

title: Caterpillar leans on old playbook to cope with Trump tariffs
summary: Caterpillar is using a cost-cutting strategy, initiated over two years ago, to mitigate the financial impact of U.S. tariffs on imported aluminum and steel. This strategy involves increasing operational efficiency, such as running factories on fewer shifts with fewer employees and redesigning products with fewer parts, to offset rising raw material costs and maintain profitability. The company expects tariffs to inflate raw material costs by up to $200 million and is implementing price increases and general cost-cutting measures.

title: Caterpillar Announces Plan To Sell Smithfield Parts Distribution Center
summary: Caterpillar, Inc. has announced a preliminary agreement to sell its Cat® purpose-built forestry business to Weiler, Inc., with the sale expected to close by early 2019. This sale includes the manufacturing plant and warehouse in LaGrange, Georgia, a training center in Auburn, Alabama, and the legacy Prentice parts distribution center in Smithfield, North Carolina. Approximately 270 employees supporting the purpose-built forestry business are anticipated to retain employment with Weiler.

title: Cat footwear introduces ExcavatorXL work boots
summary: Cat Footwear has launched the new Excavator XL line of safety boots, marking the tenth anniversary of its SuperDuty iTechnology. These boots build on the original iTechnology's blend of durability and athletic comfort, incorporating new features like an EaseHD footbed, a rubber bumper on the toe box, and an extended contoured last for enhanced comfort and performance. The ExcavatorXL series, available in various styles, aims to provide Earthmovers with a robust and comfortable work boot.

title: Caterpillar adds two new utility vehicle models
summary: Caterpillar is expanding its line of utility vehicles with two new models, the CUV85 and CUV105 D, both featuring an extra row of seating to accommodate up to five occupants. These new models build on existing platforms with gas and diesel engine options, and offer 1,000 pounds of cargo capacity and 2,000 pounds of towing capacity. The vehicles will be available through Caterpillar's dealer network in the U.S. and Canada, excluding California and Quebec, and offer over 50 accessory options for customization.

title: Indiana-based Cummins recalls 500,000 trucks over faulty system releasing excess pollution
summary: Cummins Inc. is voluntarily recalling nearly 500,000 medium- and heavy-duty trucks from 2010-2015 due to a faulty emissions control system that caused the excess release of nitrogen oxide. This recall, the largest voluntary truck emissions recall to date, resulted from testing by the California Air Resources Board and does not involve illegal "defeat devices" similar to the Volkswagen scandal. Cummins will cover the cost of repairs, estimated at $181 million, with repairs to be conducted in two phases beginning in August 2018.

title: TRUCKS: Cat articulated truck production reaches 50,000 units
summary: Caterpillar announced a significant milestone with the production and delivery of its 50,000th articulated truck from its Peterlee, U.K. facility. Since manufacturing began in 1985, Caterpillar has become a leader in articulated truck design. The 50,000th unit was received by Trader Construction Company, a long-standing customer of Caterpillar.

title: Southern half of South Milwaukee Caterpillar site sold for $13.5 million
summary: The southern portion of the Caterpillar Inc. campus in South Milwaukee was sold to Reich Brothers Holdings LLC for $13.5 million. Reich Brothers, specializing in industrial campuses, aims to revitalize the 32.5-acre property once Caterpillar vacates it by the end of 2018. This transaction involved Colliers International | Wisconsin representing the seller and The Dickman Co. Inc. representing the buyer, with the purchase price reduced due to Caterpillar's decision to relocate.

title: GE Stays on Track by Rebuilding Locomotives
summary: General Electric Transportation is increasingly focusing on remanufacturing locomotives at its Fort Worth, TX, facility, a strategy that helps combat the cyclical demand for new machines. This modernization program transforms old locomotives into modern ones with cutting-edge technology, offering benefits such as improved fuel efficiency, reduced maintenance costs, and increased reliability for customers like Norfolk Southern Corp. The plant uses flexible assembly lines and lean manufacturing principles to handle both new builds and rebuilds, extending the service life of existing assets for several more decades.

title: Former Bucyrus campus in South Milwaukee sold, revitalization planned
summary: New York investors Reich Brothers LLC acquired the large office and manufacturing campus in South Milwaukee, previously leased by Caterpillar Inc., for $13.27 million. The sale comes with plans to revitalize and refill the campus after Caterpillar vacates the premises. This acquisition marks a significant step towards the redevelopment of the former Bucyrus campus.

title: Caterpillar’s stock falls as warning of peak earnings proved false
summary: Caterpillar Inc.'s stock fell despite higher-than-expected second-quarter adjusted earnings per share, which rose from both the previous year and quarter. This performance contradicted a projection by former CFO Brad Halverson who had stated in April that adjusted profit per share had peaked. The company's shares initially gained significantly but pared those gains by afternoon trading.

title: Caterpillar to raise prices due to Trump tariffs on aluminum and steel
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced it will raise prices on its products to offset increased material costs from the Trump administration's tariffs on aluminum and steel imports. The company estimates these tariffs will add between $100 million and $200 million in extra material costs.
