This decision follows other major companies like Harley Davidson, Coca-Cola Co., and BMW also announcing price increases or production changes due to the ongoing trade disputes.

title: Tariffs will cost Caterpillar $200 million, so it's going to raise its prices
summary: Caterpillar announced that recently imposed tariffs are expected to cost the company between $100 million and $200 million in the second half of the year. To offset these costs, the company plans to implement mid-year price increases. Despite the tariff impact, Caterpillar raised its full-year earnings forecast, indicating confidence in its ability to manage these increased expenses through pricing power and operational efficiency.

title: Caterpillar | $CAT Stock | Shares Pop On Q2 Earnings & Rosy Full-Year Guidance
summary: Caterpillar's shares rallied after reporting upbeat second-quarter earnings and raising its full-year guidance. The company surpassed analyst expectations on both net income and net sales, driven by strong performance in its Construction Industries and Energy and Transportation segments. Caterpillar also plans to increase product prices to offset impending tariffs.

title: Caterpillar warns of steel tariff impact but reports upbeat earnings
summary: Caterpillar warned that steel tariffs would increase material costs by $100 million to $200 million in the second half of the year but still reported upbeat second-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street forecasts. The company expects to offset the tariff impact and supply chain challenges through previously announced price increases and raised its profit per share outlook for the year. This follows similar warnings from other U.S. manufacturers like General Motors and Ford regarding the financial impact of tariffs.

title: Demo of Cat material handler provides SA Recycling with opportunity to make the right equipment investment for feeder yards
summary: SA Recycling tested a new Caterpillar MH3026 material handler at its Las Vegas Western Yard, providing a crucial opportunity to assess its suitability for their feeder operations. The demo allowed their operators to experience the machine's capabilities, including its speed, fuel efficiency, and safety features, directly in their working environment. This successful trial led SA Recycling to purchase the MH3026 for their Alabama yard, highlighting the value of on-site demonstrations for making informed equipment investments.

title: Caterpillar bearish ‘death cross’ pattern ends longest bullish streak in decades
summary: Caterpillar Inc.'s stock experienced a "death cross" pattern on Tuesday, marking the end of its longest bullish trend-following streak in at least 46 years. This technical indicator occurred as the 50-day moving average fell below the 200-day moving average, adding to the growing list of bearish technical patterns for the company. The stock rose 0.6% on the day, but not enough to prevent the significant technical shift.

title: Caterpillar Expands HIV PrEP Coverage Amidst Questions About Insurance Denials
summary: Caterpillar Inc. faced scrutiny and a potential backlash after an employee, Lance, found his HIV PrEP medication coverage denied by the company's insurance provider, despite moving to a state known for progressive healthcare. The company initially only covered Truvada for HIV treatment or emergency post-exposure, but under pressure, announced an expanded coverage policy to include PrEP for its U.S. workforce, effective August 1. This incident highlights ongoing challenges in PrEP access and corporate responsibility in healthcare.

title: Caterpillar to add 250-plus jobs at North Little Rock plant
summary: Caterpillar announced a $40 million investment in its North Little Rock plant, creating over 250 new jobs as part of an expansion to manufacture paving equipment. This expansion will bring the plant's total workforce to approximately 775 people and comes amidst a growing statewide manufacturing sector, despite some regional decline and broader concerns about tariffs affecting Caterpillar's stock.

title: In North Little Rock, Caterpillar Will Add More Products, Hire 250 People
summary: Caterpillar Inc. plans to expand its North Little Rock plant by adding production of two new paving products, cold planers and rotary mixers, over the next two years. This expansion involves a $40 million investment from 2017 to 2020 and the hiring of 250 new workers. The plant currently employs about 515 people and will be seeking assemblers, welders, mechanics, machinists, fork truck drivers, and order pickers with starting wages between $13.50 and $20 per hour.

title: Cat Racing team had 'humble beginnings' in truck engine group initiative
summary: The Cat Racing team's entry into racing began not with executive ambition, but from a "maverick" initiative within Caterpillar's truck engine group in 1991. What started with small logos on race cars quickly grew into expanded sponsorships, particularly in NASCAR, driven by strong dealer and customer engagement. This grassroots effort proved to be a highly effective and cost-efficient marketing strategy for Caterpillar.

title: Canadian Pacific Orders 30 Upgraded EMD SD70ACU Locomotives from Progress Rail
summary: Canadian Pacific (CP) has ordered 30 upgraded EMD SD70ACU locomotives from Progress Rail, a subsidiary of Caterpillar Inc., for heavy haulage. These modernised SD90MACs will feature new traction control systems, cabs adhering to safety standards, and remanufactured EMD 710 engines for optimal performance. Deliveries are scheduled for 2019, with upgrades performed at Progress Rail facilities in Kentucky and Indiana.

title: Suppliers & Potential Supplier Resources
summary: Caterpillar's supplier resources page outlines the company's high standards for specifications, delivery, and price for its suppliers. It provides guidelines for supplier communications and directs potential suppliers to a review process for registration. The page serves as a central hub for current and prospective partners to understand Caterpillar's expectations and engagement procedures.

title: Caterpillar buildings in South Milwaukee being sold to New York firm
summary: Nearly 30 acres of Caterpillar Inc. manufacturing space in South Milwaukee, including factory buildings and offices, are being sold to Reich Brothers LLC, a New York firm specializing in industrial facilities. Reich Brothers plans to finalize the deal within weeks, though specific plans for the property remain fluid. Caterpillar's mining equipment operations in South Milwaukee have seen significant scaling back and layoffs in recent years.

title: Caterpillar hums as oil patch recovery continues (slideshow) (Video)
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is experiencing increased orders as the oil and natural gas industry recovers. An employee at the company's plant in Seguin is featured working on an engine. This indicates a positive outlook for Caterpillar amidst the ongoing recovery in the energy sector.

title: Tariff winners and losers: How Trump's trade spat could affect shoppers
summary: President Trump's imposition of tariffs on imported steel and aluminum is expected to impact consumer prices and company profits, leading to both winners and losers in various industries. American steel and aluminum producers are poised to benefit, while industries like whiskey, motorcycles, and drinks using aluminum cans face potential cost increases and retaliatory tariffs from other countries. The market reacted negatively, with the Dow Jones industrial average falling, as investors fear a trade war could crimp profits of companies and raise consumer prices.

title: Caterpillar to bring 125 new jobs to Greater Lafayette
summary: Caterpillar Inc. of Lafayette plans to create 125 new high-paying jobs in the Greater Lafayette area by renovating its current facilities. The company intends to invest $73.6 million through 2021 in facility improvements, IT software, and machinery at its 3701 South Street site. This investment is tied to a proposed 10-year tax abatement and is expected to bring jobs with an average full-time hourly wage of $27.95.

title: Caterpillar considers temporary offices for South Milwaukee workers
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is reportedly considering temporary offices for its workers in South Milwaukee as a developer shows interest in the buildings the company is vacating. This move comes amidst previous reports of potential job cuts and the company's shedding of facilities in the area. The South Milwaukee mayor had previously suggested the Caterpillar site for Foxconn.

title: This billion-dollar firm almost moved to DFW. Here's why it didn't
summary: HOLT CAT, a billion-dollar firm, considered moving its headquarters to DFW 30 to 40 years ago due to territorial factors. However, the move never materialized, leaving their base elsewhere. The CEO, Peter John Holt, discussed the reasons behind not relocating to Dallas-Fort Worth despite its potential benefits.

title: Leaner and meaner: Cummins readies the X12 engine for the road
summary: Cummins is preparing its X12 engine for market, targeting regional haul and vocational applications with its lighter design and integrated Endurant transmission. This engine, weighing 800 lbs less than the X15, focuses on optimizing fuel efficiency and performance through deep integration with Eaton Cummins Automated Transmission Technologies. Cummins emphasizes offering a power-agnostic approach to technology, providing the right solution for various customer needs from diesel to electric powertrains.

title: Caterpillar Names New Chief Financial Officer
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the appointment of Andrew Bonfield as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective September 1, 2018, following an extensive global search. Bonfield, with over three decades of financial expertise, will succeed Brad Halverson. Joe Creed, Vice President of the Finance Services Division, has been named interim CFO until Bonfield assumes the role.

title: Caterpillar Names National Grid Executive as New CFO
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has announced the appointment of Andrew Bonfield, the current CFO of National Grid PLC, as its new Chief Financial Officer. Mr. Bonfield is slated to begin his new role in September, succeeding Brad Halverson, who retires effective Friday. This move brings an executive from a U.K. multinational utility company to the heavy equipment manufacturer.

title: Caterpillar taps Andrew Bonfield for CFO post
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has appointed Andrew Bonfield as its new chief financial officer, following the retirement of Brad Halverson. Bonfield previously served as a CFO for National Grid plc, Cadbury, and Bristol-Myers Squibb, bringing extensive global financial experience. He will assume the role on September 1, with Joe Creed serving as interim CFO until then.

title: Caterpillar Announces New Industrial Power Systems Division Vice President
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has appointed Steve Ferguson as the new vice president of its Industrial Power Systems Division (IPSD), effective June 1, 2018. Ferguson replaces Ramin Younessi, who was promoted to group president of the Energy & Transportation segment. Ferguson will oversee operations for engines 18 liters and below, retail generators, and Caterpillar Defense, bringing extensive experience in lean manufacturing and financial management to the role.

title: Caterpillar Helps Customers Build a Better World
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has released its 2017 Annual Report and Sustainability Report, showcasing how the company helps customers improve living standards globally through infrastructure and energy development, economic growth, and environmental protection. The reports highlight strong business performance, including profit improvement and dividend prioritization, and emphasize the company's commitment to sustainable progress through remanufacturing, innovative customer support, and community involvement via the Caterpillar Foundation. Caterpillar's strategy focuses on long-term profitable growth, operational excellence, and providing solutions that make safe, productive, and efficient use of resources.

title: Caterpillar CEO rewarded for turnaround
summary: Caterpillar CEO Jim Umpleby received a $14 million compensation package, including a $1,070,000 cash bonus, for his "superior performance" in 2017, leading the company to an 18 percent revenue increase and doubled adjusted earnings per share. His total compensation was 213 times the median annual total compensation of all Caterpillar employees, sparking discussion about CEO-to-worker pay ratios as mandated by the Dodd-Frank Act. The article also notes an increase in Umpleby's base salary and a cash payment to outgoing CFO Brad Halverson, while omitting mention of an ongoing criminal investigation.

title: Caterpillar EU Stage V Engines Set High Standards
summary: Caterpillar is developing a full line of EU Stage V-compliant engines, emphasizing simplified design, improved performance, and reduced installation complexity. The Cat C9.3B engine has already received EU Stage V emissions certification ahead of regulatory requirements, offering increased power, torque, and fuel efficiency with a compact after-treatment system. Caterpillar is also certifying its larger engines and plans to offer dual-label certification for global flexibility.

title: Caterpillar Stock Whipsaws After Commentary Outweighs Guidance
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (CAT) shares experienced significant volatility, initially rising after reporting record first-quarter profits but then falling sharply due to management's commentary indicating that the first quarter was a "high water mark for the year." Despite strong Q1 revenue and earnings exceeding estimates, and an increased profit outlook for 2018, the stock's technical indicators suggest potential further downside.

title: Caterpillar earnings: Fears of trade-war impact appear overdone
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is expected to report strong first-quarter results, potentially extending its earnings-beat streak to eight quarters, according to Morgan Stanley. This comes despite its stock's recent underperformance compared to the broader industrial sector and the Dow Jones Industrial Average. The upcoming earnings report will offer the company an opportunity to reassure investors that its fundamental outlook remains bullish, despite recent market jitters.

title: Caterpillar Inc. Earnings: What to Watch
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is set to report its first-quarter earnings, which are anticipated to offer insights into the global economic recovery. The company's stock has seen a 2% decline this year following a strong performance in 2017. Investors will be watching the earnings report for clues on the economic recovery's momentum.

title: Caterpillar displays latest material handler, wheel loader, grapple and shears at ISRI
summary: Caterpillar showcased its latest material handler, wheel loader, grapples, and mobile shears at the ISRI 2018 conference, all specifically designed for scrap and recycling applications. The new MH 3026 material handler features refinements for industrial applications, focusing on enhanced performance, versatility, and safety. Additionally, the company introduced new GSH425/525 grapples with improved material penetration and efficiency, and S2000/S3000 Series mobile shears offering faster cycle times and robust designs for demolition and scrap.

title: Caterpillar Announces Executive Officer Changes
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced executive officer changes, effective June 1, 2018, following Group President Rob Charter's retirement. Bob De Lange will move to Customer & Dealer Support, Tom Pellette will lead Construction Industries, and Ramin Younessi has been appointed Group President of Energy & Transportation. These changes aim to leverage the executives' diverse experiences and leadership.

title: Caterpillar Announces Executive Office Changes
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced executive office changes following Group President Rob Charter's retirement. Bob De Lange will move to Customer & Dealer Support, Tom Pellette will lead Construction Industries, and Ramin Younessi has been appointed Group President of Energy & Transportation. These changes are effective June 1, 2018.

title: Army shows off next-level tech at Fort Leonard Wood
summary: The U.S. Army demonstrated three experimental technologies at Fort Leonard Wood: a 3-D concrete printer named ACES, C-SIRP drones for chemical detection, and FARO Focus Laser Scanners for detailed 3-D mapping. These technologies are part of a program to involve service members in development, aiming for greater efficiency and cost savings in modernizing military capabilities. The goal is to rapidly field innovative solutions that reduce risk to human life and enhance battlefield intelligence.

title: Caterpillar chief engineer to discuss safety and productivity changes in mining
summary: Michael Murphy, chief engineer in Caterpillar Inc.’s Surface and Mining Technology division, will deliver the 2018 G. Albert Shoemaker Lecture in Mineral Engineering on April 13, 2018, at Penn State University. His lecture will focus on how digital and automation technologies are driving significant changes in safety and productivity within the mining industry. Murphy brings 39 years of experience with Caterpillar, where he has been instrumental in developing high-precision GPS technology and automation strategies for mining machinery.

title: Caterpillar Announces Executive Officer Retirement
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the retirement of Group President Rob Charter, effective June 1, 2018, after a nearly 30-year career with the company. Charter, who led Customer & Dealer Support, was recognized for his global perspective and commitment to customer success and employee development. His replacement is expected to be announced soon, as Charter plans to return to Australia with his family.

title: Titan ACT wheel now available in expanded size range
summary: Titan International, Inc. has expanded its Accelerated Change Technology (ACT) wheel line with three new sizes (33-, 35-, and 49-inch), in addition to the existing 51-, 57- and 63-inch options. The ACT wheel is designed to reduce downtime for tire changes by up to 50% and is compatible with any brand of off-the-road tires. A recent test demonstrated that using ACT wheels could lead to over $80,000 in additional coal production per year per truck due to reduced maintenance time.

title: 'Wait and see'? Lafayette manufacturers evaluate tariffs' impact
summary: Lafayette manufacturers are cautiously evaluating the impact of President Trump's steel and aluminum tariffs. While many publicly adopt a "wait and see" approach, experts warn of potential significant negative effects on local businesses and the Greater Lafayette economy, which is heavily reliant on exports. Companies like Wabash National, Oerlikon Fairfield, Subaru of Indiana Automotive, and Caterpillar largely use domestically sourced materials, potentially mitigating immediate impacts, but professors suggest domestic prices will also rise.

title: Caterpillar reportedly to close Texas facility
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is reportedly planning to close facilities in Waco, Texas, and Panama, and is considering closing an additional plant in Illinois. This move comes as the company continues to adjust its operational footprint.

title: Caterpillar moves Texas factory's work to Kansas
summary: Caterpillar is relocating its Work Tools manufacturing facility from Waco, Texas, to Wamego, Kansas. This move will result in the Waco plant's closure and additional work being transferred to the existing Caterpillar plant in Wamego.

title: Here’s what the 30 Dow industrials companies say about a potential trade war
summary: This article discusses the stance of the 30 Dow industrials companies regarding a potential trade war following President Trump's announcement of steel and aluminum tariffs. It highlights that 22 of the 30 CEOs are members of the Business Roundtable, which opposes Trump's tariff scheme. The article also touches upon Trump's attempt to reassure investors by stating that "trade wars are good, and easy to win."

title: Caterpillar will close Waco Work Tools facility, slashing roughly 200 jobs
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced it will close its Waco Work Tools facility by the end of 2018, resulting in the elimination of approximately 200 local Caterpillar and contract positions. The manufacturing of products like buckets, couplers, and hammers will be relocated to an existing facility in Wamego, Kansas, and outsourced to external suppliers. This decision aims to optimize manufacturing operations and maintain product competitiveness in the global market, though it will not impact a separate Caterpillar distribution center also located in Waco.

title: Caterpillar to close Waco Work Tools facility
summary: Caterpillar, Inc. announced plans to close its Work Tools facility in Waco, Texas, by the end of 2018, impacting nearly 200 workers. The production of buckets, couplers, and hammers will be relocated to a Caterpillar facility in Wamego, Kansas, and external suppliers, aimed at optimizing manufacturing operations and maintaining competitiveness in the global market. This closure does not affect Caterpillar's Waco distribution center.

title: P&Q Hall of Fame Profile: C. Howard ‘Ward’ Nye
summary: This article profiles C. Howard "Ward" Nye, a key figure in the construction materials industry and leader of Martin Marietta Materials Inc. It details his influential roles with the National Stone, Sand & Gravel Association (NSSGA) and American Road & Transportation Builders Association (ARTBA), his career trajectory from Hanson Aggregates to CEO of Martin Marietta, and his vision for the industry's future amidst economic recoveries and infrastructure needs.

title: 3M agrees to $850M settlement in chemical disposal lawsuit
summary: 3M has agreed to an $850 million settlement with the state of Minnesota over a lawsuit concerning chemical disposal, specifically perfluorochemicals used in products like Scotchgard. The company, however, maintains it is not admitting to a public health issue. The state intends to use the settlement funds to clean up and safeguard drinking water in the eastern suburbs of St. Paul, while 3M faces at least two dozen similar lawsuits nationwide.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Appointment
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the appointment of Tony Fassino as a company vice president, effective March 1, 2018. Fassino will lead Caterpillar’s Building Construction Products (BCP) Division, replacing Ken Hoefling. He brings over 20 years of experience with Caterpillar, primarily in marketing and dealer support roles, and holds bachelor's and master's degrees in mechanical engineering from Bradley University.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Departure
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced that Ken Hoefling, vice president of the Building Construction Products Division, is leaving the company for other opportunities. Bob De Lange, group president of Construction Industries, thanked Hoefling for his service. A replacement for Hoefling, who began his career at Caterpillar in 1990, will be named soon.

title: Workers restart their careers in a market where jobs, pay are often in flux
summary: This article examines how individuals are navigating a fluctuating job market in Wisconsin, characterized by plant closures and shifting opportunities. It highlights stories of laid-off workers successfully transitioning into new careers, while also discussing the challenges faced by others and the debate surrounding the impact of corporate tax cuts on job creation. Companies like Kimberly-Clark, Harley-Davidson, and Badger Meter are featured, illustrating various responses to economic changes and tax legislation.

title: Cat dealers unite: Foley Inc., of N.J. acquires Giles & Ransome of Penn.
summary: Foley, Inc., a Caterpillar dealer based in Piscataway, New Jersey, has acquired Giles & Ransome, Inc., another Caterpillar dealer headquartered in Bensalem, Pennsylvania. This acquisition combines two dealerships with a total of 160 years of industry experience, expanding Foley Cat's territory into northern New Jersey, the Delaware Valley, southern New Jersey, and northern Delaware. The companies emphasize that the transition will be seamless for customers, who often already did business with both dealerships.

title: [VIDEO] How Vulcan Materials Company Puts the Cat 988K XE Wheel Loader to Work
summary: This article features a video showcasing how Vulcan Materials Company utilizes the Cat 988K XE electric drive wheel loader. The customer highlights increased fuel efficiency, improved uptime, and overall operational enhancements experienced with the new equipment.

title: Foley Inc. Acquires Ransome Cat
summary: Foley Inc. has acquired substantially all assets of Giles & Ransome, Inc., expanding Foley CAT's territory across Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and Delaware. The acquisition combines two Caterpillar dealers with a rich history, aiming to enhance customer service and productivity for a larger, unified customer base. Both companies anticipate a seamless transition for customers, many of whom previously worked with both dealerships.

title: One year later, Peoria progresses after Caterpillar headquarters announcement
summary: One year after Caterpillar Inc. announced it would move its global headquarters out of Peoria, the city is showing signs of progress and stability. While the announcement initially created concerns about real estate and economic impact, initiatives like Caterpillar's housing incentive program and OSF HealthCare's new ministry headquarters project are revitalizing Downtown Peoria and instilling consumer confidence. The article details how the community has adapted and begun to rebound, with thousands of Caterpillar employees remaining local and new development plans emerging.

title: Caterpillar Announces Officer Retirement; Consolidation of Functions
summary: Caterpillar Inc. announced the retirement of Frank Crespo, Vice President of the Global Supply Network Division, effective February 1, 2018. In conjunction with his retirement, the Global Supply Network Division (GSND) will be consolidated into existing divisions within the company. Crespo was recognized for his commitment and contributions to procurement processes and customer commitments since joining Caterpillar in 2010.

title: Caterpillar Posts $1.3 Billion Loss After Tax Reform
summary: Caterpillar Inc. reported a $1.3 billion loss in its fourth quarter due to a $2.4 billion tax-related charge from tax reform. Despite the loss, the company's adjusted earnings of $2.16 per share surpassed analyst estimates. Caterpillar also saw significant revenue growth and expects strong full-year adjusted earnings.

title: FleetPride
summary: FleetPride, a leading distributor of heavy-duty truck and trailer parts, partnered with IBM and Cresco International to transform its supply chain management through advanced analytics. By implementing IBM Analytics solutions like Cognos Analytics, SPSS Modeler, and ILOG CPLEX Optimization Studio, FleetPride has optimized distribution networks, accelerated inventory movement, and reduced errors, leading to significant improvements in efficiency and customer service. This data-driven approach helps FleetPride ensure timely delivery of parts nationwide, strengthening its market position.

title: Caterpillar Inc. | $CAT Stock | Shares Gain Following Q4 Earnings Beat
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (NYSE: CAT) saw its shares gain in premarket trading after reporting strong Q4 2017 results, exceeding analyst expectations for both earnings per share and sales. The company also issued upbeat full-year adjusted EPS guidance. Technical analysis indicated a significant gap up, pushing shares to new yearly highs.

title: Caterpillar pays quite a haul for Nashville finance HQ
summary: Caterpillar Financial Services Corp. purchased its 312,500-square-foot headquarters building in Midtown Nashville for $90.9 million in January 2018. The company's financial division had previously been leasing the building on West End Avenue for its operations. This acquisition solidifies Caterpillar's presence in Nashville for its financial headquarters.

title: Caterpillar Partnering to Develop Downtown Peoria Block
summary: Caterpillar Inc. and OSF HealthCare are partnering to redevelop an iconic Peoria building at 124 SW Adams Street into OSF HealthCare's new Ministry headquarters. Caterpillar is also donating the Peoria Professional Building, an adjacent parking lot, and $3 million to OSF for additional development. This partnership aims to revitalize downtown Peoria, attract and retain talent, and is expected to bring over 700 OSF employees to the downtown area once completed.

title: Caterpillar consolidating South Milwaukee operations by end of 2018
summary: Caterpillar Inc. is consolidating its South Milwaukee operations to facilities north of Rawson Avenue by the end of 2018, according to spokeswoman Lisa Miller. This move will not impact employment at this time, though the company previously announced plans to move up to 200 engineering jobs to Arizona. City officials are actively working on redevelopment plans for the 32.5 acres south of Rawson Avenue that Caterpillar will vacate, which is currently owned by One Liberty Properties Inc. and was listed for sale at $15 million.

title: Caterpillar consolidating all operations in South Milwaukee north of Rawson Avenue
summary: Caterpillar, Inc. is consolidating its South Milwaukee operations by closing all facilities south of Rawson Avenue and moving them to its owned campus north of Rawson Avenue. This move is expected to be completed by the end of the year and will not impact employment. The 32-acre property south of Rawson Avenue, formerly a Bucyrus facility, is for sale, and the city is actively planning for its future use.

title: Countdown to Human-Free Construction in Less Than 10 Years
summary: This article forecasts a future of highly automated construction, predicting human-free job sites within a decade due to accelerating sensor and software technology. It outlines a timeline from 2018 to 2025, detailing the integration of SaaS, IoT, AR, pre-fab construction, 3D printing, drones, and AI. The author also discusses the impending labor displacement and the need for immediate conversations about automation's societal impact.

title: Caterpillar officially names Deerfield its headquarters
summary: Caterpillar Inc. has officially named Deerfield, Illinois, as its new headquarters, nearly one year after announcing its intention to move top executive offices from Peoria. This change was formalized in an SEC filing in early January, listing the company's new primary executive address. The relocation coincides with a strong business rebound for Caterpillar in 2017, with its stock price reaching record highs.

title: Biggest Dow winners and losers in 2017: Boeing soars to record levels, GE slumps
summary: Boeing Co. significantly outperformed other companies in the Dow Jones Industrial Average in 2017, achieving an 89.4% stock price surge. This gain surpassed tech giants like the FAANG stocks and even fellow industrial company Caterpillar Inc., which saw a 69.9% gain. General Electric (GE) on the other hand, slumped in comparison
